loans.name: Mapingo Group

texts.en:
Hilda is a woman aged 42, married with eight children. She owns a shop in which she sells different kinds of clothing. Hilda buys her clothes from Tanzania which is a neighboring country to Malawi. She runs this business in order to financially support her family and to improve her living standards.

 Hilda has already received and repaid seven short-term loans from the Microloan Foundation. She requested another loan in order to expand her business. She will also use the loan to send her children to school as they dropped out due to lack of school fees. She plans to hire someone to assist her in running her business and hopes to buy a plot of land for her family. Accessing loans has helped her to have adequate food in her household.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a weaver from Peru who specializes in alpaca apparel and accessories. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool.

Alberto has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"I feel very proud to be able to contribute to the development of my country as I work with more than 20 artisan associations," explains Alberto from Peru. "Working on traditional hand looms, their craftsmanship is impeccable, and of the quality required by the international market. We want to preserve the traditions that began hundreds of years ago during the days of the Inca Empire."

"With this microcredit I will be able to purchase alpaca wool in bulk and greatly increase the number of units I have available for sale."

Use the link below to view Alberto's alpaca apparel and accessories on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/7484">http://www.novica.com/kiva/7484

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool for weaving traditional designs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 53, is a mother of five children.

She engages in a fish-vending business. The nature of her business is to buy fish and sell it to the market in her stall. 

She wants to give her family a better living so she aims to increase her income. To make it happen she decided to avail a loan to buy more fish to sell so that she can generate more income.

Jocelyn wants for the future to buy her own fishing net for fishing.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marvorid

texts.en:
Marvorid is a hardworking woman. She was born in a family of farmers in 1983. She is living in the northern part of Tajikistan with her family. She is married and has two children. 

When she was a child she was taught how to keep livestock by her father. She is a responsible, honest and bright person. 

From 2000 to 2005 there were hard times in her family and Marvorid helped her parents to care for the livestock. Each day she and her brother led livestock to pasture for feeding. She also milked the livestock for home use and to sell to dairy stores. She saved up money from this activity and used the money for flour to bake bread. 

After such challenges and experience, Marvorid has the aim to do her best and succeed in business in order to ensure her children and family the  necessary things. She is asking a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy livestock and continue her business. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock and continue her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband, to be able to buy basic needs

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari  is married with two school going children. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap around cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passers by. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en:
Batoul is a 21-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. 

She has been working at her house in vending clothing to help her family to meet the needs of life. She is a talented and has worked in this type of business for three years. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. 

To better develop her work, Batoul is requesting a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will be using the loan to buy a new collection in order to improve her business and thus her income.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare a stall for selling soft drinks at the city center.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of cloth materials for making clothes

loans.name: 31 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nhung operates a food stall/restaurant selling noodles. She is requesting a loan to purchase more material to cook noodles for sale.

Nhung is 25 years old and she is married with 1 child.  Nhung is the group leader of the 31 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

This is Nhung first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  She has been involved in this business for 2 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to cook noodles for sale and for her family to be healthy and happy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase certified seeds of maize and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bananas for sale in the market, so as to meet demands of their clients and those of the family.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina, age 58, lives in a very small town of Lahore with her five children .Sakina is a housewife and also works as a maid in a house in the city to make more money for her family.

Her son is also willing to take on some of the family responsibilities as he is very hardworking person. He wants to serve her by participating economically.and for that Sakina has applied for the loan so her son could buy a cow for the production of milk and then grow his business in the future.

Sakina thanks the Kiva team and BRAC for the light of hope given by them.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and  fortified fertilizers for a high yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming through purchasing additional certified fertilizers and seedlings for crop productivity

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman and owns a house that has no piped water or electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Saumu has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 25,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase trees for felling and making timber as well as other wood items for sale in the market and to open his own timber yard in the future

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 44 years old. She is married and blessed with six children. 

Sarah has had a maize farming business for 10 years. She will be using the loan to purchase to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds and hopes this will help her to educate her children to university level. 

This is her 6th loan with VisionFund Kenya, after successfully repaying her previous loans.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to purchase a one-acre parcel of land for dairy farming.

loans.use: to purchase to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds

loans.name: Martha Lucía

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 59 años de edad, ella es casada, vive con su esposo con el cual tuvieron 4 hijos todos ellos adolescentes, ella es muy amorosa, sacrifico muchas cosas en su vida para poder dedicarse a sus hijos y su marido, ella tenía un pensamiento de estudiar, salir adelante, pero no se arrepiente de nada.
Estando en su casa encontró una linda actividad a la cual le ha sacado muy buen provecho y ha ayudado a incentivar e impulsar la mejora de las condiciones de vida de su hogar la cual fue la cría de aves, este negocio le ha permitido generar los recursos con los cuales compra el alimento, la ropa y paga parte de los estudios de sus muchachos ya su esposo se encarga de pagar el resto.

Martha quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de pollos de levente, cerdos, y concentrado  que es el alimento de engorde. 
Este préstamo le permitirá seguir realizando la actividad que tanto beneficio y alegrías le ha dado a su familia en la parte económica.
texts.en:
Martha is 59 years old and married. She lives with her husband, with whom she has had four children, all of whom are adolescents. She is very loving and has sacrificed many things in her life in order to dedicate herself to her children and her husband. She thought of studying and getting ahead, but she does not regret anything.

In her house, she found a lovely activity which gave her great benefits, helped to inspire her, and encouraged her to improve her living conditions. That activity was raising birds. This business has allowed her to generate resources to buy food, clothing, and pay part of her children's study fees. as her husband is in charge of paying the rest. 

Martha would like to apply for a loan to buy chickens from the east, pigs, and feed to fatten them. This loan will allow her to continue with her business activity, which has given her family great benefits and happiness in their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy chickens from the east, pigs, and feed.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona has traded in cosmetics since 2012. She is teacher by profession, working at a local school in Kapan town. Besides her work as a teacher, Sona also receives orders from her customers and provides them a large variety of cosmetic products. 

She has now applied for this loan to purchase new supplies to cover customers' orders and earn profit for the family. Sona is a mother of a 14-year-old son and lives together with her mother and son. She is a proud mother and does her best to sustain the family's living. 

Sona has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics supplies to cover customers' orders and earn profit for the family

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is from Kapan town where he lives with his wife and 6-year-old child. He has been involved in providing taxi service for many years. Taxi driving is the only source of the family's income. 

Davit sold his old car with the hope of purchasing a new car, but he needs some financial support for that. Davit has applied for this loan to ask lenders to support him to purchase a car and continue providing taxi service to his customers. 

Davit has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new car for providing transportation (taxi service)

loans.name: Reinel Alonso

texts.es:
Reinel un joven tímido, pero atrevido de 23 años de edad, emprendedor, con buenas ideas, con ganas de salir adelante, se dedica al cultivo de frutas, en un campo que le presto su padre, cultivo desde joven estos terrenos y hoy que pueden producir se ha convertido en su fuente principal de ingresos, con ellos ayuda en su casa y paga por cuotas el terreno que usa.

Reinel busca mejorar su negocio, la mejor forma es comprando insumos para la preparación y mantenimiento de cultivos, necesita abonos, riegos, semillas, gallinaza, fungicidas, pesticidas, que son insumos comunes en el cultivo y de un alto costo que un joven que esta apenas afianzándose en el mercado no está dispuesto a asumir y como sus padres no cuenta con el capital, decidió buscar quien pueda apoyarlo, en la búsqueda  Interactuar llego a él con una propuesta que le gusto bastante, donde no solo le ayudaban con el dinero sino que lo iban a asesorar y guiar en todo su camino hacia el éxito.

Reinel quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar agroquímicos como lo son insecticidas, fungicidas, larvicidas y la respectiva mano de obra.
texts.en:
Reinel is a shy, but brave 23-year-old man. He is enterprising and has good ideas as well as a desire to succeed. He grows fruit on a field which his father lent to him. Since he was young, he has cultivated this land. Today, the land has become his main source of income as it can produce. With this income, he helps the household and pays for the land he uses.

Reinel is looking to improve his business. The best way to do so is to buy supplies to prepare and maintain his crops. He needs fertilizer, irrigation, seeds, manure, fungicide and pesticide. These are common supplies for growing crops, and they come at a high cost for a young person who is barely secure in the marketplace. He is not prepared to assume these costs, and since his parents do not have the necessary capital, he decided to search for support. In this search, Interactuar came to him with a proposal which he liked very much, in which they would help him not only with money, but also with advice and guidance in his path to success.

Reinel would like to apply for a loan to buy agricultural chemicals such as insecticide, fungicide, and larvicide, and to pay workers.

loans.use: to buy agricultural chemicals, such as insecticide, fungicide, and larvicide, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Didas

texts.en:
Mr.Didas is aged 42, a hard working person and happily married with 2 children aged 20 and 10. One of his children is still schooling. 

He is borrowing a loan of UGX3.000,000 and has been borrowing from UGAFODE Microfinance ltd (MDI) for over 4 years. He is a principle farmer and mainly does cattle farming and banana plantation. He works for 7 hours for a day and 6 days a week  He also has a side income from renting his commercial houses.  He started the business in order to generate income for his family house hold. 

The loan purpose is to buy pesticides and mulches for his plantations and to trade in coffee. Most of his clients are people around Bushenyi and sheema Districts. He started business in 1995. He hopes to trade more in produce for sale. He is always faced with a challenge of price fluctuations and high prices for agricultural inputs.

loans.use: To buy farm in puts such as mulch and pesticides

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 42-year-old lady; she is passing her life with her three daughters, four sons and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is taking a loan for her son who owns a small embroidery firm on partnership. He has been running this business for many years, now he has become very expert in his professions and also knits very fine embroidery through machine for gentlemen's outfits. He prepares embroidery on a large scale. He wants to buy wooden frame and embroidery materials to fulfill the needs of a large scale business. 

Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can buy wooden frame and embroidery material to do embroidery. Nasreen is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wooden frames and embroidery materials for her son's business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.pt:
Angelina  é solteira e tem uma filha menor de idade mas com idade escolar tem mais uma pessoas na sua responsabilidade vive em casa da sua mae,é trabalhadora de estado é uma emprendedora tem um salao de cabelereiro.que construiu com ajuda do valor de emprestimo.
Com o dinheiro do emprestimo vai comprar chapas de zinco e barrotes para cobrir a sua casa.
O seu maior sonho é terminar a sua casa ,pagar escola para  sua filha continuar a estudar,emprender alguns negócios.
Tem como principais desafios educar sua filha estudar para progredir na carreira profissional para melhorar as condições de sua familia.
texts.en:
Angelina is single and has a young daughter, who is school-age. She has one other person under her responsibility. She lives in her mother's house. She is a state employee. She is an entrepreneur with a hair salon, which she built with the help of a loan.

With the money from this loan, she will buy metal sheets and bars to cover her house.

Her greatest dream is to finish her house and pay her daughter's school fees so she can continue studying, as well as to start some businesses. Her main challenge is to educate her daughter and to study to progress in her professional career to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and bars to cover her house.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 25 year old married man with 2 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business of farming and motorcycle transport. He started these businesses with a hope of employing himself and he is hoping to buy a car to work as a taxi that will add him more income. He has asked for a loan to complete payment of a motorcycle.

loans.use: to complete payment of a motorcycle and with the hope to buy a car for taxi use

loans.name: 030206090003.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thạch has a retail business selling scrap. She is requesting a loan to purchase more scrap to resell.  Thạch is 43 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 030206090003.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thạch joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thạch has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution and has been involved in this business for 5 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thạch hopes to maintain  a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap to resell to be able to provide for her children and the future

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 28 years old, married to Damaris and he supports 2 family members. 

He has been in a motorcycle transport services for the last 4 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he plans to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle. This will enable him give clients better transportation services.

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and open a motorcycle repair shop. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose used the previous loan to buy beer and wheat flour for her business. She is involved in a bakery and also runs a bar alongside farming in order to boost her income. She started these businesses with the hope of earning an income for her family. 

She is faced with hardships of customers who delay paying on time and price fluctuation. 

However, Rose has a vision of expanding her business to new areas in order to gain more income. She has asked for a loan to buy beer and wheat flour for her business.

loans.use: to buy beer and wheat flour for her business

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 32 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender mercancía como jeans, calzado, blusas, licuadoras, ventiladores y otros electrodomésticos, ella es muy recursiva y trata siempre de acomodarse a los requerimientos del cliente, este negocio que inicio en mediados del año 2013 le ha significado un mejoramiento en la calidad de vida de su familia integrada por su pareja y dos hijos uno de 7 y el menor de 4. 

Ella trabaja por su casa, por su familia, por sus hijos, quiere darles una educación de calidad y una vivienda digna, que se alimenten bien, crezcas sanos, rodeados de amigos, eso para ella es lo primordial.

María busca mejorar las ventas de ropa por ello quiere iniciar a vender prendas más juveniles, atrevidas, coquetas, prendas que digan soy sexy pero reservada, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar surtido de faldas, tacones, blusas, correas para incentivar más la venta de estos productos, en la foto podemos ver un ejemplo de lo que quiere vender.
texts.en:
María, 32, sells merchandise such as jeans, footwear, blouses, blenders, fans, and other electrical appliances. She is very resourceful and always tries to accommodate her clients' requirements. She started this business in mid-2013. It has caused an improvement in the quality of life of her family, which is made up of her partner and two children, 4 and 7.

She works for her household, her family, and her children. She wants to give them a good-quality education and a decent home. She wants them to be well-fed and to grow up healthy, surrounded by friends. For her, this is fundamental.

María is looking to improve her clothing sales, which is why she wants to start selling clothing items which are younger, more adventurous and cute, which say "I'm sexy, but reserved." Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy an assortment of skirts, high heels, shirts, and belts to stimulate the sale of these products. In the photo is an example of what she wants to sell.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of skirts, high heels, shirts, and belts to stimulate the sale of these products.

loans.name: Alda

texts.pt: A Sra. Alda tem 48 anos de idadde, viúva, mae de 05 filhos dos quais uma está no lar e os restantes estão na sua responsabilidade. Para além dos seus filhos, sustenta ainda um sobrinho. É funcionária da Estaçao Agrária. Vive na casa própria e, com o empréstimo, pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente: chapa de zinco, cimento, blocos, sanitas para melhorar as condições da sua casa de banho. Ela tem o sonho de melhorar as condições de casa de banho, concluir a sua casa e melhorar as condições da dieta alimentar. O seu principal desafio é o reembolso de empréstimo para poder contrair o outro.
texts.en: Alda, 48, is a widow and a mother of five children. One of the children is in a home and the rest are under her responsibility. Aside from the children, she also supports a nephew. She is an employee in the Agricultural Sector. She lives in her own house. With this loan, she plans to buy construction materials, namely metal sheets, cement, blocks, and toilets, to improve the conditions of her bathroom. Her dream is to improve the conditions of her bathroom, finish her house, and improve her dietary conditions. Her main challenge is paying back the loan in order to take out another one.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, namely metal sheets, cement, blocks, and toilets, to improve the conditions of her house.

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
Melanya is a teacher with 15 years of teaching experience. She works at a local secondary school. Her time after work also belongs to her students, because besides school, Melanya also provides individual classes from her house. She is enthusiastic and hardworking teacher, and her students value her tireless work.
 
Melanya lives with her husband who is has a retirement pension and 23-years-old son.
 
She asks lenders to support her to purchase a computer that she needs for providing individual classes for her students. 
She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a computer needed for providing additional individual classes to students

loans.name: Seidy Rita

texts.es: Doña Seidy es una señora de 49 años, tiene un vivero que le genera los únicos ingresos en la familia y de los cuales dependen ella, su madre y su hermana, pretende desarrollar un proyecto de agricultura orgánica para lo cual solicita un millón de colones (¢1.000.000), su meta es  aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su estatus de vida.
texts.en:
Seidy, age 49, has a nursery that generates the only income for the family that depends upon her, her mother and her sister.

Seidy plans to develop an organic agricultural project for which she is requesting a million colones (¢1,000,000).  Her goal is to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to develop an organic agricultural project.

loans.name: Floretina

texts.pt:
Sra.Florentina tem 53 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de 06 filhos dos quais 02 estudam e estão na sua responsabilidade, frequentando o ensino primário e secundário, respectivamente. Vive na casa própria.
Com o empréstimo de 20.000,00 meticais pretende comprar fatos, malas, mantas, duvetes e lençois na vizinha África do Sul para revender.
Ela tem o sonho de construir uma mercearia para abraçar outro negócio visto que a sua idade já não permite os movimentos Moçambique e África do sul. Pese embora, enfrenta dificuldades financeiras e o seu desafio é redobrar as esforças para poder reembolsar o empréstimo
texts.en:
Florentina, 53, is single and a mother of six children. Two of her children are studying and are under her responsibility. They are in primary and secondary school, respectively. She lives in her own house.

With this loan of 20,000 Mozambican meticais, she plans to buy suits, bags, blankets, duvets, and sheets in neighboring South Africa to resell. Her dream is to build a grocery store to have another business, since her age does not allow her to move between Mozambique and South Africa. However, she currently faces financial difficulties and her challenge is to redouble her efforts in order to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy suits, bags, blankets, duvets, and sheets in neighboring South Africa to resell.

loans.name: Yoram

texts.en:
Yoram is aged 55 years, a father of ten children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He deals in general merchandise retail trade. This is a business he started in order to support his family and to be in line to provide for his personal needs. 

His business dream is to expand his business into new market segments, despite the challenge of low customer turnover and price fluctuation. 

Yoram has asked for a loan to buy more stock of sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: 031101110002.thiệu Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy works in agriculture raising livestock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Thủy is 44 years old, and she is married with two children. Thủy is the group leader of the 031101110002.Thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Thủy has been involved in this business for seven years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar, aged 45, is a responsible mother living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her fifth loan with BRAC and her first with Kiva. 

Her husband is involved in a scrap-dealing business and deals with scrap goods such as iron, plastic accessories and waste papers. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and selling them to the recycling factories.

Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have the amount needed to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap even in stock to sell for generating income.

Therefore, Kishwar has requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods in bulk for reselling to the recycling by her husband.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a resident of Kagadi, Uganda, who is involved in a motorcycle transport business commonly known as boda boda, which he started in 2009. Justus complements his business with farming. 

He is hardworking and has a plan of buying a car in the future so as to have a more convenient and profitable means of transport. He encounters the difficulty of the poor road network that causes constant mechanical breakdowns.  

Justus will use the loan to buy a motorcycle to expand his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to expand his transport business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old, married and has five children to provide for. She engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business to earn income. It was a good business for the family because it is an earning business — she earns PHP 1,500 a month that helps them with their family's daily needs. 

She aims to increase her income because of increasing needs of the family, so she decided to take a loan to buy additional good items to sell to increase her store inventory and have more sales to generate more income. 

Josephine's plan for the future is to expand her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional good items to sell.

loans.name: Demiano

texts.en: Domiano is 38 years old, married and supports a family of seven members. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for the last seven years and earns 7,000 KES per month. Domiano has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from Kiva's partner, Vision Fund Kenya, to maintain his motorcycle for efficient service to his clients. He plans to use the profits to buy more motorcycles for transporting purposes.

loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon es un padre de familia y responsable de un hogar conformado por su pareja y sus dos hijos uno de 13 y otro de 15 años que depende enteramente de él, es un hombre que gusta del trabajo independiente una actividad que aprendió del suegro y que este mismo se la impulso mucho, el negocio que desempeña es la venta de calzado, considerado marca propia ya que él mismo lo fabrica en un taller que tiene ubicado en su casa.

Trabaja 6 días a la semana a cada día le dedica 12 horas, cuando tiene mucho trabajo se lleva a su hijo mayor para que le ayude pero solo el día sábado y así este se gane un dinero y aprenda a valerse por sí mismo, es su manera de educarlos, sabe muy bien que son humildes pero con trabajo y estudio superaran cualquier adversidad que se le presente.

Más que un sueño es un objetivo el que se ha trazado Jhon, quiere comprar vivienda, mejorar condiciones de vida y pagar la educación de sus hijos, todo su trabajo y esfuerzo giran en torno a estos ítems.

Jhon quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales como lo son plantillas, suelas, cordones, cuero, hilo industrial, entre otros para fabricar su calzado.
texts.en:
Jhon is a responsible head of the household that is comprised of his life partner and their two children, ages 13 and 15.  They are completely dependent upon him.  He is a man who enjoys working independently.  He learned this business activity from his father-in-law, and this gives him a great deal of impetus.

His business is selling his own brand of shoes.  This is because he makes them himself in a shop that he has at his house.  He works 12 hours a day, six days a week.  When he has a lot of work, he brings his oldest son to help him.  However, he only does this on Saturdays.  This way he earns money and learns to provide for himself.  It is his way of educating him.  He knows very well that they are poor, but with work and education they can overcome any adversity that presents itself.

More than a dream is the objective that Jhon has laid out.  He wants to buy a house, improve his living conditions, and pay for his children’s education.  All of his work and efforts revolve around these considerations.

Jhon wants to request a loan to buy materials like insoles, soles, laces, leather, and industrial thread, among other items to make shoes.

loans.use: to buy materials like insoles, soles, laces, leather, and industrial thread, among other items to make shoes.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a video show business in the nearby town. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 80,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and a television set for her businesses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and a television set for her businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy initial stock such as sockets, bulbs, tube lights, switches and repairing tools to set up her son's electrician shop.

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en: Saleema is 33 and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband has owned a vegetable business for many years. He purchases fresh and seasonal vegetables from the main market at wholesale prices and sells from his vegetable shop at retail. He gets a reasonable profit. He manages his household necessities from his earnings through this vegetable business. He wants to increase his vegetable stock; therefore, his wife Saleema made contact with Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for a loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for reselling by her husband.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is 38 years old, married and supports a family of seven members. 

He has been in motorcycle transport for the last seven years and earns KES 7,000 per month. 

Japheth has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to service and maintain his motorcycle for efficient services to his clients. 

He plans to use the gained profits to buy more motorcycles for transporting purposes. 

His future hopes and dreams are to start his own motorcycle transporting company in the area.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle for efficient services to his clients

loans.name: Ba

texts.en: Ba is 27 years old and is married with one child. He lives in Quang Xuong District, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam. Ba has a manufacturing business making wood furniture. He has been in this business for five years. The main hardship that Ba faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet. This is Ba's first loan with Thanh Hoa, Kiva's partner. With his business profit, Ba hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Marcela Amparo

texts.es:
Marcela es una mujer de 38 años de edad, ella es madre de tres hijos que depende en su totalidad de ella y de su pareja, vive en una zona rural siempre se había desempeñado como ama de casa, realizando los alimentos para su familia, aseando su hogar y manteniendo el orden, pero este año las cosas se han complicado un poco y su hogar requiere con urgencia una ayuda, una que Marcela está dispuesta a brindar poniendo a su favor todos sus conocimientos en confección.

Marcela tiene los conocimientos para realizar el trabajo, las ganas, el tiempo, la determinación pero le falta el capital, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una máquina fileteadora e insumos, iniciara primeramente como sastre, buscara como hacerse proveedora para prestar servicios a terceros en confección de prendas.

Ella quiere realizar este trabajo y les pide apoyo, para sacar a su familia adelante, a base de trabajo.
texts.en:
Marcela is a 38 year old woman. She is the mother of 3 children who depend on her and her spouse completely. She lives in a rural zone and has always worked as a housewife, making the food for her family, cleaning the house and keeping order.

But this year things are more complicated and her household is in urgent need of help, something that Marcela is prepared to provide putting all her sewing knowledge into play. She has the knowledge to do the job, the will, the time and the determination but she lacks the capital.

So she is requesting a loan to buy a serger and supplies to start out as a seamstress looking to become a contractor providing services to third parties in making clothing. She wants to do this work and is asking for help to get her family ahead through her work.

loans.use: to buy a serger and supplies to start first as a seamstress.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials cloths for making clothes for sale to her customer and meet their demands and to become financially stable

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru: Равшан житель села Вахдат Шахристанского района. Ему 23 года.  В данное время  Равшан работает в дорожной компании Шахристанского района. Отец Равшана механизатор и они имеют трактор. Для ремонта трактора им нахватает денежных средств, и он решил помочь отцу, чтобы отремонтировать трактор. В обоюдном согласии семьи Равшан обратился в Арванд  за финансовой поддержкой и дал заявку на кредит. Он заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Ravshan lives in Bakhdat village in the Shahristanskii district. He is 23 years old. Currently, Ravshan works in the road company of Shahristanskii district. 

Ravshan's father is a mechanic and they have a tractor. They will gather funds to repair their tractor, and Ravshan has decided to help his father repair the tractor. In mutual agreement with his family, Ravshan has applied to Arvand for financial support and has applied for a loan. He gives thanks in advance for the support.

loans.use: to pay for tractor repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soaps.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add a stock of poultry to be able to open a shop and run a successful business

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle for transport business. He is a retailer dealing in the selling of general merchandise and he does farming and motorcycle transport businesses for extra income. 

He faces the challenges of limited capital and weather changes especially during the rainy seasons, which make roads impassable. He is looking forward to constructing a better home. Johnson needs another loan to buy another motorcycle for transport business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his transport business and to be able to build a better home

loans.name: Xuân

texts.en:
Mrs Xuân works in agriculture growing vegetable crops.

Xuân is 34 years old and she is married with 2 children.
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Xuân first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Xuân has been involved in this business for 1 year.

The main hardship that Xuân faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom, for her family to be healthy and safe

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martin es un hombre de 37 años,  está muy feliz porque gracias al crédito anterior el logro comprar sus materiales de construcción y puedo construir su casa, pues ahora su familia tiene mejores condiciones de vida,  él ahora solicita un  nuevo préstamo para poder comprar sus semillas de zanahoria y fertilizantes químicos y orgánicos, pues ya se acerca la época de cultivar.
El gran sueño de Martin es poder comprar más terrenos y aumentar su cultivo.
texts.en: Martin is a 37 year old man. He is very happy because with his previous loan he manged to buy construction materials and built his house. Now his family has better living conditions. He is now requesting a new loan to be able to buy carrots seeds and chemical and organic fertilizer as it is close to planting time. Martin's big dream is to be able to buy more land and expand his crops.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tuna

texts.en:
Tuna is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. In addition she also operates a farming business in the village 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 100,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes and fertilizers,seeds and an irrigation pump for her business . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and fertilizers,seeds and an irrigation pump for her business .

loans.name: Chuyên

texts.en:
Mrs Chuyên has a service business laying bricks.  Chuyên has been involved in this business for 2 years.

Chuyên is 40 years old and she is married with 3 children.  She supports 2 dependents with her business in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Chuyên first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

The main hardship that Chuyên faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build toilet.

With her business profit, Chuyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet for the health of her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw and body, in order to provide income for the family

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda hails from Badian, Cebu. She is 53 years old. She is married and her husband owns a vulcanizing business. Rosenda is also engaged in selling Ukay-ukay clothes (Ukay-ukay is a business that sells slightly-used designer clothes that is very affordable). In addition to that she also own a tailoring business and help in keeping their vulcanizing business sustainable. 

She is asking for a loan to buy ukay-ukay (slightly used branded clothes), hose, compressor and heater. In the future, she plans to expand their business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy ukay-ukay (slightly used branded clothes), hose, compressor and heater

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 44 years old. She is married with 3 children. 

She operates a restaurant and has been in the business for ten years. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she will use it to buy a potato peeler inorder to peel more potatoes for making french fries. 

She plans to use the loan to open another restaurant. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy a potato peeler for making an increased number of french fries in her restaurant

loans.name: Berdiali

texts.ru: Бердиали  жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 42 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги. Каждый трудится как может. Основным и стабильным бизнесом Бердиали является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Бердиали хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Бердиали обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Бердиали  заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Berdiali is a cheerful man. He is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. He has a very harmonious family. They live in the countryside. 

In order to have income in the family, every member of the family tries to earn money somehow. Everyone works as much as they can. Animal husbandry is Berdiali's main and stable business. He rears and sells livestock. In this business, he is helped by his wife. She tends to the livestock, and also sells their milk. 

The livestock business brings Berdiali a good and stable income. This, he wants to expand this business. He needs to buy a few more heads of livestock for nurturing and further sales. Berdiali has turned to Arvand and hopes to receive a loan to buy livestock in order to achieve this. He hopes that this business will successfully expand and bring more profits, in order to efficiently meet the needs of his family. Berdiali thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 45 years old and married. He supports a family of 8 members. He has been practicing small scale farming for the last 7 years and earns KES 7,000 per month.

Fredrick has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farming tools and equipment for high production. He plans to use the anticipated profits to start a metal shop in the area.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farming tools and equipment for high production.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 49 years old, married to Morris and she supports 6 family members. 

She has been a farmer for the last 14 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 11,000.
 
She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to purchase fertilizer and maize seeds for planting in her farm for a better harvest, which she will sell in the market and meet family and clients' needs.

She plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business. 

Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and maize seeds for planting for a better harvest which she will sell in the market and meet family and clients' needs.

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.en: Inomjon is a brave man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1977. He is living in a village with his family. He is married and has children. His family is big, and as a head of a family, he is responsible for feeding them. He has ten years experience doing business. He does business in agriculture, planting wheat and potatoes. His son helps and supports him in the business. He also keeps livestock at his house and feeds them for selling. He appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to buy calves to feed and sell them in market. He hopes to do business and feed his family.

loans.use: to buy calves to feed and sell them in market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a bull for slaughter for meat sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase material for making clothes.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lilia is 55 years old and has one child in school.

Lilia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a 25-year-old married man with 1 child, who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business of motorcycle transportation and also does farming for supplementary income. He is faced with the challenge of weather changes especially during the rainy season because it spoils the roads and his motorcycle too. Besides that, he is working very hard to make sure he constructs a well-furnished good house for his family. Gerald has asked for a loan to buy household assets like chairs commonly known as a sofa set.

loans.use: to buy household assets like chairs commonly known as a sofa set.

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is married with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business. Her potential customers are town dwellers and neighbors, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph deals in butchery by selling fresh beef, which he has practiced for many years. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He earns additional income from his cocoa garden for his family of four children and the schools fees for the two attending school. He works hard to meet his family's basic needs. In spite of the challenge of limited capital, he dreams of educating his children and completing his house construction. Joseph is requesting a loan to buy cows for slaughtering to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is requesting a loan to buy more cocoa for selling as his major economic activity. He is aged 39 years and married with 8 children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He gets additional income from his cocoa garden, but is challenged by limited capital on top of the business being seasonal. He hopes to improve on his cocoa business in the future, build a permanent house and also educate his children.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Madi

texts.fr:
Mr MADI est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 06ans 06mois. 02 vont à l’école. Il a 03personnes en charge.
Mr vend de l’insecticide depuis 13ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés de bétail.
Il veut s’acheter 04cartons d’insecticide.
Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son activité. Mr ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation dans sa parcelle.
texts.en: Madi is married and father to two children. His eldest child is 10 years old and the younger one is six and a half. They both go to school. Madi has three dependents in total. He has been selling insecticides for the past 13 years and gets his supplies in livestock markets. He would like to buy four cartons of insecticides and he will use the profits he makes to reinvest in his business. His aim is to be able to build a house on his own plot of land.

loans.use: to buy four cartons of insecticide.

loans.name: Furqat

texts.ru: Фуркат жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 46 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги. Каждый трудится как может. Основным и стабильным бизнесом Фурката является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Фуркату хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Фуркат обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Фуркат заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Furqat is a cheerful man. He is 46 years old. He is married and has three children. He has a very harmonious family. They live in the countryside. 

In order to have income in the family, all members of the family try to earn money somehow. Everyone works as much as they can. Furqat's main and stable business is animal husbandry. He rears and sells cattle. His wife helps him with this business. She tends to the cattle and also sells their milk. 

The animal husbandry business brings Furqat a good and stable income. Thus, he wishes to expand this business. He needs to buy a few more heads of cattle for cultivating and subsequent selling. For this, Furqat has turned to Arvand and wants to receive a loan in order to buy cattle. He hopes that this business will successfully expand and bring in more profits, so that he can sufficiently meet the needs of his family. Furqat thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy traditional fabric and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cereals and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer and packets of maize seeds for planting in his already prepared farm for a better harvest and to meet the demands of clients and for family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a wheelbarrow and spades for use in her ballast business

loans.name: Philes

texts.en:
Philes is fifty-two years old and married with five children. She runs a beauty salon as well as well as selling charcoal and has been in business for twenty years. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, and she will use it to buy beauty products and hair extensions.
 
Philes plans to use the profits from the business to have a bigger beauty salon. 

Her hope for the future is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and hair extensions

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
She is Jocelyn and she sincerely sends to all the kind-hearted lenders her warmest thanks because the PHP 50,000 loan has assisted with her business. She was able to purchase more grocery products and other supplies which are necessary to boost her business profit. So far, she was able to managed all the resources used.

For the 5th time, Jocelyn is asking for your assistance because she would like to have business expansion. She is applying for another PHP 50,000 worth of loan which she will be using again for the purchase of additional grocery items and products she needs to add to her current inventory. She expects to have a significant increase in profit as she improves her capital being for her store.

Jocelyn aims to send to maintain a flourishing business throughout the year and the years to come. She is an active community partner of C.C.T. She meets with her fellowship* group every Wednesday.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 35 years old, married to Everline, and he supports six family members. 

He has been selling electrical appliances in the market for the last seven years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

David has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, with which he plans to purchase more electrical appliances for sale in the market.

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand his business sector. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical appliances for sale in the market

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 38 years old, married and has five children. She is engaged in a sari-sari store business to earn her living. She aims to provide her children with a better living and send them to school. So she want to increase her income . She took a loan to buy additional goods for sale to increase her store inventory and increase her sales to generate more income.

Lolita plan for the future to expand her business to sustain the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for selling to support the needs of her children

loans.name: Premia

texts.en:
Premia is 65 years old with one child. Premia works very hard to provide for them.

Premia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store.

She has been in this business for seven years now. 

In the future, Premia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in African masks and carvings. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, and sandpaper.

Abdulai has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is his story:

"It took a painful experience for me to get into art. I had to drop out of school after my dad passed on. My mum, who was not working at that moment, was faced with the challenge of taking care of us. I told myself I would find a job to help keep my younger siblings in school. And I did. I worked as an errand boy for art workshops in our neighborhood and used the tips I got for running errands to buy food for my brothers and sisters. I was fascinated by the way the workers could carve beautiful designs out of wood. I was willing to learn a trade to be able to earn money and thus achieve my goal of helping my family. So when I was given the opportunity to try my hands with some pieces of wood, I was happy and knew this was going to be the beginning of a bright future. This was how I began."

"I want to work on creating more pieces. Your assistance will go a long way to make me achieve this objective. I am very thankful to you in advance."

Use the link below to view Abdulai's African masks and carvings on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/9152">http://www.novica.com/kiva/9152

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, and sandpaper

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 62 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Segundina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

She has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Segundina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino, who works alongside his wife, Agripina, is an artisan who specializes in alpaca and wool weaving. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca and sheep's wool

Faustino has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"My parents and grandparents were artisans," says Peru's Faustino. "So I learned at an early age to weave on rustic looms, to prepare the warp and spin the wool. Our family motto has been: I will never let go of either my grandfather or grandson's hands, for what I have learned from the elders, I will teach to the young. Based on this family philosophy, our work today represents the art that has been passed down from generation to generation within my family."

"With this loan, we will acquire the material needed to weave a variety of apparel pieces. We are very thankful to all of you for this opportunity."

Use the link below to view Faustino's alpaca and wool weavings on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/705">http://www.novica.com/kiva/705

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca and sheep's wool for his weaving business

loans.name: Wend Be Ziiri Group

texts.fr:
Mme HELENE représente le groupe WEND BE ZIIRI. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 04ans et le moins âgé a 06mois.Personne ne va à l'école.
Mme vend des condiments depuis 02ans. Elle s'approvisionne au marché de son quartier. 
Elle veut s'acheter 01sac de gombo sec et 01sac d'oignons.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Hélène represents the Wend Be Ziri group. She is married and mother to two children, the eldest of whom is four years old and the youngest six months. Neither of the children go to school. 

Hélène has been selling condiments for two years and gets her supplies in the market in her neighborhood. She wants to buy a sack of dried gombo and a sack of onions. She would like to reinvest her profits in her business, and her ambition is to extend her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sack of dried gombo and a sack of onions.

loans.name: Abran

texts.fr: Abran âgée de 33ans, revend des mèches depuis un certain temps dans une boutique. Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite son second crédit pour acheter des mèches. Elle espère avec le gain devenir grossiste et aider ses enfants. Elle a 02 enfants en charge.
texts.en: Abran is 33 years old and has been selling hair extensions in a shop for some time. In order to be able to satisfy customer demand more readily, she is requesting her second loan to buy hair extensions. She  hopes  to use her profit to become a wholesaler and help her children. She has two children in her care.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de céréales au marché, Yawa une femme de 36ans sollicite un second crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle souhaite à l'avenir développer son activité et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Yawa, who is a 36-year old woman, sells cereals in the market and is requesting a second loan to buy sufficient goods to meet customer demand. She would like to build up her business in the future and be able to take better care of herself.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Coiffeuse de profession depuis 2004, Akouavi mère au foyer demande un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des produits cosmétiques. Elle a 02 enfants âgés de 11 et 1an et son conjoint est déclarant en douane. Elle espère avoir une plus grande activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en: Akouavi has been a hairdresser by trade since 2004 and she is also a mother. She is requesting a first loan from WAGES to buy cosmetics. She has two children aged 11 years old and one year old respectively, and her husband is a customs declaration officer. She hopes to be able to build up her business and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more trees for timber to earn more income and start a carpentry business

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is a 29 years old and he supports 3 family members.
 
He has been a motorcycle transporter for the last 2 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he plans to purchase a wind screen and other spare parts for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle for a better transportation and meet the clients needs.  

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and purchase more motorcycles for transportation purposes. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a wind screen and other spare parts for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a farmer and a mother of two children. To earn a living she engages in coconut wine vending. Through this business she provides for her children's needs and for them, it is a good business for the family. 

Leonora want to give a better life to her children so she aims to increase her income so that she can provide her children with their needs specially their educational needs. So she took a loan to buy additional ingredients for coconut wine to make more wine and sell more coconut wine to earn more income. 

Leonora's plan for the future is to have a sari-sari store business as her other business.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for brewing coconut wine.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elsa is 54 years old now.

Elsa has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell .

She has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with three children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 8,500, she wants to purchase a solar panel to use in her business at night. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel to use in her business at night.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 44 years old. She lives alone in a small village of Kareli district. Nino cultivates the family-owned agricultural land seasonally and grows different kinds of vegetables there. She sells the harvest to generate income. As the income is only seasonal and not enough for Nino, she decided to start a trading business.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL. With the received credit Nino will purchase a stock of clothes and will sell among her villagers in order to get a stable income. 

She is a very hardworking woman and hopes that the new business will be successful. Nino awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes in order to get a stable income

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 37 years old from Minia. He is married and has 3 children. Mohammad is a part time farmer but the income from his job can't cover his family's monthly increasing expenses. 

Since Mohammad has a long experience in fattening cattle and in cattle sales, he decided to start small cattle fattening as a business. The project was very successful and Mohammad dreams of expanding it, so he requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase his sales and his income to his family.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle to increase his sales and his income to his family.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi, who is a 44-year-old married man, lives in the village of Ghoresha. He has a seven-member family and they earn a living with their small agricultural business. Giorgi cultivates family-owned agricultural land, growing nuts and harvesting some produce for family use. 

Giorgi sells nuts seasonally and gets a small income. Apart from this he works in a stone factory and gets a small fixed income. The family finds it hard to achieve financial stability and cover all family expenses. 

Giorgi requested a loan from local financial institutions to expand his agricultural business and make it more productive. His loan request was rejected several times due to his family's unstable financial condition. The start-up program created between Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of 1500 GEL, for purchasing a milk cow and starting dairy farming. Giorgi and his wife will start producing milk products, cheese and yogurt, for local selling and for family food also. 

This new business initiative will significantly improve the family's living conditions and they will achieve financial stability. Giorgi will be very grateful for the help.

loans.use: To start dairy farming and expand agricultural activity

loans.name: Arqayik

texts.en:
Arqayik is from Kapan town where he lives with his wife and two sons. Arqayik drives a taxi, using his own car for many years. 
To be able to purchase new tires and renovate the car Arqayik now asks this loan. He needs this loan to be able to bring the car into working condition and continue providing taxi service. 

Arqayik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
He hopes for lender's support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for new tires, renovation of the car to continue taxi driving

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To put up a structure for shelving bricks and adding more stock..

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is living in small town with her family. She is divorced and has one child. She alone raised her child, and for almost two years, her son has been working in Russia. 

For almost 15 years, she has been doing a business trading women's shoes in the domestic market. She buys from wholesalers in the city market and retails in rural markets. She has permanent customers for her goods. She is doing the business to make a living. 

She asked for help from IMON getting a loan to buy women's shoes. She awaits the kindness of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes

loans.name: Turashoboye Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne  fait partie du groupe  Turashoboye et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 47 ans et est mariée à François, un peintre. Ensemble ils ont 9 enfants âgés de 12 à 30 ans, dont  4 étudient. 

Elle  fait le commerce de la bière industrielle et de la limonade dans son bistrot     depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière industrielle et de limonade  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  construire une maison moderne, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jeanne belongs to the Turashoboye group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 47 years old and married to a man called François, who is a painter. They have nine children together, ranging from 12 to 30 years of age; four of them are studying.

Jeanne has been buying and selling manufactured beer and lemonade in her bistro for the past 20 years. She is on her third loan from Turame, and with the Kiva loan she has been granted, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of manufactured beer and lemonade, which she will resell to make more money.

Over the coming years she would like to build a modern house and see her children through school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of manufactured beer and lemonade to resell so she can earn more money.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Con un gran sueño el cual es comprar una vivienda propia inicio su camino como emprendedor y como agricultor el joven Daniel un muchacho de 21 años de edad que cuenta con la ayuda de tres empleados y con sus capacidades e ideas innovadoras ha logrado tener éxito con su cultivo.

En la foto se ve él y al fondo empleados trabajando, todo lo que tiene lo ha logrado con esfuerzo y haciendo una mención de honor a sus padres que fueron quienes lo capacitaron y le dieron unas bellas palabras “hijo tienes las habilidades e inteligencia para lograr grandes cosas”, unas palabras que lo dejaron marcado y que hoy con su negocio honra.

Daniel quiere solicitar un préstamo para seguir dando forma a su negocio quiere comprar insumos agrícolas necesario para complementar el trabajo que se ve realizando en la foto, necesita abonos, riegos y algunos productos para proteger sus campos de depredadores.

Tú puedes apoyar a un joven como Daniel que son los llamados a continuar con la hermosa labor de agricultura en Colombia.
texts.en:
With his dream of buying his own home, young Daniel, aged 21, embarked upon his path as an entrepreneur and a farmer. He has three employees and with his innovative ideas and skills he has achieved success with his crops.

The photo shows him and his employees working in the background. Everything he has has been achieved with effort and thanks to his parents, who taught him and told him, "son, you have the skills and intelligence to do great things". These words made an impression on him and he honours them today with his business.

Daniel wants to request a loan to continue shaping his business. He wants to buy the agricultural inputs he needs to supplement the work you can see in the photo. He needs compost, water and products to protect his crops from predators.

You can help a young man like Daniel to continue his beautiful farming work in Colombia.

loans.use: to buy compost, water and products to protect his crops from predators.

loans.name: Garegin

texts.en:
Garegin lives in Kapan town with his parents, wife and two little sons. 

Garegin has been involved in construction for many years. He provides different types of reconstruction, housing internal and external improvement work in Kapan town. 

To be able to purchase tools and materials needed for construction work, Garegin has applied for this loan. This loan will help him to purchase it and make the work efficient.  

Garegin has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for providing construction work

loans.name: Nzoriha Group

texts.fr:
Japhet  fait partie du groupe  Nzoriha et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 41 ans et est marié à Espérance, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 5 à 18 ans, dont  5 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce de haricot, du riz, arachide dans sa boutique  depuis  13 ans. 

Il est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, d’arachide et de riz  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une vache pour faire de l’élevage  et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Japhet belongs to the Nzoriha group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 41 years old and married to Espérance, a trader. They have seven children together, ranging from five to 18 years of age; five of the children are studying.

Japhet has been buying and selling beans, rice and groundnut in his shop for the past 13 years. 

He is on his third loan from Turame, and with his Kiva loan he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice and groundnut to resell, so he can earn more money. 

Over the coming years he would like to buy a cow so he can begin a livestock farming activity and also see his children through school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice and groundnut to resell and earn more money.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a bathroom with a toilet on her patio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase relaxers, shampoo, hair conditioners and hair extensions to use for salon services

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 34 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She raises pigs, which she has been doing for two years.  

Rowena requested a loan, which she will use to buy pig feed. This loan will help improve her hog raising business and augment her income. She hopes to be able to do some expansion. In the future, Rowena hopes that she will become financially stable in handling her business and for the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children. She also takes care of additional family members . She has a retail grocery shop and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy beans, flour, soap, sugar, rice, cooking oil, cartons of salt and crates of soda. Her major business challenge is transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her main monthly expenses are for food and medication.

loans.use: to buy beans, flour, soap, sugar, rice, cooking oil,

loans.name: Abesigwa Mulika Farmers Group

texts.en:
