Fridah, aged 36, is a resident of Kagadi, Uganda who trades in local brew and supplements her income with farming. Fridah is single and very hardworking; she started her business in 2001 in order to earn a living. However, she is faced with a problem of little working capital. 

She is therefore going to use the loan to buy local brew to sell. This will in turn increase her working capital. According to her, the business is doing well and more capital is need to boost it. She is a member o Abesigwa Mulika group where members have to guarantee one another in order to access a loan since they don't pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy more alcohol for resale

loans.name: Polycap

texts.en:
Polycap is a 30 years old and supports four family members.
 
He has been in the motorcycle transport service business for the last six years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to purchase spare parts for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle for improved transportation services. 

Polycap plans to use his gained profit to repay the loan and start a car wash. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle for improved transportation services

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married mother of four children, all in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, Saumu has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. 
With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, Saumu wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes lives in Nor Kharberd village and works as a hairdresser. His small salon in the center of the village provides its service only for men. Hovhannes works hard to provide high quality service and have customers. The salon is very old and needs to be renovated, so people prefer to come and enjoy the service. 

Hovhannes also needs some tools that are vital for his work as  a hairdresser (scissors, hair dryer). This is the reason why Hovhannes has applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Hovhannes lives with his wife, who is a teacher by profession, and two school-aged sons. As the only breadwinner of the family, Hovhannes greatly hopes to receive lenders' support and improve his workplace.

loans.use: to pay for tools needed for providing  hairdressing service (scissors, hair dryer) and pay for renovation of the salon

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with five children, four in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past six years, Amina has operated a cosmetic shop business. Her customers are town dwellers and neighbors, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfume, lipstick and body lotion. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase perfume, lipstick and body lotion

loans.name: Grupo Panimache Group

texts.es:
Josefa es una mujer de 61 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 19 y 36 años.

Josefa (es la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la elaboración  de blusas típicas, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde hace 15 años.
Josefa por vivir en una aldea muy lejana desde  hace mucho tiempo no cuentan con agua potable en su casa, pues ella y sus hijas  han sufrido mucho porque tienen que cargar agua para poder hacinarse en su casa, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder pagar la instalación de agua potable en su casa.

 El gran sueño de Josefa es poder construirles una casa para sus hijas.
texts.en:
Josefa is a 61-year-old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family with four children aged between 19 and 36 years old.

Josefa (the first from the left in the photograph) has the desire to earn an income and take care of her family. She is dedicated to making traditional blouses. She has been doing this work for 15 years.

Because Josefa lives in a village very far away, for a long time, she didn’t have drinking water in her home. As a result, she and her daughters have suffered a lot because they had to carry water to be able to have it in the house. For this reason, she requests a loan to be able to pay for the installation of drinking water in her home.

Josefa’s biggest dream is to be able to build a house for her daughters.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of drinking water in her home.

loans.name: Las Manzaneras De Panimache Primero Sector I Group

texts.es:
Cecilia es una joven de 23 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Panimache Chichicastenango.
Cecilia (es la que se encuentra en medio de la fotografía  de blusa morada)  para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace 7 años.
Cecilia es una joven muy emprendedora porque ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un  préstamo junto a un grupo de personas para hacer de su negocio algo más grande, ella con el crédito piensa comprar cortes, fajas y blusas para luego venderlas a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a twenty-three year-old woman, she lives with her parents in a village of Panimache Chichicastenango. 
To earn money and help her parents with the household expenses, Cecilia (standing in the middle in the photo, wearing a bright pink blouse) buys and resells traditional clothing. She has been working at this for seven years. 
Cecilia is a very enterprising young woman, because now she has decided to apply for a loan as part of a group to help her business to grow. She would like to use the loan to purchase skirts, belts and blouses and sell them at a good price.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Desde el año 1986 el señor Jairo se dedica al negocio de cultivo de frutas, se fortaleció en el comercio de Agucates, distribuyendo principalmente en plazas de mercado, aunque también a su negocio llegan personas naturales dispuestas a comprarle sus productos para posteriormente venderlo en fincas.

Esta Actividad le ha servido para valerse por sí mismo., es un hombre soltero que no tiene hijos ni pareja solo son él y sus palos de mango, a sus 53 años de edad se encuentra muy cómodo, a gusto con su actividad, no busca tener grandes riquezas que atraigan problemas, solo busca producir un poco más para vender mejor y así pagar sus deudas, tener para darse sus gustos, comprar su vino, en pocas palabras darse sus comodidades que es su gran propósito, trabajar muy duro para vivir bien.

Como lo habíamos mencionado anteriormente Jairo no tiene familia, por ello quiere apoyarse y refugiarse con excelentes personas como las que leen esta historia para solicitar un aliento económico que usara para  la compra de abonos, riegos, gallinaza, pesticidas y fungicidas para su cultivo de aguacate.
texts.en:
Since the year of 1986 Jairo has made a living int he business of cultivating fruits. He was strengthened in the trade of avocados, distributing them primarily in marketplaces. But also individuals arrange to buy his products to later sell them on farms.

This activity has helped him to fend for himself. He is a single man who does not have children or a wife, it is only him and his mango trees. He is 53 years of age and is very comfortable and at ease with his activity. He is not seeking great wealth that attracts problems, he is only looking to produce a bit more to sell better and pay his debts. To give his tastes, to buy his wine, briefly give his amenities is his great purpose, to work very hard and live well. 

As mentioned above Jairo does not have a family, and for this he wants to support himself and seek refuge with excellent people like those that read this story to request an economic breath which he will use to purchase fertilizers, irrigation, manure, pesticides and fungicides for the cultivation of avocados.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, irrigation, manure, pesticides and fungicides for growing avocados.

loans.name: Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es: Paulino, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, y reside junto a ella en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con su familia, actualmente cultiva papa, maíz y frijol, pero su mayor venta es la papa, y la vende en el mercado local. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos para su familia. desde que inicio con el cultivo a invertido varios préstamo para mantener buena cosecha. Actualmente solicita un préstamo por 22,000 lempiras en forma grupal para compra de semilla de papa para siembra y comprar abono, insecticidas para dar asistencia al cultivo y sacar mejor producción. El grupo se llama Futuro Mejor, integrado por tres miembros que también se dedican al mismo cultivo y se conocen en la comunidad. Solicitan un préstamo grupal por 74,000 lempiras para semillas e insumos para siembra de papas. En la foto esta Paulino, Pedro y Guillermo a la derecha.
texts.en:
Paulino is 35 years old and lives in a common-law relationship. They live together in a village in the municipality of Intibucá. He has always worked in agriculture with his family. Currently he grows potatoes, corn and beans. His main crop to sell is potatoes and he sells them at the local market. This business is the source of income for his family.

Since he started growing he has invested a number of loans to maintain good harvests. At present he is requesting a loan for 22,000 HNL as part of a group to buy potato seed to plant and buy manure and insecticide to assist his crops and have higher production.

The group is called "Futuro Mejor" and is made up of three members who grow the same crops and know each other from their community. They are requesting a group loan of 74,000 NHL for seeds and supplies to grow potatoes. In the photo are Paulino, Pedro and Guillermo to the right.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds to plant, manure and insecticides to assist the crops.

loans.name: Floricultura El Clavel Group

texts.es: Doña Franca, tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 8 hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá junto a su esposo, dos hijos y un nieto. Ella siempre a trabajado en la agricultura con su familia y donde vive es una zona apta para el cultivo como de  granos básicos, papas y hortalizas, su cultivo es maíz, frijol, papas, zanahorias y remolachas. La producción la sacan al mercado cercano para vender. Lleva dos ciclos de préstamo en la Institución con el actual que es por 15,000 Lempiras y es en forma grupal, con este va comprar abonos, insecticidas, fungicidas, arreglo de la tierra y compra de semilla de papa para siembra. Su fin es seguir invirtiendo en siembra de papas, granos básicos y hortalizas para seguir obteniendo ingresos para su familia. El grupo al que pertenece se llama Floricultura el Clavel, integrado por 6 miembros que viven en una zona productora de papas, granos básicos y hortalizas. Han decidido solicitar un préstamo grupal por un total de 74,000 Lempiras, para comprar semillas e insumos para cultivo de papas. En la foto esta María Santos a la izquierda, Franca, Zacarías, María Félix, María Laura y María Elvira.
texts.en:
Franca is 54 years old, is married, and has 8 children. She lives in a village in the municipality of Intibucá with her husband, two children, and a grandson. She has always worked in agriculture with her family. Where she lives is an area suitable for growing crops, such as basic grains, potatoes and vegetables. Her crops are corn, beans, potatoes, carrots, and beets. She takes her harvest to a nearby market to sell. 

She has had two loan cycles with the instition, including the current one, which is for 15,000 lempiras and is a group loan. With this, she is going to buy manure, insecticides, and fungicides; pay for repairs to the land; and buy potatoes seeds for growing. Her goal is to continue investing in growing potatoes, basic grains, and vegetables to continue earning an income for her family. 

The group to which she belongs is called “Floricultura el Clavel.” The group is made up of 6 members who live in an area that produces potatoes, basic grains, and vegetables. They have decided to request a group loan for a total of 74,000 lempiras to buy seeds and supplies for growing potatoes. 

In the photo, from the left are María Santos, Franca, Zacarías, María Félix, María Laura, and María Elvira.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticides, and fungicides; pay for repairs to the land; and buy potatoes seeds for growing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a bathroom with a toilet to make his home more comfortable and hygienic.

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.en: Ambrosia is a farmer from Badian, Cebu. She and her husband grow corn on their land. This has been their source of income for two years now. She usually earns 8,000 PHP every four months, the time it takes to grow and harvest her crop. She is asking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her crop. She hopes to maintain her farm and make it more successful by expanding the land to cultivate in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Masitula

texts.en:
Masitula is married with four children and all her children go to school. She sells both new and used clothes. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of new and used clothes.  She moves door to door, selling on a retail basis. 

Masitula has been in this business for five years. Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her movement. She would like to get a permanent place like a boutique where her customers could find her. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bales of new clothes and bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Farmers Group

texts.en:
Tukolerewamu Farmers Group is located in the Gavu Mpigi district. Their major activity is crop growing. The group is headed by Christopher, who is the group's chairperson and also treasurer on the local council. The group received loans previously to buy fertilizer and to employ laborers to assist them in their businesses. Their yields increased and so did their income.
They are now applying for another loan to buy organic fertilizer and to hire laborers to weed and prune their crops for better output.
The group appreciates UGAFODE's interest in their businesses and pledges to work hard to maintain the partnership.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as organic fertilizers to boost crop yields

loans.name: Noura

texts.en: Noura is 24 years old and lives in Minia. She has three children and her husband is a sentry in the police station. Noura bought some low-priced groceries to sell to her neighbors and their children to cover some of the expenses of her children. The demands of her customers increased and Noura knew that she should expand her business. So, she requested 3,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy more groceries such as carbonated drinks, oil and pasta.

loans.use: To buy more groceries such as carbonated drinks, oil and pasta.

loans.name: Grupo Cruz B, Cantón Pamezabal. Group

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer de 28 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 11 y 12 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Santa Lucía Utatlán.
Teresa (es la que se encuentra en medio de la fotografía de suéter negro) para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los de la casa, se dedica a la costura e blusas típicas, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde hace dos años.
Teresa es una mujer digna de admirarse, porque con tal de obtener otro ingreso, ha prestado una máquina para poder coser y con ella generar un poco de ganancia, pero ella ahora ha tomado la iniciativa de solicitar un préstamo para comprarse una máquina de coser.
El gran sueño de Teresa es poder construir su propia casa y tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 28-year-old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family with two children aged between 11 and 12 years old. This humble family lives in the community of Santa Lucía Utatlán.

Teresa (who is in the middle of the photograph in the black sweater)—to earn an income and support her husband with the household expenses—is dedicated to sewing and making traditional blouses. She has been doing this work for two years.

Teresa is a woman worthy of admiration. Because she wanted to earn an additional income, she has borrowed a sewing machine. With this, she generates some earnings. However, now, she has taken the initiative to request a loan to buy a sewing machine herself. 

Teresa’s biggest dream is to be able to buy her own house and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase trees for his timber business.

loans.name: Sauti

texts.en:
Sauti is a married mother of five children who all attend school .She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water .Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a vegetable-selling business in the community. She faces major challenges of seasonality and transportation costs in her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting, Sauti wants to pay school fees for her children .She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his motorcycle seat as well as buy a wind screen for improving his motorcycle transport

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell groceries, such as candy, juice, rice, sweets, and sugar.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Malienne, Ban  est âgée de 56 ans .Elle est veuve et a à sa charge  6 enfants dont 4 vont à l’école. Ses enfants sont âgés de 17 à 32 ans.
Ban a fréquenté l’école coranique, elle fait l’élevage de mouton depuis 13 ans. Aujourd’hui elle souhaite développer son élevage de mouton pour en faire sa principale source de revenu. Elle fait recourt au prêt RMCR pour acheter plus de moutons à élever. Le profit gagné la permet de faire face aux besoins de sa famille (nourriture, habillement, éducation, santé etc…)   Elle s’approvisionne au marché environnant et vend au même marché. Les difficultés que BAN a rencontrées concernent: les maladies des animaux, et des cas de vol. Le prêt du RMCR  permet à BAN d’avoir une activité qui génère des revenus pour  subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coming from Mali, Ban is 56. She is a widow and is raising six children, of whom four attend school. Her children are between 17 and 32 years of age. 

Ban attended Koranic school and she has been raising sheep for 13 years. Today she would like to develop her sheep-raising business so as to make it her principal source of revenue. She asked for a loan from RMCR to buy more sheep to raise. The profit she earns will allow her to cover the needs of her family (food, clothing, education, and health care). She buys her livestock in a nearby market and sells them in the same market. 

The difficulties Ban has encountered are concerned with animal illnesses and some cases of theft. The loan from RMCR allows Ban to have a business that generates income so that she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep for later resale

loans.name: Glenda Zoraida

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 22 De Noviembre se reúne cada quince días en un sector conocido como El Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar de gente amable, trabajadora y dedicada  a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Glenda, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 22, 20 y 18 años de edad, todos ellos aun viven con ella y dos estudian en universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Glenda es una mujer muy luchadora que para ganarse algo por su cuenta todas las tardes instala una pequeña carreta en una calle muy transitada de la ciudad en la cual vende  salchichas y  frituras, acompañadas de plátano asado y jugos o gaseosas a elección de sus clientes, trabaja casi todo el día ya que a pesar que es en las tardes que vende sus alimentos ella desde las mañanas prepara todo para cuando ya le toca vender se le haga mas fácil,  ella lleva más de 10 años con esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por su cuenta en bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar salchichas, carne, cueros de cerdo y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 9 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le  gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “22 De Noviembre” (“22nd of November”) loan group meets every fifteen days in an area known as “El Guabito” in the city of Portoviejo. This place has people that are friendly, hard working, and family oriented.

In this place, lives Mrs. Glenda. She is 48 years old, is married, and, from this relationship, has 3 children, who are 22, 20, and 18 years old. All of her children still live with her, and two of them study in university. Her husband works in agriculture.

Glenda is a very persevering woman. To earn something for her account, everyday she sets up a small cart on a very busy street in the city; from the cart, she sells sausages and fry-ups, accompanied by roasted bananas and juices or sodas from her clients to choose from. She works almost the whole day. Even though she only sells her food in the afternoons, she spends the morning preparing everything, so that when she starts selling, it is easier. She has spend more than 10 years doing this work, and she earns an income for the wellbeing of her family.

This loan will be used to buy sausages, meat, pig hide, and other supplies to prepare the food. 

She has been in the loan group for nine year, and she likes it because of the help that the loans offer her. Her dreams are to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy sausages, meat, pig hide, and other supplies.

loans.name: Union Y Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
Pablo, tiene 32 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos, reside en el municipio de Intibucá. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, haciendo trabajos a particulares. Hace 6 años que cultiva papas, lechuga, coliflor, remolacha, brócoli y zanahoria. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Pablo solicita un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras en forma grupal con el propósito de comprar semillas de papa para sembrar, abonos, insecticidas y otros insumos para dar asistencia a las parcelas de cultivo de papa actuales. Tiene como meta poder construir una vivienda y darle estudio a sus hijos y ofrecer fuente de empleo en la comunidad. 
El grupo se llama Unión y Esfuerzo, que lo integran 5 miembros, quienes se dedican a la agricultura de papas y hortalizas y viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo total es por 62,000 lempiras, el cual lo utilizaran para comprar semillas de papas y poder tener una fuente de ingresos. En la foto se identifican de izquierda a derecha Así: Evaristo, Cipriano, José, Pablo y Selzo a la derecha.
texts.en:
Pablo is 32, married, and has two children. He lives in the town of Intibucá. He has always made a living in agriculture, doing small works. He has been growing potatoes, lettuce, cauliflower, beetroot, broccoli and carrots for six years. He sells his produce at the local market. Pablo is requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras as part of the group to buy potato seeds to grow and compost, insecticide and other inputs to maintain the plots on which he is currently growing potatoes. His aim is to be able to build a home, provide his children with an education, and offer jobs in his community.

The group is called Unión y Esfuerzo, and has 5 members, who make a living growing potatoes and vegetables and lie in the same community. The total loan is for 62,000 lempiras, which they will use to buy potato seeds and have a source of income. In the photograph, the members are, from left to right, Evaristo, Cipriano, José, Pablo and Selzo.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds to grow and compost and insecticide to maintain the crop.

loans.name: Tel Taaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA eprésente le groupe TEL TAABA. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 23mois. 02vont à l'école, elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des vetements depuis 07ans. Elle s'approvisionne au marché de son secteur.
Elle veut s'acheter 20douzaines d'habits pour femmes et enfants.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. AMINATA is the representative of the TEL TAABA group. She is married with six children ranging in age from 23 months to 25 years old, two of whom are in school. She supports four people. 

Aminata has been selling clothing for seven years. She buys her stock at the local market. She wants to purchase 20 dozen pieces of clothing for women and children. 

Aminata plans to save her profits. Her goals are to expand her activity and to improve her children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 20 dozen pieces of clothing for women and children.

loans.name: Jobita Magdalena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 22 De Noviembre se reúne cada quince días en un sector conocido como El Guabito de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar de gente amable,  trabajadora y dedicada  a sus familias.
En este lugar vive la señora Jobita, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 1 hijo de 24 años el cual ya es independiente. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Jobita hace varios años construyo una pequeña graja en la finca de su mamá, allí ella se dedica a la cría de pollos, ella compra los pollos pequeños para luego alimentarlos y cuidarlos por tres meses tiempo necesario para que estén listos para la venta,  vende a los vecinos del lugar o entregarlos a los comerciantes. Es así como ella se gana algo que les sirve para salir adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus actividades en el campo.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los pollos. Lleva 4 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios adicionales que ofrece la institución como el seguro médico gratuito. Sus sueños son seguir contando con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
The “22 De Noviembre” (“22nd of November”) loan group meets every fifteen days in an area known as “El Guabito” in the city of Portoviejo. This place has people that are friendly, hard working, and family oriented.

In this place, lives Mrs. Jobita. She is 44 years old, is married, and, from this relationship, has a 24-year-old son, who is independent. Her husband works in agriculture.

Many years ago, Jobita build a small farm on her mother’s land. There, she is dedicated to raising chickens. She buys small chickens, feeds them, and raises them for three months, which is the time needed for them to be ready to sell. Finally, she sells them to neighbors or delivers them to merchants. In this way, she earns an income that is used to go forward, since her husband doesn’t earn very much through his farm work.

This loan is to buy food and medicines for the chickens. She has spent 4 loan cycles with the loan group. She lives it because of the additional services that the institution offers, such as free health insurance. 

Her dreams are to continue counting on the help of the loans.

loans.use: to buy food and medicines for her chickens.

loans.name: Sohiba

texts.en: Sohiba is from the city of Dushanbe. She is just 21 years old. She was born and raised here. Sohiba is married and has a child. She is a sweet and responsible woman who has always known how to maintain comfort, warmth and convenience at home for her family. Sohiba does not have a higher education, but she has the talent of sewing women's national dresses. She can sew a simple one in a day, even though she needs to manage the house and look after her child. Sohiba finds time to do everything. She wants to take a loan to buy a sewing machine and other sewing accessories. Sohiba has decided to increase her income and improve living conditions for her child.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and increase her income.

loans.name: Golib

texts.ru:
Голиб добродушный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 34 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Со своей семьёй Голиб живут в сельском посёлке. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Голиб занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении 10 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуру, а также выращивает картошку. Затем, когда собирает урожай, вывозит на большой базар и там продаёт свой урожай. Раньше он занимался деканством и потом решил реализовывать свой урожай.
 Сейчас Голиб хочет расширить бизнес, именно по выращиванию сельхозкультуры. Но сейчас у него недостаточно собственных денежных средств, чтобы закупить семена для посева урожая. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для закупа семян для посева. Голиб очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Golib is a kind-hearted and hard-working 34-year-old man. He is married and has three children. Golib lives with his family in a rural area. Golib runs a business in order to get income to live on. For ten years now he has been cultivating crops and growing potatoes. When he has gathered his harvest, he transports it to a big market and sells it there. Previously he had a mid-sized farm and decided to sell his own harvest.

Now Golib wants to expand his business, specifically crop growing. But he does not have enough funds now to buy seeds to sow. He has therefore applied to Arvand for a loan to buy the seeds. Golib is very hopeful of a positive result, and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow crops.

loans.name: Noemi Mirian

texts.es:
Noemi es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo varón de 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de zumos y jugos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ que se encuentra en un proceso de urbanización acelerada, principalmente producto de asentamientos humanos y por la presencia de la pequeña y mediana industria, así como de microempresas. De clima templado, similar al de la ciudad, durante el invierno las precipitaciones son raras, en verano las temperaturas varían entre10-19 grados centígrados.
Noemi es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la disfruta junto a su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia; compuesta por 2 cuartos construidos de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba eléctrica, no cuenta con alcantarillado, no tiene vidrios en las ventanas ni en la cocina, baño y lavandería no tiene agua. Su negocio es la venta de zumos y jugos, los zumos más populares son los de zanahoria, también es muy consumido el batido de bicervecina, que es una mezcla de cerveza negra con huevo y azúcar, batido en licuadora y es muy popular porque es una bebida reconstituyente. “los jugos y zumos son muy consumidos debido a que gran parte de la zona no cuenta con agua potable…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de agua potable para los usos de la vida diaria. Su sueño es instalar agua potable en su hogar para que su familia viva en mejores condiciones, ella desea realizar la conexión de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para dejar de beber agua sucia de pozo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Noemi solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable, en su cocina, baño y lavandería para dejar de beber agua sucia de pozo y mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Noemi is a 30 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has an 8 year old son. Her business is selling zumos [pure fruit juice] and juices [fruit juice made with water or milk]. She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, consistent, responsible and very hard working. 

She started her business in the Sacaba area which is in the process of quickly becoming urbanized mainly due to people settling in and the presence of small and medium industries and micro-enterprises. It has a temperate climate similar to the city. It rarely rains during the winter and in the summer the temperature varies between 10-19 degrees Celsius.

Noemi has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair loosely worn. She is short with a medium physique. Her mother tongue is Quechua which she speaks at home and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for business purposes. She enjoys her life with her partner who works as a builder and with her son who studies at school. They live in their own home which consists of two rooms built of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof. It has electricity and well water drawn by an electric pump. They do not have a sewer system nor glass in the windows and there is no water in the kitchen, bathroom or laundry room. 

Her business is selling zumos and juices. The most popular zumos are carrot. Bicervecinas are also consumed a lot which is a mixture of dark beer with egg and sugar mixed in the blender. It is very popular because it is restorative. “Juices and zumos are consumed frequently because a large part of the area does not have drinking water,” she comments. 

The advantage of her business is that she continually has customers. The disadvantage is the lack of drinking water for everyday life. Her dream is to install drinking water in her house so her family will live under better conditions. She wants to get a water connection in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room so they can stop drinking the dirty well water.

This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the twelve years she has been in business. It is for these reasons that Noemi is asking for a loan to install drinking water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room so they can stop drinking dirty well water in order to improve their health.

loans.use: to install drinking water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room in order to stop drinking dirty well water and improve her health

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plots for tree planting for more income gain.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 08 Janvier 1997 lors de son inauguration. Depuis lors le groupement a atteint 34  cycles dans le programme des bancs villageois. Les femmes sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué par les notables du village. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata (debout  à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve âgée de 71 ans  et a en charge 19 enfants dont ses petits fils. Elle est une femme très respectée au sein du groupe et est membre du comité de gestion. Elle fait du commerce de denrées alimentaires. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés centraux pour revendre en détails chez elle. 

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 01 sac de riz à 13000f, du sucre à 27000f de l’huile de palme à 15000f 02 sachets de 100 bouillon à 1250 f l’un pour le revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices, elle les utilise en partie pour augmenter son épargne et appuyer ses enfants et petits enfants dans les charges scolaires, la nourriture, l’habillement et les soins médicaux.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was created and inaugurated on January 8, 1997. The group has since completed 34 loan cycles with the program. The women in this group share a bond of solidarity and team spirit which is praised by the village leaders. Their main business activity is small trade. 

Mrs. Fatoumata (standing at the far right and raising her hand) is the group’s featured borrower. She is a 71-year-old widowed mother supporting 19 children, some of whom are her grandsons. She is well respected within the group and sits on the management committee. She sells foodstuffs, acquiring merchandise at the central markets to retail from her home. 

She will use this loan to buy one sack of rice for 13,000f, some sugar for 27,000f, some palm oil for 15,000f, and two 100-unit packets of bouillon for 1,250f apiece to sell. 

She will use her profits to bolster her savings and to support her children and grandchildren’s tuition, and to provide for their needs in food, clothing, and medical care.

loans.use: to buy one sack of rice for 13,000f, some sugar for 27,000f, some palm oil for 15,000f, and two 100-unit packets of bouillon for 1,250f apiece to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of bananas for sale so as to meet the demands of clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase saw mills for cutting and smoothing timber planks

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor is from Noyemberyan town. He lives with his parents and brother. Both Gor and his brother are students in the university, while their parents work in a private company and try to sustain the family's living. 

Gor specializes in medical studies and dreams of becoming a doctor. 

Gor now asks lenders to support him with paying his university tuition. He hopes to receive lenders' support, continue his studies and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is 27 years old and from Minia. She is married to a farmer and has two children. Maha insisted on giving her children a proper education, so she started a grocery store project to help her husband with the family income and afford a proper education for her children. 

The project became very successful, which encouraged Noura to expand her project and start selling products to smaller grocery stores. So she requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy products such as oil, rice, sugar and pasta to increase her sales and her monthly income for her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery products such as oil, rice, sugar and pasta.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy speakers and two screens for soccer viewers.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
Bashorat is a cheerful woman. She was born into a family of workers in 1961. She is living in the northern part of Tajikistan with her family. She is divorced and has three children. She has higher education in medicine. She is a psychologist by her major.

But recently, she has been busy sewing medical coats. She has done her business for 15 years. She is satisfied to do this business and has permanent customers among hospital workers.

She is well known at IMON and has a good credit history. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to treat her daughter in hospital. She hopes that her daughter will be healthy. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to treat her daughter in hospital.

loans.name: Juana Paola

texts.es:
Juana es una muchacha de 20 años, es casada tiene una linda hija de tres años, vive junto a su hermosa familia en Totonicapán.
Juana para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la carpintería desde hace cuatro años, para ella es una labor es muy digna.
Juana gracias a la dedicación y amor con la que fábrica, sus muebles, tiene mucha clientela, es por eso que ahora requiere de más materiales como madera y máquina para carpintería, pero ella no cuenta con el dinero suficiente por tal motivo solicita un crédito  para poder adquirir sus materiales y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes.
Juana sueña que su carpintería se más grande y que sea reconocida nacionalmente.
texts.en:
Juana is a 20 year old young woman.  She is married and has a lovely three-year-old daughter and lives with her beautiful family in Totonicapán.

Juana has been making furniture for four years so she can earn an income and support her family.  It’s a very respectable job for her.

Thanks to her dedication and love with which she makes her furniture, she has many customers so she needs more supplies such as lumber and tools, but she doesn’t have enough money, so she is asking for a loan to buy materials and better satisfy her customers’ needs.

Juana dreams of having a bigger, nationally known furniture workshop.

loans.use: to buy lumber and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle so as to offer better transportation

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, where she serves neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients, which in combination with perishable goods can lead to losses.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat/oil. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat/oil.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bawa Rumi Village. Lawal joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Lawal will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Lawal now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle so as to offer better, faster, and more effective transportation services to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk to supply to her clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a printing machine for her husband

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is a 44-year-old married woman from Tbilisi city, the capital of Georgia. She lives with her husband, who is a private artisan and earns approximately 600 GEL. He is the only breadwinner in the family. 

Raisa has a great desire to start her own business and add to the family's welfare. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. She decided to start a clothing-trading business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. With the loan of 2000 Gel, Raisa will purchase stock of used clothing at a wholesale price and open a shop in a good location in town. 

With the support of the Start Up program Raisa will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle her financial difficulties as well as expand the business in the future. Raisa awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a used clothing shop

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a small house. Mohammad wants to improve himself and be independent, so he wants to start selling toys in the city. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy toys and a stall to start his own business. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve his family's conditions.

Mohammad appears in the photo next to his toy stall.

loans.use: to buy toys and a stall to start his own business.

loans.name: Ntembe

texts.en:
Ntembe is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Ntembe operates a grocery vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is 21 years old and is from Minia. Her husband works in pre-painting preparations and is the only breadwinner of the family. They have a son and a daughter.

Eman decided to start a small restaurant project in a room she prepared in her house, but she can't afford to buy cooking equipment and raw materials needed to start the project.

Therefore, she requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy raw materials and cooking equipment to start her project and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and cooking equipment.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 28 years old and is from Minia. He is married to a housewife and has one son. He has been working in pre-painting preparations for 10 years and has a lot of experience in this field.

Mustafa dreams of substituting his old tools with new and modern ones. Therefore, he requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy modern, quick and easy-to-use tools to expand his business and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy modern, quick and easy-to-use tools.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is an active woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1976. She lives in a district with her family. She is married and has three children. She is a responsible, honest and gentle person.

She participated in a three-day training seminar provided by IMON to startup clients. She got a business plan for the business she wants to open: a grocery store in her area. She will help residents access everyday necessary products.

Samira asked for a loan to start her business and buy grocery products. She hopes to be supported and thus to have a business for feeding her family. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to sell

loans.name: Ajayb

texts.en:
Ajayb is 57 years old, married, and has six children. One of her sons (in the photo) has been running a nursery business selling flowers and plants for many years. 

Ajayb requested a loan from Murabaha for 30,000 PKR, which her son will use to purchase more seeds of different flowers, new plants, and pots. He wishes to use part of the revenues on the expansion of his business and wishes to spend part of the income on the betterment of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase flowers seeds and plants and pots for her son's business.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 35-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of purchasing and selling animals for many years, with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

Currently she has availed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more animals to grow her business. She wishes to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to grow her business.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nut business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  


With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Jennybeb

texts.en:
32-year-old Jennybeb is from Badian, Cebu. She is married with two children ages two and 10. She has been raising hogs for two years now to help her husband.

Jennybeb is requesting a loan to continue giving her hogs the feed required to fatten them. She will use the loan to buy quality feed as well as new piglets to raise to increase her income. She hopes that from the proceeds of her business she can successfully send her children to school for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Ade. Ade lives in North Bogor, located about a 1 hour 30 minute drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her two children (one daughter and one son). Ade owns a stall where she sells daily consumer products, small snacks and mobile airtime credits for her community. She wanted to join Ruma because as a woman, she wants to help her husband improve their life and learn about how to manage another business opportunity, as well as contribute more to her community. Her community sees Ade as a kind and gentle woman, as well as a trusted and friendly mobile provider. That's why it's so easy for her to attract many customers. 

As the business grows, Ade is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Ade improve her business and accordingly, her community, who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Ade is the one who is standing in front of her small stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 34-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of purchasing and selling animals for many years, with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

Currently she has availed a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats to grow her business. 

She dreams of providing a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to grow her business.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is a hard-working mother of four from Badian, Cebu. Her husband is a farmer and does not earn much to support their children, who are 10, 11, 12 and 16 years old.

Carmelina started a small sari-sari (variety) store business, but she is struggling to keep it well-stocked. She is asking for a loan to buy items like canned goods, chips, candies, shampoo, detergent, seasoning, noodles and eggs.

The loan will be a big opportunity for her to expand her business to support her children's schooling and to buy healthy meals for the family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, chips, candies, shampoo, detergent, seasoning, noodles and eggs to sell

loans.name: Naseeb

texts.en:
Naseeb is 50 years old and married. Her son (also shown in the photo), some time ago, started a van driving business. He owns one Suzuki van and needs some financial help. 

Therefore, Naseeb has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for her son. He used the amount to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van. 

Naseeb is hopeful that her son’s business will prosper and their standard of living will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of her son's van.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Гулбахор жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 45 лет. Она замужем  и имеет 2-их детей. Она обратилась в Арванд впервые, когда узнала, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Гулбахор живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Она работает в столовой официанткой. Её муж также не имеет образования. Он пастух.
Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, семья Губахор занимается своим бизнесом. Она занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного бизнеса она получает хороший доход.  Сейчас Гулбахор с мужем хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Гулбахор очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is a happy and hardworking 46-year-old woman. She is married and has 2 children. She comes to Arvand for the first time after learning that there was an opportunity to obtain financial support. Gulbahor lives with her family in a rural area. She does not have a college education because she could not attend a university due to financial hardships in her family. She works as a waitress at a cafe. Her husband also does not have a college education. He is a shepherd.

To provide a livable income, Gulbahor's family is involved in their own business. She fattens up and sells cattle, and earns a good income from this business. Now Gulbahor and her husband want to increase their livestock headcount in order to expand their business. This is why she came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock. Gulbahor really hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand her business

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фарогат умная, заботливая женщина в возрасте 42 лет.   У нее неплохой заработок но все же на необходимые условия недостаточны что осуществить все свои мечты.  У нее 3 прекрасных детей и любящий муж.  Вместе с мужем она работает для обеспечения своей семьи. Старшая дочь Фарогат учится в городе Душанбе. Фарогат сотрудничает с Арванд с 2013 года. На этот раз она хотела купить корову и дала заявку на кредит.  Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en: Farogat is a smart and caring 42-year-old woman. She has a decent income, but still not enough to fulfill all of her needs and achieve her dreams. She has 3 beautiful children and a loving husband. Together with her husband, she works hard to provide for her family. Farogat's oldest daughter is a student in Dushanbe. Farogat has been partnering with Arvand since 2013. This time, she wants to buy a cow and requested a loan for this purpose. She thanks Arvand for the support in advance!!!

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Francisco Alberto

texts.es: Francisco de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, tiene mas de 25 años de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder empezar con sus siembras y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is 47 years of age and lives in his own home with his family. He makes a living farming basic grains. He has made a living in that business, which he started with his own resources, for more than 25 years. With what he earns from his sales, he his able to pay for some household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure and to improve the land shown in the photo so that he can begin planting his crops and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure and improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize for selling.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Hadija operates a stall where she sells grocery vegetables. Her stall is at the market and she sells to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Shohida

texts.ru:
Шохида женшина в возрате 56 лет. Она родилась  и выросла  в городе Истаравшан в семьи рабочего. В настоящее время она разведена. Шохида   занимается куплей продажей электро товаров. Товар она привозит с Республики Узбекистан. В месяц она 2-3 раза привозит оптом  товары и сдает в розницу своим клиентам. У неё чистый доход в месяц составляет 1200-1500 сомон.  Шохида  хорошая спокойная женщина. Она живет  со своими детьми. Её сыновья уже взрослые. Они работают на стройке.
 У неё есть мечта, Шохида хочет построить большой дом для своей семьи. Но для этого её необходимы денежные средства. То, что она зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе построение нового дома. Поэтому Шохида обратилась в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Шохида надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Shohida is a 56-year-old woman, She was born and raised in a working-class family in the town of Istaravshan. She is currently divorced. Shohida is involved in reselling electrical goods. She brings in the merchandise wholesale from the Uzbekistan Republic 2-3 times per month and sells it retail to her customers. Her monthly net income amounts to 1200-1500 somoni. Shohida is a good and calm woman. She lives with her children. Her sons are already grown and work at a construction site.

Shohida has a dream. She wants to build a big house for her family, but needs money to achieve this dream. What she earns is not enough to allow her to build a new house. This is why Shohida requested a loan from Arvand to buy construction materials in order to build her house. Shohida hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a new house for her family

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr: Kadiatou qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang au centre, et qui  est debout , elle tiens la pochette myAgro, porte un T-shirt multicouleur, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivent et travaillent dans le village de Ticko au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Kadiatou, âgée de 37 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants âgés de 6 à 14ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Kadiatou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30ans. Kadiatou cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et d'engrais de qualité. Kadiatou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement  et des semences de qualité . Cette année Kadiatou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro des semences et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0,25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30ans que Kadiatou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Kadiatou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Kadiatou espère aussi pouvoir faire du commerce.
texts.en:
Kadiatou, appearing in the middle and standing in the second row, holding a myAgro pouch, and wearing a multi-colored T-shirt, is a member of a group of seven farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Ticko, southwest of Bamako, in Mali. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, aged 6 to 14, of whom three are currently in school. 

Kadiatou is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. Thus, she was encouraged to do this work for 30 years. She grows peanuts on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain and of quality fertilizers. 

Kadiatou is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment system and the quality seeds. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her parcel of 0.25 hectare. She has been growing peanuts for 30 years for its commercial value, since peanuts are a food she sells on the market due to the advantages of growing them as much as trade in them. 

With greater yields and higher income, Kadiatou is planning on buying some farm supplies and equipment. Ultimately, she hopes also to be able to work in commerce.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Sostenible Group

texts.es:
El grupo “SOSTENIBLE” se encuentra conformada por mujeres trabajadoras y responsables. Este grupo está emprendiendo su segundo ciclo. Este es el segundo crédito de Sonia de 45 años, ella nos comenta que gracias a su crédito anterior realizó las compras  de sus insumos y hubo mayor ingreso para solventar los gastos de su hogar. El nuevo crédito que adquirió lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para sus ventas como vasos descarta bles cucharas y un nuevo tablero de mazamorras para que su menor hijo por las tardes le apoye en las ventas de sus dulces. Sonia es la primera persona que esta a lado izquierdo de la foto viste polo color verde.
El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
The group "Sostenible" is made up of hard-working and responsible women. This group is beginning their second loan cycle. 

This is the second loan for 45-year-old Sonia. She tells us that thanks to her previous loan, she was able to purchase her supplies and had a higher income to pay for her household expenses. She will invest the new loan that she acquired in the purchase of materials for her sales like disposable cups, spoons, and a new mazamorra (a pudding-like dessert) table so that her youngest son can help her with the sales of her desserts in the afternoons. 

Sonia is the first person on the left side of the photo dressed in a green t-shirt. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan provided.

loans.use: to buy materials (disposable cups and spoons) and a new table-top.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is a married woman with three young kids. She raises and sells hogs. She has been raising hogs for quite few years now. Aside from that, she also works as barangay clerk in her community. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. Her husband works as a carpenter.

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and supplements. With these inputs, she will be able to raise and sell healthy hogs, and she will be able to slowly improve and expand her business.

Celeste hopes that she will be able to manage her hog raising business to become more sustainable and also to continue send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk supply to clients to meet their needs and those of her family

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a 34-year-old married man with two children (a one-year-old and a three-year-old) living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a produce buyer and owns a retail shop selling electronics where he earns additional income for his family needs. He started these businesses with the purpose of earning income. 

The loan purpose is for Sam to buy coffee and maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy coffee and maize for selling.

loans.name: Aghavnik

texts.en: Aghavnik is 61 years old and she lives in the city of Kapan in the Syunik region. She has a vocational medical education and it has already been 30 years that she has worked at the city hospital as a nurse. Aghavnik is married and she has two daughters and a son. Her daughters are married and they live with their families. Her son is also married and he lives with his family in his parents’ house. Aghavnik is a very active woman and as she mentions, usually her work all day long at the hospital never makes her tired and she does her work with great pleasure. Unfortunately she cannot say at this moment that she has the same activeness and she feels some weakness and is unhealthy. She is asking for this loan in order to have a medical examination and solve her health problems.

loans.use: to have a medical examination and solve her health problems.

loans.name: Kilanga

texts.en:
Kilanga is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over seven years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of dry fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of dry fish for resale

loans.name: Ferawati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Ferawati. Ferawati lives in North Bogor, located about a one hour and thirty minute drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her only child. Ferawati owns a stall where she sells daily consumer products, small snacks and mobile airtime credits for her community. She joined Ruma in 2014. She wanted to join Ruma because as a woman, she wants to help her husband improve their life, to learn about how to manage another business opportunity, and to be able to contribute more to her community. Her community sees Ferawati as a humble and kind woman, as well as an informative mobile service provider.

As the business grows, Ferawati is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Knowing about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Ferawati improve her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Ferawati is the one who is standing in front of her own small stall. She will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity and water) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bawa Rumi Village. She joined Babban Gona to increase her wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags.  Despite her small farm, Habiba hopes to harvest 30 bags of maize this year. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Habiba now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her extra earnings to ensure that her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farming yields.

loans.name: Ekram

texts.en: Ekram is a 47-year-old single woman living alone who has been working for four years at her house selling homemade foods such as pickles, thyme and oil to meet the needs of life and living in an appropriate way. Ekram is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to ameliorate her business merchandise to give the best product to her clients. She is very certain that she will sell all products and expand her business area. She hopes that in the future, she might open her own store and attract more customers.

loans.use: to ameliorate her business merchandise

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran, 34 years old, lives in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region with his wife and two children. Tigran buys cars and spare parts from Georgia and sells them in the Lori region, a business he has had for seven years. It is the family's sole source of income.

Tigran is happy about qualifying for his second Kiva loan. The first loan greatly developed his business, and he hopes his second one will also have a good results. This time he wants to buy a computer and a printer. This will be a great help for him, as he will be able to go online to find cars which he will buy to resell.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a printer

loans.name: Shilingi

texts.en:
Shilingi is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has owned a food stall business where she serves neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients, which along with the perishability of her goods can lead to losses.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat/oil. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat/oil.

loans.name: Yaú

texts.en: Yaú is a Babban Gona farmer from Yanoko Village. Yaú joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yaú  will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds. His loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Yaú would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud, 24 years old, is from Minia. He is married to a housewife and has two children. He used to work in construction but he couldn't continue his work due to his health problems. Mahmoud started a small grocery store project to cover his family's monthly expenses and satisfy their basic needs. The demands of his customers increased and he did not want to alienate his customers so he requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy more grocery products such as oil, rice, pasta and sugar.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products such as oil, rice, pasta and sugar.

loans.name: Margoin Yackeline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza.
En este lugar vive la señora Margoin, tiene  43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos de 27, 25, 18 y 4 años de edad, los dos menores  estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña Margoin es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así lograr sus ingresos para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, vende productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), ella sale a vender por la localidad en sus ratos libres. La mayor parte del crédito se la da a su esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos tales como leche, queso, yogurt, mantequilla, así como también maní, salprietra entre otros, el sale a entregar en su carro por la ciudad y los domingos también instala un pequeño puesto en el mercado local, ella le ayuda en este día ya que es cuando más venden, llevan 10 años que se dedican a esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar productos Yanbal, leche, queso, yogurt, mantequilla entre otros. Lleva 9 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos salen adelante. Sus sueños son tener un local.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for a long time as the city of the royal tamarind due to the great quantity of this fruit that existed at one time, the members of the Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza (Credit Group Women with Hope) meet once a fortnight.

Margoin lives here, she is 43 years old, married and has four children from this relationship who are 27, 25, 18 and four years old. The two youngest study at university and at school. Her husband is a merchant.

Margoin is a woman who likes to be independent and achieve an income to help with the costs of running the home. She sells Yanbal products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories) and goes out to sell them in the local area in her free time. 

The majority of the loan she will give to her husband, who sells dairy products like milk, cheese, yoghurt and butter as well as peanuts, salprieta (a condiment made from toasted corn, peanuts and herbs) amongst other items. He makes deliveries in the city by car and on Sundays he also has a small stall in the local market. Margoin helps him on Sundays as this is when they sell the most. They have been doing this for 10 years.

This loan will be used to buy Yanbal products, milk, cheese, yoghurt and butter amongst other items. Margoin has been in the Credit Group for 9 years and she likes it because with the loans they manage to move forward. Her dream is to have a shop.

loans.use: to buy Yanbal (beauty) products, milk, cheese, yoghurt and butter etc.

loans.name: Munavvarjon

texts.en:
Munavvarjon is a skillful woman. She was born in a family of workers in 1969. She is living in northern part of Tajikistan in a small town of beautiful nature and hospitable people. She is married and has one child. She has many years of experience doing business at home, like sewing traditional mattress called “Kurpacha”. She sews accurately and has permanent clients among friends and neighbors. She also sews traditional textile sewing called “Kurokduzi,” which is a national pendant for decoration or tablecloth in holidays. 

Unfortunately, her house needs to be repaired because the living condition is bad and taking orders there from customers is not convenient. She is asking a loan from Kiva and IMON to repair her house. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en: Ararat lives in Kapan city of the Syunik region. He lives here happily with his beloved wife with whom he is seriously engaged in beekeeping. He is rather skilled in this field since he has had honey production starting from 1976. Now Ararat has a lot of bee families and each season he sells a great quantity of honey to his neighbors and also to his number of regular customers. During these years he has become very famous for his farm honey, since it is very tasty and healing, and as he says there are a lot of people among his customers who buy his farm’s honey for different treatments. Now Ararat will use this loan to purchase wax papers, frames and also special medicine for his bees and beekeeping work.

loans.use: to purchase wax papers, frames and also special medicine for his bees and beekeeping work.

loans.name: Maria Twegatte Group

texts.en:
Maria Twegatte Group is situated in the Golo Kayabwe Mpigi district. They deal in fishing and fish trading. The group is headed by Hellen, who employs fishmongers to carry out the business efficiently. She sells the fish in a market in Busega. 

The group members acquired loans to boost their businesses. Hellen will specifically use the loan to buy fish to sell so that she can meet the demands of her customers, since she has assured clientele. The group members appreciate the support of Kiva and UGAFODE.

loans.use: To boost her fish business by buying fish to sell

loans.name: Riyan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Riyan. Riyan lives in North Bogor, located about a one hour and thirty minute drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Riyan is a young guy who has a big spirit to become an entrepreneur. He owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to expand business in technology, as well as to contribute more to his community who needs access to such services. He also feels happy he joined Ruma because for him, Ruma’s services is the best. His community sees Riyan as a responsible and hardworking young guy, as well as a good mobile service provider.

As the business grows, Riyan is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, especially on weekends. As seen in the photo, Riyan is the one who is standing  in front of his own small stall. He will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
