Vicente es ahora un hombre de 62 años que se encuentra profundamente agradecido por el crédito anterior, porque gracias a ello logro comprar sus semillas de papa y todos sus insumos, también cuenta que gracias a las ganancias que obtuvo logro mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Vicente ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar abono químico para el cultivo de cebolla.
El gran sueño de Vicente es comprar más terrenos para luego heredarlos a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vicente, age 62, is profoundly grateful for the previous loan.  Thanks to the loan he managed to buy potato seeds and all of his supplies.  He also says that thanks to the earnings that he got. he managed to improve his family’s living conditions.

Vicente is now requesting a new loan in order to be able to buy chemical fertilizer for his onion crop.

Vicente’s big dream is to buy more land in order to be able to pass it on to his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his onion crop.

loans.name: Mastonai

texts.ru: Эту самостоятельную и целеустремленную девушку зовут Мастонаи. Она 22 летняя жительница района Хамадони. Мастонаи живет вместе отцом, матерью и братишкой. Два года назад Мастонаи начала свой маленький бизнес, чтобы помочь папе обеспечить семью. Она начала изучать профессию швеи, чтобы зарабатывать таким путем для улучшения условий жизни семьи. Мастонаи быстро освоила эту деятельность. Ей сейчас в работе помогает мама. Она сейчас берет кредит, чтобы поменять швейную машинку, потому что нынешняя швейная машинка устарела. Это кредит поможет ей приобрести швейную машинку и расширить бизнес. Мастонаи обратилась к Вам за кредитом, потому что она верит в Вас, и вы ее не подводите.
texts.en: The name of this independent and driven young woman is Mastonai. She is a 22-year-old resident of the Hamadoni district. Mastonai lives with her father, mother and brother. Mastonai started her own small business two years ago to help her father provide for the family. She began to learn the seamstress profession to earn a living and improve her family's life. Mastonai mastered this trade very quickly. Her mother currently helps her with work. She is requesting this loan to replace her sewing machine because her current machine is old. This loan will help her buy a sewing machine and expand her business. Mastonai came to You for the loan because she believes and relies on You.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and expand her business

loans.name: Muhiba

texts.en: Muhiba is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is living in a small town that has pretty seasonal scenery and generous people. She is a widow and has three children. She is a responsible, gentle and communicative person. She has a higher education, but unfortunately, because of difficult situations in her life she has to do a business in order to feed and provide for her family. She is busy buying and selling vegetables and fruits. She appealed to IMON and asked for help to buy an assortment of vegetables and fruits. She is planning to do her business well and earn money to provide the family's needs such as food and clothing and raise her children. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Oom

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Oom. Oom lives in North Bogor, located about 1 hour and 30 minutes' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her two children. Oom owns a stall where she sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She wanted to join Ruma because as a woman, she wants to help her husband improve their life and learn how to manage another business opportunity, as well as contribute more to her community. Oom is a kind and hardworking woman and her community sees her as a trusted and informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, Oom is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Oom improve her business and accordingly, her community, who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Oom is the one who is sitting in her home. She will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for selling to community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Kosimjon

texts.ru: 25 летный молодой воспитанный человек Косимчон. Он женат, но пока не имеет детей. У него не очень большая семья. Косимчон, живет вместе отцом, матерью, женой и братом. В семье работает Косимчон и его брат. Чтобы прокормить семью Косимчон начал заниматься перевозом грузов. У него есть Моторола, с помощью Моторолы он зарабатывает, и обеспечить семью.  У него есть постоянные клиенты который, Косимчон часто возить товар на рынке. Сейчас его Моторола сломался, данный момент он не может зарабатывать. Он хочет отремонтировать Моторолу, но у него нет достаточного сумма денег, по этой причине он обратился за кредитом. За счет кредита он купить запчасти для ремонта. Косим, надеется на Вашу поддержку. Запрашиваемый  кредит поможет ему не потерять источник дохода и скорее начать свою работу.
texts.en: Kosimjon is a 25-year-old young and well-raised person. He is married, but does not yet have children. He does not have a big family. Kosimjon lives with his father, mother, wife and brother. Kosimjon and his brother are the only ones working in the family. To provide for his family, Kosimjon got involved in transportation. He has a Motorola motorcycle, with the help of which he earns a living and provides for the family. He has regular clients, to whom Kosimjon delivers goods at a market. Now his Motorola has broken down and he can no longer earn a living. He wants to repair his Motorola, but does not have enough money and requested a loan for this purpose. He will use this loan to buy spare parts for the repair. Kosimjon relies on Your support. The requested loan will help him retain his income source and resume his work faster.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his Motorola motorcycle

loans.name: Placida Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza.
En este lugar vive la señora Placida, tiene 46 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  10 años el cual estudia en escuela. Su esposo es infante de marina.
Doñas Plácida es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y así sentirse independiente y  con sus ganancias colaborar con los arreglos de su hogar, ella se dedica al comercio,  vende de ropa colombiana la cual es muy solicitada por sus clientes, también vende  joyas de plata y bisuterías, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque la mayoría de sus prendas ella las vende en su casa, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 5 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganar lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, joyas de plata y bisuterías. Esta casi desde el inicio  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for a long time as the city of the royal tamarind due to the great quantity of this fruit that there was at one time, the Communal Bank Mujeres Con Esperanza (Women with Hope) meets every fortnight.

Placida lives here, she is 46 years old, she lives in a common law relationship and has a son of 10 years old who studies at school. Her husband is a Marine.

Placida is a women who likes to earn her own money and so feel independent and contribute to the costs of running the home. She earns a living though commerce, selling Columbian clothing which is in great demand from her customers. She also sells silver and costume jewellery. She sells from door to door although she sells most of the clothes from her home, she sells on credit and collects every week or fortnight. She has has this business for five years which has allowed her to earn her own income for the good of her family. 

This loan is to buy clothing, silver and costume jewellery. She has been in the communal bank almost from the start, and she likes it because the loans are fast. Her dream is to give her son the best in life.

loans.use: to buy clothes, silver jewellery and costume jewellery.

loans.name: Misnawi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Misnawi. Misnawi lives in Depok, a suburban area located about a one hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only daughter. Misnawi owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined Ruma last year. He decided to join Ruma because he wanted to learn how to start up a business using technology. Misnawi is a hardworking man and his community sees him as a friendly and trustworthy mobile provider.

As the business grows, Misnawi needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community, so his community can connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to his community who needs access to such services. Misnawi’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for his community using Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Misnawi is the one who is sitting in his stall. He is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia, age 51, is living in Lahore, Pakistan. Safia lives with her husband, four sons and two daughters. Safia has to look after her children all day long along with the help of her daughters. Her son used to work at the lathe machine but now he has to buy some new tools for the machine to work efficiently. So Safia applied for the loan so that her son can continue working and expanding their income. Safia is thankful to the Kiva team and its partner.

loans.use: to pay for tools for her son to work on the lathe machine

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a Babban Gona farmer from Galadima Mayau Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Isah no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farm land. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, increasing his income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona, Isah now has the chance to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields and thus profits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional material to make shoes, including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc. for her son's business.

loans.name: Gul Nargis

texts.en:
Gul Nargis is a 53-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband. He has been running a nursery business (flowers and plants) for many years. 

For the growth of her husband’s business, she has requested a loan from Murabaha of 30,000 PKR. It allows her husband to purchase more seeds of different flowers along with new plants and flowerpots. He wishes to use part of the revenues on the expansion of his business and wishes to spend part of the income on the betterment of his family members.
f

loans.use: to purchase more seeds of different flowers along with new plants and flowerpots, to increase his flowers business

loans.name: Masozi School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Florence. She is the Director of Masozi Nursery & Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Bweyogerere in Wakiso with 200 students. Masozi School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. 

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Masozi School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Florence ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 39 year old married woman. She lives with her husband and five children who are attending school. Due to difficult economic conditions, Zeinab is obliged to work continually, as she is responsible for supporting her husband with their family expenses. 

She opened a shop since 2011 where she sells scarves and accessories. She provides her customers good quality products. She is satisfied with what she has attained so far, although she wishes to enhance her family’s way of living even more. Today, she’s asking or a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l, to purchase merchandises and to renovate the shop. In the future, she plans to borrow additional loans with the aim to develop her work.

loans.use: to purchase scarves and accessories for sale in her shop and also to renovate it to increase sales and help the family

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit lives with her husband and son Hayk in Armavir town. Her son is a student in medical university and dreams of becoming a dentist. 
Both Margarit and her husband work hard to earn income for family's living. Their salary allows them to cover household costs, but is not enough to save for Hayk's education. 

Margarita Has applied for this loan to ask lenders for the support. The whole family hopes to receive the help and give Hayk an opportunity to make his dreams come true.

loans.use: to pay for her son Hayk's university tuition in dentistry

loans.name: Basiya

texts.en: Basiya, 47 years old, is a very enthusiastic person. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a general store. He offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, he needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. For this reason, Basiya has requested a loan from Murabaha of 30,000 PKR for her husband, who will buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, he will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at his store and improve his earnings

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for his store, including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to improve his earnings and aid the family

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bawa Rumi Village. Saratu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Saratu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her gain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Saratu now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en:
Akhtar is 39 years old, married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) is an electrician by profession. He repairs different electronic products in his locality and earns good amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

Now he needs to cater to more customers. For this reason, Akhtar has applied a loan of 25,000 PKR for her husband as he required purchasing different wires, switches, charges and cables for catering to more customers and increase his net income.

loans.use: to purchase different wires, switches, charges and cables for her husband's business to increase his net income.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 36-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four school-aged children. 

Due to bad financial conditions, Siham and her husband must work together to fulfill their family's needs. In 2013, Siham decided to open a shop where she sells a variety of used shoes at good prices. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to purchase shelves and a new collection of shoes. The loan will allow Siham to improve her business operations and increase her sales and revenue.

loans.use: to purchase shelves and a new collection of shoes and

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is 33 years old and he lives with his wife, children and parents in Vanadzor city in the Lori region.  Vardan has a specialty as an architect but he is in the trading business now. 

Vardan works at a private company as a driver and distributor of different candies and sweets. He takes orders from nearly 300 food markets and these are markets not only in his region, but also markets in the Tavush region. Since being very active and clever Vardan manages also to gain a lot of new market owners that also give him large orders. Vardan works without holidays in order to cover all his orders. 

Vardan asks this loan as he wants to buy a computer which he will use for making his daily list of markets for visits, and also to note there each day the amount of debts that some markets have. He also wants to take part in a course of computer skills, so that he will work skillfully and quickly.

loans.use: to buy a computer and to take part in a course of computer skills so he can utilize it well for his business

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad  is 35 years old, married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 4 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from the Kashf Foundation, so now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income and to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 45-year-old married woman. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she purchased buffaloes and began selling their milk. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. 

Sakina is happily supporting her family with the income she generates. She is requesting a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income

loans.name: Tening's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 08 Janvier 1997 lors de son inauguration. Depuis lors le groupement a atteint 34  cycles dans le programme des bancs villageois. Les femmes sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué par les notables du village. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame Tening  (debout à l’extrême droit avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans mariée et mère 02 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de denrées alimentaires et d’habillements. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés centraux pour le revendre chez elle.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter 01 sac de riz à 13500f, 01 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile raffinée à 25000f, des bouillons, de la moutarde, des biscuits, des boubous et chaussures d’une valeur de 50000 pour le revendre en détails chez elle

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’acheter des chèvres les engraissées pour les revendre plus tard, améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en renforçant la nourriture et en leurs achetant des fournitures scolaires.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was created and inaugurated on January 8, 1997. The group has since completed 34 loan cycles with the program. The women’s sense of collaboration has helped them to develop a bond of solidarity and team spirit which is praised by the village leaders. Their main business activity is small trade. 

Mrs. Tening (standing at the far right and raising her hand) is the group’s featured borrower. She is a 39-year-old married mother to two daughters. She sells foodstuffs and clothing, acquiring merchandise at the central markets and selling from her home. 

She will use this loan to buy one sack of rice at 13,500f, one 20-liter bottle of refined oil at 25,000f as well as bouillons, mustard, cookies, boubous and shoes for 50,000f to retail from her home. 

She plans to use her profits to buy goats to fatten and sell, and to better her family’s living conditions by improving their food situation and buying school supplies for the children.

loans.use: to buy one sack of rice at 13,500f, one 20-liter bottle of refined oil at 25,000f as well as bouillons, mustard, cookies, boubous and shoes for 50,000f to retail from her home.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia Eusebia se sigue dedicando al trabaja en una institucion publica y tambien la socia abrio su tienda donde vende ropa como pantalones,blusas y chompas,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es abrir otra tienda de ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar polos,chompas,blusas y pantalones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Eusebia continues working in a public institution and also opened a store where she sells clothing such as pants, blouses and sweaters. Through this business she wants to support her family. Eusebia dreams of opening another clothing store. Eusebia seeks a loan to buy shirts, sweaters, blouses, and pants. She is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy shirts, sweaters, blouses, and pants.

loans.name: Jany Nayaky

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza.
En este lugar vive la señora Jany, tiene 20 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y aun no  tienen hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa constructora.
Doña Jany se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y zapatillas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja casi todos los días, aprovecha las horas de la mañana ya que a esa hora es más fresco y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus conocidos,  tiene mucha clientela ya que les da crédito y cobra cada 8 o 15 días. Lleva más de 4 años con estcomprar ropa ye negocio el cual le permite ganarse sus propios recursos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatillas ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Lleva  1 año en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe en el grupo. Sus sueños son tener un  hijo.
texts.en:
The “Women with Hope” Women's Credit Group meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi – known for many years as the city of regal tamarinds for the large quantity of this fruit that exists there.

Mrs. Jany resides here. She is 20 years old and maintains a common law marriage, As yet, she has no children. Her husband works for a construction enterprise. 

Mrs. Jany sells clothing of all types, as well as shoes, door-to-door. She works almost daily, especially during morning hours, since it is cooler then. Also, she sells her goods from her house when friends visit. She has a large clientele since she offers credit and collects payments every eight to fifteen days. Mrs. Jany has been buying and selling cloths for over four years, and the work has allowed her to earn her own resources.

This loan will be used to purchase clothing and shoes to fill orders she has already received. Mrs. Jany has worked with her Credit Group for one year now and she especially likes the benefits it offers. Her dream is to have a son.

loans.use: buy additional clothing and shoes to sell door-to-door and from her home.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Timoteo es un joven de 22 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Timoteo con el afán de generar sus ingresos y apoyar en la casa con los gastos trabaja como panadero desde hace cinco años.
Timoteo es un joven que le preocupa su futuro es por ello que ahora está priorizando comprar media cuerda de terreno, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero necesario por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para poder adquirir su terreno.
En el futuro sueña con poder construir su propia casa para tener una vida mejor
texts.en:
Timoteo is a young man of 22. He is single, and lives next to his parents in a community in Sololá. With the purpose of generating income and helping out with household expenses, he has been working as a baker for the past 5 years.

Timoteo is invested in his future, and that is why he is prioritizing the purchase of half an acre of land. However, one of the difficulties he has is the lack of necessary funds. It is for this reason he is requesting a loan, so that he may purchase this piece of land.

He dreams of being able to build his own house so that he may have a better life.

loans.use: to buy half an acre of land.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre que se encuentra muy agradecido por el crédito anterior pues gracias a ello logro comprar sus semillas y sus insumos, gracias a Dios le fue muy bien con la cosecha y obtuvo muy buenas ganancias. Juan ahora se ve a la necesidad de solicitar otro préstamo para nuevamente comprar  sus semillas de cebolla y fertilizantes.
Juan sueña con construirles una casa a cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan is a man who is very grateful for the previous loan.  Thanks to it he was able to buy seeds and supplies.  Thanks to God the harvest was very good and he had very good earnings.  Juan is now needing to request another loan to again buy his onion seeds and fertilizers.

Juan dreams of building a house for each one of his children.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La socia Mery se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de boletos turísticos a las diferentes personas del extranjero y también personas nacionales,la socia es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar boletos turísticos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Mery continues with her business. She sells tour tickets to different people, to foreigners and also to nationals. The member is a hard working person and through this business wants to provide for her family. The member is requesting the loan to purchase tour tickets. The member is happy about the loan and promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase tour tickets.

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es:
El socio Rafael Angel se dedica al negocio de transporte,el socio realiza servicio de taxi, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Rafael Angel is in the transportation business with his taxi service.  Through this business he wishes to move forward.  His dream is to be able to buy himself a new taxi.  He is asking for a loan to buy tires for his taxi.

Rafael Angel is happy for the loan and commits to making the loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy tires for his taxi

loans.name: Mosoq Huñukuy Ivanqui Group

texts.es:
La socia Fernanda pertenece al banco comunal MOSOQ HUÑUKUY IVANQUI,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate,provincia de la Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 50 años de edad  es viuda y tiene 4 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abono.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos  por el préstamo y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member, Fernanda, belongs to the community bank MOSOQ HUÑUKUY YVANQUI. The bank is located in the Echarate district, province of Convención and department of Cusco.

The member is a 50 years old widow and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling vegetables. The member has been working in this type of business for a while and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts every day in her business. The member is a responsible and persevering person. The member wants to be able to continue to work in order to support her family. The member requests the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. 

The members are thankful for the loan and promise to make the payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de piñateria,la socia vende artículos de fiestas infantiles como platitos,adornos,globos y cubiertos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar platitos, adornos y globos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member earns her living selling party supplies. She sells articles for children's parties like plates, decorations, balloons, and utensils. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. She has worked in this business for four years and it is going very well for her.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy plates, decorations, and balloons. She is happy about the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy plates, decorations, and balloons

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem has successfully built her business selling material with previous support from Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has now gained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of money to contribute to the family’s income.

Naseem has now applied for another loan, this for 50,000 PKR to buy bundles of cloth in different colors and designs so as to increase her sales and make more in profits.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: flour, yeast, lard, salt, trays, sugar, to make and sell bread.

loans.name: Achwak

texts.en:
Achwak is a 28-year-old woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and does her best to support them through her modest income as a hairdresser. She works in her home and welcomes her customers very pleasantly.

With the aim of acquiring new tools and supplies, Achwak is applying for a 1,575,000 LBP loan through Kiva’s field partner Vitas s.a.l. She looks forward to opening her own beauty salon in the future, where she will also be selling beauty products and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools and supplies

loans.name: Agbégnigan

texts.fr: Agbégnigan un homme de 32ans était revendeur de cartes de cartes de recharge depuis 2007. Le profit tiré de la vente lui a permis d'avoir une autre activité secondaire qui est la vente des portables et d'ordinateurs depuis 2013. Il souhaite réinvestir dans cette seconde activité et subvenir pleinement aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Agbégnigan is a 32-year-old man who has been reselling prepaid phone cards since 2007.  With the profits from his sales, he has been able to develop an additional activity and has now been selling mobile phones and computers since 2013.  He would like to reinvest in this second activity and fully meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, computers and accessories.

loans.name: Jannat

texts.en:
Jannat, fifty, is a hardworking woman with three children. She is very skilled in the art of embroidery, sewing beautiful designs and patterns by hand. She has been using this talent for many years to earn a living, and her skill is known throughout town.

Jannat is applying for a 50,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner Kashf Foundation to buy more beads, threads and frames to meet more orders placed by her customers in good time. Her profits will bring Jannat closer to attaining her dream of providing a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beads, threads and frames for her embroidery work

loans.name: Rotifa

texts.en:
Rotifa is a wise woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1964. She is living in a small town where the common business is processing dried fruits. She is married and has three children. She is well known at IMON and has a good credit story. 

She is a retailer of fruits and dried fruits and buys from the central market and sells to rural markets. Separately, she sews traditional man’s wear and trades in the domestic market. 

For the next trading, she wants to buy dried fruits and resell them in the rural market. She is asking for help to buy fruits and dried fruits. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy fruits and dried fruits

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 45 years old, married, and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has 6 children and 5 of them attend school. Joseph is faced with a challenge of rental bills. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets to roof his residential house. He owns a retail shop of general merchandise since 2013. He also practices farming by growing crops and vegetables for additional income. He is a hard working man faced with a challenge of limited capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to roof his residential house.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household needs.

For over ten years Mesalimu has operated an open-air food business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. The major challenge for her business is poor weather.

Mesalimu decided to join Yehu to access its loans for her business. She is applying for a 40,000 KES loan to buy sacks of wheat and maize flours, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy sacks of wheat and maize flours, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés es un pequeño productor de café que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. Siempre ha estado relacionado con las actividades agrícolas, en particular la producción de café, que es un rubro con alto potencial económico según comenta este emprendedor.

En los últimos años, su cafetal ha sido afectado por plagas y enfermedades propias de este rubro, por lo que se ha propuesto la implementación de un plan de renovación,  que incluye para este ciclo la renovación de 4 manzanas de café, para lo cual está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita comprar los insumos agrícolas que requiere, y lograr restablecer su cafetal para tener mejores rendimientos en los próximos ciclos, y con ello mayores ingresos que le permitirán darle a su familia mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Andres is a small coffee producer who lives in a rural community in northern Nicaragua.  He has always been connected to agricultural activities, in particular the production of coffee.  It is a business with high economic potential, according to this entrepreneur. 

In the last few years, his coffee plantation has been affected by pests and diseases, and thus he has set out to implement a renovation plan.  It includes for this cycle the renovation of 4 manzanas [a land measurement unit equivalent to 1.740 acres] of coffee.

Andres is requesting this financing which will allow him to buy the agricultural supplies that he requires and with this he will be able to re-establish his coffee plantation in order to have improved output in the next cycles.  These greater earnings will permit him to give his family better economic conditions.

loans.use: to increase the productivity of his coffee plantation with the renovation of 4 manzanas [a land measurement unit equivalent to 1.740 acres] of coffee

loans.name: Shahrom Group

texts.en:
This is Shahrom Group. It is composed of Rajabi and Dilbar. They live in the city of Kulob with their families. 

Rajabi is 40 years old. A few years ago she divorced her husband and now lives in her mother`s home. Dilbar is her brother`s wife. She is 32 years old and very kind woman. Together Rajabi and Dilbar are engaged in sewing. 

They are very pleased, because despite the fact that they do not have a higher education, they are able to feed themselves and help the family. The purpose of getting loan is that Rajabi and Dilbar wants to buy more fabrics and thread for sewing of beautiful national women`s dresses. 

Their main problem is lack of money, but they believe that with the kindness of Kiva and its lenders they will solve their problem.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and thread for sewing of beautiful national women`s dresses

loans.name: Gina Ercilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza.
En este lugar vive la señora Gina, tiene 40 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, de  22, 19 y 5 años de edad, los dos menores  estudia en universidad y escuela. Su esposo es cerrajero.
Doñas Gina es una mujer que realiza una diversidad de actividades con la finalidad  de ganarse lo suyo y así ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y para los estudios de sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende de ropa de todo tipo, joyas de plata y productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), ella también realiza trabajos de pintados de uñas y elabora manualidades, cose almohadas con variedad de bordados que se venden muy bien y rápido, ella también realiza talleres en los cuales enseña a varias personas a elabora las manualidades por lo cual cobra una mensualidad y también les vende los materiales con lo cual sus ventas están aseguradas. Lleva 5 años con esta actividad la cual le deja muy buenos ingresos y le encanta a la vez
Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos y otros materiales para manualidades. Lleva más de 2 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years now as the City of the Real Tamarinds due to the great amount of this fruit present at that time, the members of "Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza" [Women With Hope Credit Group] meet every 15 days. In this place lives Gina. She is 40 years old. She's in a common-law marriage and, from this relationship, they have three children of 22, 19, and 15 years of age. The two younger ones study in college and in school. Her husband is a metalsmith.

Gina is a woman that takes up a variety of occupations for the purpose of earning her keep and, this way, helping her husband with the household expenses and for her children's studies. She's in the sales business; she sells clothes of all kind, silver jewelry, and Yanbal products (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumes, and women accesories). She also does nail painting work, makes crafts, and sews pillows with a variety of embroidery that sell very well and fast. She also carries out workshops in which she teaches several people to make the crafts for which she charges a monthly fee. She also sells them the materials, thereby her sales are assured. She's been in this business for 5 years, which leaves her with a very good income, and she loves it at the same time.

This loan is to buy fabrics, thread, and other materials for handicrafts. She's been in the Credit Group for two years and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she funds her business. Her dream is to give the best education to her children.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and other materials for handicrafts.

loans.name: Efrain Jhordan

texts.es:
Efraín, es un joven estudiante que nació en Huánuco. Desde muy pequeño emigró a Lima, junto a sus padres y hermana en busca de un mejor futuro para todos.
Él está estudiando actualmente el cuarto semestre de Mantenimiento de Maquinaria Pesada en SENATI. Le apasiona mucho su carrera porque está muy relacionada con el sector minero, el cual es pagado por el gobierno. Efraín desea ser un profesional competente, darle lo mejor a sus padres y hermana.
Él siente que su carrera le ayudaría mucho en el futuro, porque le brindaría mejores ingresos económicos y cubrirá sus necesidades personales.
Actualmente le va muy bien en sus estudios, pero le falta de dinero para cubrir sus estudios, lo cual es el principal obstáculo por el que está atravesando. Debido a ello, Efraín solicita el apoyo de KIVA para poder culminar exitosamente su carrera.
A Efraín le gustaría trabajar como técnico de componentes hidráulicos, realizando la labor de reparación de los mismos.
El apoyo que le brinda KIVA, le ayudaría a cubrir los gastos de estudios. También, le permitirá ser un profesional de una de las carreras con más demanda y trabajará en lo que más le gusta.
Efraín dice: Me siento muy agradecido y afortunado al saber que personas como las que trabajan en KIVA me brindan este apoyo, es una gran ayuda para las personas necesitadas y doy las gracias por confiar en mi.
texts.en:
Efraín is a young student born in Huánuco. When he was small he emigrated to Lima, together with his parents and sister, in search of a better future for everyone

He is currently studying in his 4th semester of Heavy Machinery Maintenance at SENATI. He is fascinated about his major as it is closely related to the mining sector, which is government paid. Efrain wants to become a competent professional and provide the best for his parents and sister. He feels his education will help him greatly in the future as it will provide higher economic income and cover his personal necessities.

Right now things are going very well with his studies, but he lacks the money to cover his studies. This is the main obstacle he is facing. Because of this Efrain is requesting the help of Kiva to be able to successfully complete his studies.

Efrain likes to work as a hydraulic parts technician, working on repairing the parts. The support that Kiva provides will cover the costs of his studies. It will also allow him to be a professional in one of the professions in most demand and work at what he likes.

Efrain says: "I feel very grateful and fortunate to know that people who work with Kiva provide me with this support. It is a great help for needy people and I give thanks for your confidence in me".

loans.use: to complete the last three semesters of Heavy Construction Machinery Maintenance.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is married and from the village of Ddmashen in Armenia’s Gegharkunik region. She graduated from a trades college in Yerevan but never was employed, so she now works as a farmer. The couple has cows and calves, horses, piglets, sheep and chickens, but their potato cultivation is still the main source of her family’s income.

Marine is very grateful for her first Kiva loan, which helped her to develop her farm. She has been able to sell her farm’s output--milk, cheese, butter, meat, eggs and potatoes--at the wholesale market with the help of her husband.

Now she is applying for a 700,000 AMD loan through Kiva's field partner Nor Horizon to buy a truck for her farm. It would greatly help her in taking her large quantity of farm products to market.

loans.use: to buy a truck for her farm

loans.name: Marta Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marta, elabora tortillas para vender cada día por la mañana y por la tarde, el oficio lo heredó de su familia, con la experiencia necesaria decidió fundar su propio negocio en su casa, lo tiene hace 10 años; es jefa de su hogar, vive con sus dos hijos, uno de ellos estudia, la familia colabora para atender a los clientes.
Invertirá maíz, bolsas, leña, etc., contara con los insumos necesarios para elaborar la venta de tortillas, espera tener a sus clientes satisfechos, aumentar sus ventas e ingresos para disminuir las necesidades de su hogar.
Sus aspiraciones son agregar otro tipo de mercadería, remodelar el local y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Marta makes tortillas that she sells every day in the morning and evening. She learned the business from her family and from that experience she decided to start her own business in her home, which she has had for 10 years.  She is the head of her household and she lives with her two children, one of whom is in school.  The family works together to serve her customers.  She will use the loan to purchase corn, bags, firewood, etc., in order to have the needed supplies to make and sell tortillas.  She hopes to satisfy her customers, increase her sales and earnings in order to cover her household expenses.  Her hopes are to add another product to sell, remodel her storefront and get ahead with her family.

loans.use: purchase corn, bags, firewood and other supplies to make tortillas.

loans.name: Najia

texts.en:
Najia, 55, is a widow and mother of nine children, three of whom are still in school. She started a beauty products business in a small room in her home, where she sells high-quality makeup, perfumes and Brazilian gold. She also visits clients when requested. She is well-known in her area for the unique objects that she offers, in addition to her special selling skills and her friendly and adorable personality.

Today Najia is asking for a 1,575,000 LBP loan through Kiva's field partner Vitas s.a.l to increase her inventory and to obtain a driver’s license so she can visit her clients inside their homes. She is very proud that she was able to develop her business in such a short time and hopes to open her own shop soon.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and obtain a driver’s license so she can visit her clients in their homes

loans.name: Agua Buena Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AGUA BUENA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Timotea ella es soltera y tiene 52 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanias, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de pasto.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Agua Buena" communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district of the Province of Cusco in the Cusco region.  

Timotea is one of the members, she is 52 years old and single. She works in her grocery store selling basic goods such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8am to 7pm. She has 5 years of experience in this business and it has gone very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business.  She is seeking this loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies. 

The member in the superimposed picture had her photo taken after the meeting because of work commitments.  The other members of the group work in businesses that include: craft sales, clothing sales, grocery stores and hay sales. The members are grateful for those who are taking part in making their dreams come true, and they are committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Angel Rodolfo

texts.es:
Ángel es un productor con 25 años de edad, vive en una alejada comunidad al norte de Jinotega y desde  hace 4 años se dedica a la caficultura, actividad que le permite garantizar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y sus 4 hijos. 

Este joven maneja su finca bajo los criterios de la certificación comercio justo, y con el apoyo del equipo técnico de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), a la cual está afiliado.

En los últimos dos ciclos, los rendimientos productivos de su finca han mejorado en un 50%, debido al adecuado mantenimiento que ha dado a su cafetal, lo cual se ha propuesto continuar y para ello está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita adquirir los insumos agrícolas que necesita su plantación.

Su meta es tener un producción que supere los 200 quintales de café por ciclo, y para lograrlo ha comenzado con pequeñas inversiones para el mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Ángel is a 25-year-old farmer. He lives in an isolated community north of Jinotega and for the last 4 years he's been producing coffee. This activity allows him to cover his wife's and four children's basic needs. 
This young man manages his farm according to its fair trade certification, and with technical support from the association Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), where he is also a member.
During his last two loan cycles, the farm's production performance improved up to 50%, thanks to proper management of the coffee plantation. He wants to continue improving, so he is asking for a new loan to be able to purchase farming supplies that he needs.
His goal is for production to exceeed 200 quintales (or 20,000 lbs) of coffee per cycle, so he is making small investments to keep up with its maintenance.

loans.use: To ensure he can properly maintain his coffee crops and he can have a better revenue after this cycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in beans, soft cheese, tomatoes, butter, tables, chairs, cabbage and other products needed for her business.

loans.name: Amaridis Xiomara

texts.es:
Amaridis es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la caficultura con el apoyo de su esposo. Tiene dos hijos que estudian en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven, que se ubica en una zona rural al norte de Nicaragua.
 
Esta pequeña emprendedora, ha sabido manejar su pequeña finca, por lo que en los últimos años su producción de café ha sido de 120 quintales de café pergamino, lo cual es un rendimiento muy bueno para el área de café que tiene, ya que en los últimos dos ciclos su cafetal ha sido afectado por la roya, que es una de las enfermedades que más afecta este rubro.

Para mantener y mejorar los niveles productivos de su finca, Amaridis está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los insumos que necesita aplicar para el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones. Con esta inversión, ella está segura que podrá mejorar la producción y aumentar los ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Amaridis is an enterprising woman who works as a coffee grower with the support of her husband. She has two sons that study in the community’s school, which is located in a rural part of Northern Nicaragua. 

This entrepreneurial woman knows how to manage her small farm, and because of this, in recent years she has produced over 12,000lbs of parchment coffee. This is a very good yield for the her coffee fields.  In recent cycles, her coffee plantation has been affected by coffee rust, one of the most common diseases in this type of farming.

To maintain and improve the production levels of her farm, Amaridis is asking for a loan to buy the supplies needed to maintain her fields. With this loan, she is certain that she will be able to improve production and increase revenue, which will improve conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies that she will use on her coffee plantation in order to have a good harvest.

loans.name: Exitosos De Carapongo Group

texts.es: “LOS EXITOSOS DE CARAPONGO” es un grupo nuevo conformado por socios dedicados a diversas actividades del comercio minorista. Maritza  tiene 49 años de edad es conviviente. Ella realiza manualidades flores floreros para liego expenderlo de manera ambulatoria en la afueras de los cementerios.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más materiales pinturas tris tijeras y demás accesorios para realizar sus manualidades. Ella cumple la función de tesorera. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Maritza es la segunda del lado derecho
texts.en:
Exitosos de Carapongo is a new group consisting of members working in diverse retail trade businesses. Maritza is 49 years old and is in a domestic partnership. She makes handicrafts—flowers, vases—to later sell as a street vendor outside of cemeteries. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more materials like paint, Triz superglue, scissors, and other accessories to carry out her handicrafts. She functions as the treasurer of the group.

The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan offered. Maritza is the second person on the right.

loans.use: to purchase more paint, Triz superglue, scissors, and other accessories

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge tiene 29 años de edad y vive con su compañera de vida y su hija de 5 años de edad, que es la alegría de su hogar, y se encuentra estudiando, ya que desea que ella pueda optar a una mejor calidad de vida.  Él se dedica a la venta de ropa y  tiene 2 años en este negocio mostrando ser muy amable y respetuoso con sus clientes, por lo que cada día son más las personas que buscan sus productos por sus precios accesibles. Jorge desea comprar más mercadería para poder surtir más el local con lo que espera aumentar sus ganancias para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, por lo que él solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos, maniquís para ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a su clientela.
texts.en: Jorge is 29 years old. He lives with his life partner and their 5-year-old daugther. She is the joy of the family and she is currently going to school, as mom and dad want her to have a better quality of life. He has been selling apparel clothing for the last 2 years. He is very polite and respectful with his customers, and more and more people are drawn to his business thanks to his affordable prices. Jorge wants to buy more merchandize in order to stock his store with a larger variety, hoping to increase sales and offer a better quality of life to his family. He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in shirts, slacks, skirts, dresses, mannequins to offer a larger variety of products to his customers.

loans.use: to invest in shirts, slacks, skirts, dresses, mannequins to offer a larger variety of products to his customers.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Doña Rosa de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de manteles bordados a mano, tiene 15 años de experiencia en ese rubro, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene puede salir adelante con sus hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos para seguir elaborando los manteles como lanas de varios colores por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos económicos para una mejor estabilidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa is 57 years old and lives in her own house with her two children. She works in the production of hand-made embroidered tablecloths. She has 15 years of experience in this field. Her business is located in her place of residence. With the earnings she obtains, she can get ahead with her children. 

She is requesting for a loan for the wholesale purchase of materials, like wool of various colors, in order to continue producing the tablecloth. This way, she can continue with her work that generates a good financial income for better stability in life.

loans.use: to purchase wool of various colors at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in construction material for a bathroom and to install clean water piping in his family home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in shirts, skirts, slacks, yoga pants, socks, dresses, hangers, mannequins to attract more customers.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
The person who appears in the above photo is Ruth. She is 25 years old, married, and has 5 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

Ruth has skills in enterprise start-up, business record-keeping, and financial management, which she acquired from her association with Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. This training has helped her manage her agriculture enterprise; she farms maize, beans, and potatoes. 

Ruth is taking a Kiva loan in order to purchase seeds. The resulting increase in earnings will enable her to cover both her family's basic needs and the cost of education for her children.

Ruth is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds that will boost yields and give a bounty harvest, leading to more sales.

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan is 58 years old, and he lives with his wife in Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region of Armenia. 

Vachagan keeps busy in his native village with farming and agriculture. As he is disabled, it is only with the help of his wife that he can care for their cows, heifers, pigs, and chickens. 

In addition to his disability, Vachagan now has some health problems, and he urgently needs a course of treatment. With the 500,000 AMD loan he has requested, he will be able to pay for his course of treatment prescribed by his doctor.

loans.use: to pay for his course of treatment prescribed by his doctor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so she can increase her milk supply and meet both her clients' and family's needs.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 33-year-old married woman. Her husband, who is also shown in the above photo, has been running his fruit selling business for many years. 

Saima's husband tries hard to provide his family with the basic necessities through his business. 

Saima has taken a murabaha-type loan of 30,000 PKR for the improvement of her husband’s business. They will purchase sacks of apples, guavas, and apricots so he can consistently meet market demand.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, guavas, and apricots so her husband can consistently meet market demand.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 25 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. 2 of their children are in primary school, and 1 is in secondary school.  
 
Sharon joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. She has been running her agriculture business for 6 years, farming maize and potatoes. 

Sharon is taking a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer. With this loan, she hopes that her business will generate more profits and thus help increase her income level. This will put her in the position to easily provide the necessities for her children, including food and education. 

Sharon is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their financial support. She promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer that will help improve farm yields and give her more income to cover her family's needs.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 25-year-old married man from Khan Younis City who lives with his wife in a small house. Haytham works as an employee where he gets a low income. He wants to improve himself and be independent so he thought of starting to sell cosmetics and accessories.

Haytham took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy cosmetics products and accessories to start his own business. By taking this loan, Haytham will be able to improve his family's conditions.

Haytham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products and accessories to start his own business

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be a risk taker. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals, flour, soap, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, cereals, soap, sugar and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, cereals, soap, sugar and other items

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en: Ayat is a 54-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. Despite the bad circumstances, Ayat is doing a great effort in cooperation with her husband to be able to satisfy the family’s needs. She has owned a grocery store since 2013. And today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase food provisions and to buy a refrigerator to increase her business sales as well as her income. She is an optimistic person who is always aiming for the best and plans to receive more Kiva loans in the coming years to keep on improving her family’s standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions and to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his dairy farming to raise more income to improve his family's living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for increased milk supply to clients to meet their needs and those of her family after milk sales.

loans.name: Florefe

texts.en:
Florefe is 51 years old and married. She has six children, four who are married already. Florefe and her husband are both rice farmers. She aims to have abundant rice for harvest and therefore increase her income. She is asking for financial assistance to buy fertilizer for the rice field so that she can produce good-quality rice and have more sales after production.

Florefe wants to expand her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the rice field.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors waiting for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Zeporah

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Zeporah. She is fifty-eight years old, married, and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She does banana farming as her main business. She is grateful for Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and book keeping that has enabled her manage the business better than before. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality fertilizer so that she can increase her output and in return increase her profits from sales. This will assist her to cater for her family’s upkeep and payment of school fees for the children.

Zeporah  is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer that will increase output and thus create more income to provide for the family.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani is a Babban Gona farmer from Galadima Mayau Vilage. Sani joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Sani will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Sani would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy coats and other items.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, el señor vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos en casa propia, su pareja se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y él realiza los cultivos de maíz y frijol, ambos trabajan para sostener su hogar, no tienen ayuda económica de otras personas, aprendió a trabajar en el campo con el apoyo de su padre, ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y trabaja de forma independiente desde hace 6 años, trabaja en tierras propias e inicio con capital propio.
Está solicitando un crédito para tener recursos económicos con los que comprara insumos agrícolas y podrá pagar la preparación del terreno para sembrar maíz y frijol, pretende tener todo listo para la próxima temporada de siembra y aprovechar el inicio del invierno.
Aspira a que sus cosechas sean abundantes y le generan mayores ganancias con las que piensa pagar sus deudas y hacer reparaciones en su vivienda.
texts.en:
José lives with his life companion and two children in his own house. His partner works raising pigs and he grows corn ans beans. Both work to sustain their household. They have no help from other people. He learned to work the fields with the help of his father.

He now has much experience and has been working independently for 6 years. He works his own land and started with his own capital. He is requesting a loan to have the economic resources to buy agricultural inputs and pay to prepare the land to plant corn and beans. He wants to have everything ready for the next planting season and take advantage of the beginning of winter. He hopes to have a good harvest that generates greater income which he is thinking of paying his debts and do some repairs on his house.

loans.use: tp buy agricultural inputs and pay to prepare the land for seeding corn and beans.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is from Bambakashat village where she lives with her husband and daughter. Her only son serves in the army and is 21 years old.

Laura is occupied with farming. She cultivates tomatoes and keeps 50 hens and two calves. Her farm isn't big, but the dreams of making it rich and profitable are big. Laura cultivates tomatoes and with the big assistance of her husband, sells them in the local markets.

Laura has now applied for this loan to ask lenders to help her with some farming expenses. She needs to purchase tomato seeds, fertilizer, pesticides for cultivation and to hire workers for harvesting work. Because the arable land is big, Laura and her husband can not manage to cultivate it and the support is vital for them.

As this is Laura's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Laura get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Laura hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds, fertilizer, pesticides for cultivation and to hire workers for harvesting work.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel, vive junto a sus padres en el Distrito de Ate Vitarte, ubicado en la carretera central de Lima. 
Actualmente se encuentra cursando el tercer semestre de Mecatrónica Industrial, carrera que le gustó siempre desde muy pequeño.Le va muy bien en sus estudios, salvo por la falta de dinero que pone en riesgo la continuidad de su carrera.  Estudia 20 horas a la semana clases teóricas y 20 horas de clases prácticas.
Joel, siente que esa carrera le dará una gran satisfacción personal y gracias a ello, sus padres no tendrían que trabajar porque él se encargaría de su familia. A él le gustaría trabajar siempre en algo referente a la electrónica.
Él utilizará el préstamo de KIVA para poder solventar los gastos de estudios y continuar estudiando. Aún le falta un año y medio para poder culminar su carrera. 
Su sueño es tener un trabajo estable, seguir capacitándose y ver que sus padres se sientan orgullosos de él. El principal obstáculo por el que atravesó es cuando sentía que no podía salir adelante por la difícil situación económica que atraviesa su familia.
Se siente muy aliviado por el apoyo brindado, también le alegra saber que personas como él pueden salir adelante gracias a la oportunidad brindada con la obtención de este préstamo.
Por último, Joel les dice a KIVA: Es una gran ayuda que me brindan y gracias a eso puede seguir estudiando sin ningún obstáculo, convirtiéndome en un gran profesional de Mecatrónica Industrial. Gracias KIVA por esta gran oportunidad de poder lograr mi sueño.
texts.en: Joel lives with his parents in the district of Ate Vitarte, located near the central highway in Lima.  Currently, he is in his third semester of Industrial Mechatronics, the career he has been interested in since he was very small.  He is doing very well in his studies, except that he lacks the necessary funds, which puts him at risk of not being able to continue with his program.  He has 20 hours a week of theory classes and 20 hours a week of practical classes.  Joel feels that this career will give him great personal satisfaction and thanks to this, his parents won't have to work because he could take care of his family.  He always enjoys working with anything related to electronics.  He will use the KIVA loan to resolve his education expenses and continue studying.  He still has another year and a half until he can complete his degree.  His dream is to have a stable job, to continue developing professionally, and to see that his parents feel proud of him.  The main obstacle for him occured when he felt that he couldn't continue on because of the difficult financial situation in his family.  He feels very relieved by the support being offered, and also happy to know that there are people like him who can get ahead thanks to the opportunity offered through obtaining this loan.  Finally, Joel would like to say to KIVA: "This is a great help that you are offering me and thanks to this, I can continue studying without any obstacles, and become a professional in Industrial Mechatronics.  Thank you, KIVA for this great opportunity to achieve my dream."

loans.use: to cover the costs of his studies and to become a professional in Industrial Mechatronics.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel pertenece al banco comunal EL ÉXITO, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua con su negocio de negocio de venta de plantas ornamentales, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua  vendiendo  a todos su clientes que le solictan, la socia es unja persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de más  plantas entre otros.
texts.en:
Isabel belongs to the communal bank "El Éxito".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, Cusco province, and Cusco department.  

Isabel continues with her business of selling ornamental plants.  She appreciates the granted loan and she promises to comply with the established repayment schedule.  She continues selling to all the customers who request it.  She is a responsible and earnest person.  This is the way she provides for her family.  

Isabel is requesting a loan to purchase more plants, among other things.

loans.use: to purchase more plants, among other things.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is a 35-year-old divorced woman from Khan Younis city. She lives with her family in a small house. Khetam has a stall for selling cosmetics in the city. It is a good business and provides her with a good income.

Khetam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more cosmetics products and accessories for her own business. By taking this loan, Khetam will be able to improve her family’s conditions.

Khetam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics products and accessories for her own business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Joan. She is thirty years old. She is married and has three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to learn and gain more experience in enterprise start-up and development. She also learnt skills in financial management, which have helped her manage finances well.

She does maize and potato farming, which has enabled her to earn income for her family’s basic needs. She is borrowing a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. This will enable her to increase income; thus improving her business and hence be in a position to educate her children.

Joan is grateful for Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds, that will boost farming.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a married woman. She has nine children. She describes herself to be hardworking.

She operates a retail business where she sells livestock. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of livestock.

She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of livestock.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira, age 27, is a single lady. One of her brothers is shown in the picture; he deals in the business of painting. He is an expert in doing his work and earns a good amount towards fulfilling the family’s needs.

In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required, so Saira has taken a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for the growth of her brother's business. It helped him purchase buckets of paint in different colors, along with brushes, to cater to more customers.

loans.use: to help her brother to purchase buckets of paint in different colors, along with brushes, to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарину 40 лет. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Мужу 45 лет. У нее один сын и она дочка. Дочке 16 лет. Сыну 13 лет. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Зарина продает разную детскую одежду на центральном рынке района Хамадони. В сфере торговли Зарина работает около 10 лет. Для нее такая работа не трудная и очень интересная. Ей нравится общаться с новыми людьми и помогать людям с выбором детскую одежду. Зарина хочет на сумму от кредита привести больше разную детскую и мужскую одежду и продавать на рынке. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей увеличить товарооборот и доходы от торговли.
texts.en:
Zarina is 40 and married with two children. Her husband is 45 and she has one son, who is 13, and one daughter, who is 16. Her husband is working abroad in Russia and she sells children's clothing at the central market in the Hamadoni region. She has been working in retail for about 10 years. This kind of work is not difficult for her and she finds it very interesting. She likes meeting new people and helping them choose children's clothing.

Zarina wants to use the loan amount to bring in more inventory of children's and men's clothing and to sell it at the market. The loan will help her increase her working capital and profits from her business.

loans.use: to bring in a variety of children's and men's clothing

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik is a farmer and he lives in Zovaber, in the Gegharkunik region. Here he lives with his daughter, son and daughter-in-law. All the family is busy with farming. 

Rafik’s farm is small and here he has a cow, a calf, sheep, lambs and chickens. Since his farm is not a very rich one, he is seriously engaged in potato cultivation. His farm’s potatoes are very tasty and of high quality. He sells them both to re-sellers and at the wholesale market to his regular customers. 

Since potato cultivation is the only constant income for the family, Rafik has decided to enlarge it, and with this Kiva loan he will buy a lot of potato seedlings and fertilizer and organize potato-planting activities.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer and to organize potato-planting activities

loans.name: Catalina Marina

texts.es:
Catalina de 54 años conviviente. Hace trece años Catalina y su esposo se dedica  a la venta de sándwich y refresco comenzó vendiendo de manera ambulatoria en una caja térmica y gracias al apoyo de su esposo lograron establecer su negocio en su propia vivienda y con el esfuerzo de ambos lograron comprar una moto taxi para que su esposo siga vendiendo por las calles y así puedan tener mayores ingresos para solventar los gasto de su hogar.
