El mayor anhelo de Catalina es comprar una combi y poder acondicionarlo en una combi sanguchera. Solicito el crédito para poder comprar más insumos para la preparación de sus ricos sándwich.
Está muy agradecida con los inversionistas Kiva por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
Catalina is 54 years old and lives with her partner.  For three years, Catalina and her partner have worked selling sandwiches and soft drinks.  She started out as street vendor with a cooler.  Thanks to the support of her partner, they were able to establish their business in their own home.  With the effort of both, they were able to buy a moto-taxi so that her partner could continue selling in the streets, and thus have greater income to cover household expenses. 

Catalina’s greatest wish is to buy a van to be able to set it up as a food truck.  She is requesting the loan to be able to buy more supplies for the preparation of her delicious sandwiches.

She is very grateful to the Kiva investors for trusting in her.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of her sandwiches.

loans.name: Eugenia Isabel

texts.es:
Eugenia, invirtió el crédito anterior en materia prima para mantener surtido su negocio y seguir generando los ingresos que necesita para mejorar el estilo de vida familiar y cancelar su deuda, su vivienda tiene una mejor estructura.
Nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar azúcar, bolsas, melones, piñas, etc., para elaborar refrescos y también invertirá en papelería, alambre y pegamento para continuar produciendo piñatas, de esta manera su fuente de ingresos seguirá funcionando.
texts.en: Eugenia invested her last loan in primary materials to keep her business stocked and to continue generating the income she needs to improve her family's lifestyle, pay off her debt, and improve the structure of her home. She is requesting another loan to purchase sugar, bags, melons, pineapples and other items to prepare beverages and also to invest in paper, wire and glue which she will use to create piñatas. In this way she will be able to continue running her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of items to make juice and piñatas.

loans.name: Kihoto Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Rachael. She is 45 years old, married and has five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in October 2013.

She does maize and bean farming. Through HiH EA training, she has acquired skills in enterprise development, record keeping and financial management. She has also been able to commercialize her farming and get more profits. 

Rachael is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase quality fertilizer and seeds for the upcoming planting season. This will greatly boost her farm yield, and hence increase her income, which will enable her to cater for her children’s school fees, clothing, food and other needs for the family. 

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as quality fertilizer and seeds to help improve crop yield.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is 29. She is divorced with no kids. She lives in Vinogradovo with her elderly mother. Even though she is still young, she has an established business selling women's casual clothing in the local market and is getting a stable income.

Lubov is seeking 40,000 grivnyas to purchase lingerie and bathrobes for further retail sale. She is hoping to sell purchased inventory at a good price and reinvest the money in her business. One of Lubov's dreams is to open a clothing store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie and bathrobes for further retail sale

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is a farmer in the village Zovaber of Gegharkunik region. He is 27 years old and he lives with his parents. His mother in unemployed and she is a housewife. His father goes to the Russian Federation for work abroad. 

Arman does different construction works in his village, but he also has a cute farm, the care of which he mainly manages alone. He has cows, a calf and chickens in his farm. So the sale of his farm milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese and eggs his mother organizes mainly to their neighbors. 

Arman also manages potato cultivation on his plot of land. For this vegetable, he says there is no need to find customers since resellers are plentiful and they buy wholesale. 

This loan of 600,000 Armenian drams Arman will use for his potato production. He is sure that this season's harvest will be really profitable since it is of highest quality.

loans.use: to produce potatoes

loans.name: London School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fred. He is the deputy head teacher of London College of St. Lawrence, a mixed school in the rural area of Maya in Wakisoo with 1,200 students. 

London College of St. Lawrence has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing two water filtration systems will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 1,000 liter tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

London College of St. Lawrence will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Fred ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman and is staying together with her husband and three children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 44, is married to Stellah and he supports 5 family members.  He has been a mason for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of KES 14,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he plans to use to buy more construction equipment.

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy construction equipment.

loans.name: Thabu

texts.en: Thabu is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, soap, milk and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of milk, soap, sugar, flour and other items. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of milk, soap, sugar, flour and other items

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is from Kyiv region. She is 54, and married with a grown son. She sells drapes, net curtains, pelmets, sheets and towels. Valentina rents a small facility in a local mall. She has been in this trade for 19 years.
Valentina is hoping to invest 20 000 UAH to purchase drapes and net curtains. Summer marks a season of remodeling and reconstruction in many Ukrainian homes which is why this type of merchandise will definitely be in high demand this season. A variety of assorted inventory will be a nice attraction and will help her to be in a better position competition-wise.

loans.use: to purchase drapes and net curtains to sell

loans.name: Maria Sarbelia

texts.es:
María, utiliza los créditos para mantener estabilidad en su negocio de cafetín y seguir ofreciendo los productos que sus clientes necesitan, manifiesta que está trabajando duro para finalizar la construcción de su vivienda.
Opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar azúcar, aceite, café, chocolate, quesillo, chicharrón, harina, entre otros materiales para elaborar la venta de pupusas, refrescos, atoles, etc., así podrá mantendrá la continuidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
María uses her loans to maintain stability in her small cafe and to continue providing the products that her customers need. She is working hard so that she can finish building her home.

She chose to take out a new loan to buy sugar, oil, coffee, chocolate, soft cheese, pork rind, flour, and other supplies in order to sell pupusas, refreshments, atoles, etc. This way she will be able to keep her business afloat.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, coffee, chocolate, soft cheese, pork rind, flour, and other supplies in order to sell pupusas, refreshments, atoles, etc.

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
This is Narek's second loan with Kiva. He is a student in Medical university and studies hard to become a doctor. 
The first loan helped Narek to pay for his university tuition for the first year, and he now asks lenders to support him with his second semester tuition. 
Narek, as a responsible borrower, hopes to receive lenders'' support one more time and continue his education.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Sector Los Chumil-Papa Group

texts.es:
Martin (es el primero del lado izquierdo dela fotografía de chumpa café) es un hombre que se encuentra muy satisfecho porque gracias al crédito logro comprar  su abono orgánico y obtuvo muy buena cosecha y ahora su familia tienen que comer el resto del años, pero el junto a su grupo han visto la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar sus semillas de papa y fertilizantes para cultivar en esta temporada.
El gran anhelo de Martin es poder mejorar su vivienda y comparar más terrenos para seguir incrementado su cultivo.
texts.en:
Martín (first from the left wearing a brown jacket) is a very satisfied man as, thanks to a previous loan, he was able to buy organic fertilizer and obtained a very good harvest.  Now his family have food for the rest of the year. However he, along with his group, has seen the need to request a new loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate this season.

Martín has a great desire to improve his home and to buy more land to continue increasing his crops.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: Maria de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, sus padres y su hermana, ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace 12 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas (fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas) para poder tener un mejor cultivo de maíz.
texts.en:
Maria is a 31 year old single mother who lives in her own home with her daughter, her parents and her sister.  She has worked in agriculture growing corn for 12 years, and sells her produce in various markets close to her home.  With her earnings she pays for household expenses.  

She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs (fertilizer, compost, herbicides) to be able to grow a better crop of corn.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs (fertilizers, compost, herbicides)

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a divorced mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, Amina has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. A major challenge she faces is the high cost of transportation in the area where she operates her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 40,000 KES, Amina wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Imani Bagaria Location Poutry Keeping Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Ruth, a member of Imani Bagaria Location Poultry Keeping Shg Group. Ruth is forty-eight years old and married with two children. She does maize and potato farming and also keeps poultry.

Ruth joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2011. She has learnt about enterprise start-up and development, and gained more experience. She has also learnt skills on prudent financial management, which has helped her to manage her business well.  

She is now taking out a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. This will enable her to increase production and hence improve her income, so that she is in a position to educate her children. 

Ruth is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will help boost income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is a single man who describes himself as hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, soap, milk, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area, where he serves many different types of people. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient financial resources. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more milk, soap,sugar, flour, and other items to sell. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Nelson's previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more milk, soap, sugar, flour, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Arcidez

texts.es:
Oscar, es un hombre soltero y padre de familia, ha tenido que salir adelante con sus tres hijos de 20, 18 y 14 años de edad, su trabajo consiste en practicar la crianza de ganado y el cultivo de granos básicos, el oficio lo aprendió cuando apoyaba a su padre en las labores agrícolas a una edad de 12 años, trabaja todos los días sin un horario establecido.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para cultivar granos básicos y zacate para alimentar al ganado, le será de ayuda para mejorar la producción de maíz y frijol tanto para alimentación familiar como para generar ingresos que son de utilidad para cuidar de su familia y pagar su deuda.
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando, tener una situación financiera estable y mejorar la ganadería.
texts.en:
Oscar is single and has three children, ages 20, 18 and 14, who he is supporting.  His work involves raising cattle and growing basic grains.  He learned farming by helping his father when he was 12 years old.  He works every day with no established schedule.

Oscar will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow basic grains and improve his corn and bean production, as well as fodder for the cattle.  The grains will be used for family consumption and to generate an income to care for the family and pay off debt.

His dream is to continue working toward a stable financial situation and to improve his livestock.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies to grow basic grains and improve corn and bean production, and fodder to feed the cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Martina Isabel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marina, vive con su hija, la cual es madre de dos hijos, todos comparten la misma vivienda, hace ocho años inicio a vender ropa y otros productos como una actividad con la que estaría teniendo los ingresos que necesita para cubrir los gastos familiares, con ayuda de un familiar aprendió e inicio su negocio, trabaja todos los días y por el momento no representa dificultades para seguir atendiendo su negocio.
Comprará camisas, pantalones, blusas, chores, etc., podrá ofertar nuevos diseños, colores y tallas de prendas de vestir para atender de manera especial a sus clientes, espera que la inversión tenga un resultado positivo para ir mejorando la economía familiar.
Para Marina es muy importante mantenerse trabajando y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Marina lives with her daughter who has two children, and they all share the same house.  For eight years Marina has been selling clothing and other products to earn an income to cover household expenses.  With the help of her family she learned the trade and works every day.  For now she has not run into any difficulties attending to her business.

She plans to buy shirts, pants, blouses, shorts, etc. in order to offer new clothing styles, colors and sizes to her customers as a special service.  She hopes the investment will have a positive effect on the family economy.

It is very important for Marina to continue working and supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants, blouses, shorts, etc. to offer new styles, colors and sizes of clothing to her customers.

loans.name: Graca

texts.pt:
Sra.Graça, tem 39 anos de idade, solteira, mae de 02 filhos  frequentando o ensino primário e secundário, respectivamente. Vive na casa própria.
Com o empréstimo de 30.000,00 meticais pretende comprar bolsas, calçado e perfumes na vizinha África do Sul para revender.
Ela tem o sonho de construir uma boutique e salão, visto que até então, vende de forma ambulatória. Pese embora, enfrenta dificuldades financeiras e o seu desafio é redobrar as esforças para poder reembolsar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora.
texts.en:
Graça is 39 years old and unmarried. She has two children in elementary and secondary school. She lives in her own home.
She will use the loan of 30,000 meticals to buy purses, shoes, and perfumes in the neighboring country of South Africa to resell.
Her dream is to build a boutique and beauty salon, since she has been selling door to door so far. Nevertheless, she is struggling to overcome financial difficulties and will redouble her efforts so she can pay back the loan promptly and in full.

loans.use: to buy purses, shoes, and perfumes in South Africa to resell.

loans.name: Las Violetas Y El Girasol Group

texts.es: Zoraida tiene 40  años de edad es casada con dos hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de lencería a través de catálogos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más  productos y así incrementar sus ganancias. Ella participa en el grupo “LAS VILETAS Y EL GIRASOL”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Zoraida es
texts.en: Zoraida is 40 years old, married and has two dependent children.  She sells lingerie by catalogue and plans to use her loan to buy more products and increase earnings.  She is a member of the communal bank "LAS VILETAS Y EL GIRASOL".  The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more lingerie.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
José, vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia, sus hijos ya tienen su hogar propio, la manera de generar ingresos para  los gastos familiares es el cultivo de maíz, se dedica a trabajar en el campo desde el año 1985, vive en una zona favorable para la agricultura, los terrenos en que siembra son propios, el periodo en que trabaja es del mes de mayo al mes de diciembre.
Cultivara una manzana de maíz por lo que está necesitando de un préstamo para comprar abono, semilla, insecticidas y además cubrirá otros gastos para preparar el terreno en el que realiza su trabajos agrícolas, realizara todas sus actividades en el tiempo justo para tener una mejor cosecha.
José tiene como objetivo seguir trabajando para reunir el dinero suficiente para reparar su vivienda y tener un techo más seguro y digno.
texts.en:
José lives with his life partner in the house that he owns. His children now have their own home. His source of income for household expenses is growing corn. He has worked in the fields since 1985 and lives in an area favorable to agriculture. He owns the land that he sows and works from the month of May to the month of December.

He will grow one manzana (an area of land equivalent to about 1.7 acres) of corn. He needs a loan to buy fertilizer, seed, insecticides, and to cover other expenses to prepare the soil for agricultural work. He will carry out all of his activities at the right time in order to get a good harvest.

José's goal is to keep working so that he can save enough money to fix up his home and have a safer roof over his head.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, insecticides, and to cover other expenses to prepare the soil for agricultural work.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is from Melitopol. She is 51 and married, with 3 grown-up daughters. 

Marina works at the central marketplace selling seasonal men's footwear. She owns a vending location, and she has been running this business for 17 years. 

She is hoping to get 25,000 grivnas (UAH) to purchase assorted men's summer footwear to sell in her vending kiosk this spring/summer. She is planning to buy casual footwear - floater sandals, flip flops and regular sandals that always sell well and are good for the hot summers here in the south-east of Ukraine.

loans.use: to purchase assorted summer footwear for men to sell in her vending kiosk this spring/summer

loans.name: Rubidia

texts.es:
Rubidia, ha logrado mejorar la sastrería con la buena administración del crédito anterior, sus ganancias son utilizadas para cumplir con sus obligaciones y le ha dado apoyo a su esposo para comprar una bicicleta en la que pueden transportar mercadería que ella necesita para trabajar.
Está solicitando más capital por la buena experiencia que ha tenido, lo invertirá en hilos, telas, botones, broches, zippers y otros materiales importantes para elaborar las prendas de vestir que debe entregar a sus clientes.
texts.en: Rubidia has been able to improve her tailoring thanks to the good management of her previous loan.  Her profits are used to pay her debts and has been able to support her husband to buy a bicycle in which to transport the materials she needs to work.  She's requesting another loan because of the good experience she's had.  She will invest in thread, fabrics, buttons, pins, zippers, and other materials needed to make her clothing items she needs to deliver to her clients.

loans.use: to invest in thread, fabrics, buttons, pins, zippers and other materials needed to make her clothing items she needs to deliver to her clients.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, está optando por un nuevo préstamo para comprar pollos de engorde recién nacidos, concentrados y vacunas para mejorar la granja, espera poder mantener su clientela y cubrir las nuevas demandas.
Con la facilidad de recursos económicos que le dio el crédito anterior su negocio ha crecido, tiene un mejor estilo de vida familiar y ha reducido sus deudas.
texts.en: Juan is requesting a new loan to buy new born chicken for fattening, chicken feed, and vaccines to improve his farm.  He hopes to keep his clientele and be able to cover the new demand.  His business has grown, thanks to the financial help from the previous loan.  He also has a better quality of life and has reduced his debt.

loans.use: to buy new born chicken for fattening, chicken feed, and vaccines to improve his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Jenifer Yarixa

texts.es:
Jenifer, no ha cambiado mucho su estilo de vida pero está percibiendo mejores ingresos, esto se debe a que el negocio es de subsistencia.
Solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar bebidas, aceite, golosinas, galletas, pan, etc., su objetivo es resurtir la tienda y seguir atendiendo a sus clientes de la mejor manera.
texts.en: Jenifer hasn't changed her lifestyle much because her business is mainly for subsistance but she's having a better income.  She's requesting a new loan to buy drinks, oil, candy, crackers, bread, etc. so she can restock her store and keep taking care of her clients in the best posible way.

loans.use: to buy drinks, oil, candy, crackers, bread, etc. so she can restock her store and keep taking care of her clients in the best posible way.

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es:
José, es dueño de un taller mecánico, el negocio lo heredo su papá y esta funcionado aproximadamente desde hace 17 años, trabaja de lunes a sábado y hasta le fecha no representa dificultades para trabajar; José tiene un núcleo familiar formado por su esposa y dos hijos de 17 y 20 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando y no son independientes.
Comprará herramientas, aceite, grasa, etc., para poder realizar sus trabajos con mayor calidad, equipará su negocio con herramientas modernas y necesarias para seguir trabajando, procura tener nuevos clientes y mejores ganancias.
Los sueños que a José le gustaría ver cumplidos son que sus hijos culminen una carrera universitaria y que el negocio continúe creciendo.
texts.en:
José owns a garage that he inherited from his father. He has been running it for some 17 years. José works from Monday to Saturday and has not had any difficulties with his work so far. José is married and has two children, ages, 17 and 20 years old. Both of José’s children are in education and are not independent.

José will use this loan to buy tools, oil, great and more to carry out work to a higher standard and to equip his business with modern tools that he needs to continue working, gain new customers and earn a higher income.

José’s would like to see his children complete university studies and wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy tools, oil, great and more to carry out work to a higher standard and to equip his business with modern tools that he needs to continue working.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, vive solo en una vivienda familiar, sus hijos son independientes y viven en otro domicilio, se dedica a sembrar maíz, maicillo y frijol, el oficio lo aprendió de su papá, lo práctica desde hace más de 20 años y lo emprendió con capital propio.
Necesita de un préstamo para comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para preparar el terreno y sembrar granos básicos en el tiempo justo, su objetivo es tener todo listo para cuando inicie a llover, pues así sus cultivos agrícolas tendrán un mejor resultado.
Aspira a ir mejorando las cosechas para tener una situación económica estable y reducir sus deudas.
texts.en:
Miguel lives alone in his family home. His children are independent and live elsewhere. Miguel makes a living growing corn, sorghum and beans. He learned this trade from his father and has been working in it for more than 20 years. He started his business with his own capital.

Miguel needs this loan in order to buy the farming supplies that he needs to prepare his land and sow basic grains on time. His aim is to have everything ready before the rains start as this will result in a better yield.

Miguel wants to improve his harvests in order to have stable finances and reduce his debts.

loans.use: to buy the farming supplies that he needs in order to prepare his land and sow basic grains on time.

loans.name: Vilma De Jesus

texts.es:
Vilma, tiene como negocio el cultivo de granos básicos, vive en casa propia con su esposo y 4 hijos, tres asisten a la escuela y otro es apenas un bebe, su esposo es albañil, ella tiene 7 años de trabajar en la agricultura, inicio con ahorros y luego con ayuda de préstamos ha logrado cultivar una manzana de tierra.
Necesita comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas, semilla de maíz y frijol para condicionar la tierra y evitar el problema de plagas, lo hace pensando en ampliar su negocio y aprovechar la llegada del invierno.
Sus proyecciones son tener una cosecha de 60 qq de maíz y cinco sacos de frijol, para alimentar a su núcleo familiar y comercializar otra parte para tener nuevo ingresos.
texts.en:
Vilma's business is cultivating basic grains.  She lives in her own house with her husband and four children.  Three of them attend school and the fourth one is only a baby.  Her husband is a stonemason.  She's been working in agriculture for 7 years.  She started with some savings and later on with the help of loans she's been able to cultivate her own piece of land.  
She needs to buy fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, corn and bean seeds to prepare the land and avoid plagues.  She wants to expand her business by taking advantage of the arrival of winter.  Her projection is to harvest 60 qq of corn and 5 bags of beans to feed her family and sell the rest to have new income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, corn and bean seeds to prepare the land and avoid plagues.

loans.name: Rabiaa

texts.en: Rabiaa is a 43-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. She has been working for 12 years ago at her house doing a tailoring business to help her family to meet the needs of life. She is well known in her region for her good reputation. To better develop her work, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will be using the loan to buy a new tailoring machine. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine

loans.name: Silviya

texts.en:
Silviya has already used Kiva financial assistance to help her enterprise grow and expand. Because of the slow trade, her business needs additional funding to restock her merchandise and keep the business running. This time Silviya is seeking 20,000 UAH to open a new vending location and stock it with quality inventory.
 
Previous loans have helped Silviya diversify her assorted merchandise at different points of her business path and gain more loyal clients. Additional income can now be invested in the family; Silviya's son studies in college and she can help him with his college fees while he doesn't have a stable good paying job.

loans.use: to open a new vending location and stock it with quality inventory

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana, necesita de capital para comprar materiales para hacer arreglos florales, variedad de ropa, plátanos para elaborar tostadas y también reparara el coche de freír papas, le permitirá seguir trabajando para ir mejorado su desarrollo económico.
Con el préstamo anterior su negocio se mantiene con vida, ha incorporado nuevos rubros su familia tiene buena salud y ella continua trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en: Ana needs the loan to buy materials for making floral arrangements, clothes, plantains to make toasts and also to repair the food cart where she sells french fries.  This will allow her to improve her economic development.  With the previous loan she's been able to stay alive and has started working in other areas.  Her family is in good health and she continues working to keep progressing.

loans.use: to buy materials for making floral arrangements, clothes, plantains to make toasts and also to repair the food cart where she sells french fries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk supply to clients

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
María, esta satisfecha por la ayuda que ha recibido de parte de los inversionistas Kiva y Padecomscredito, el préstamo anterior lo utilizo para ir mejorando su negocio, manifiesta que sus ingresos son mejores y los utiliza para cubrir las necesidades familiares.
Está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar frutas, bolsas, gaseosas, jugos, etc., tendrá un mejor inventario para mantener la continuidad de su negocio y seguir teniendo una mejor calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
María is satisfied with the help she's received from the investors at Kiva and Padecomscredito. The previous loan was used to improve her business.  Her income is better and she uses it to cover her family's needs.  
She's requesting a new loan to buy fruits, bags, sodas, juice, etc.  This way she will have a better inventory and will maintain the continuity of her business so she can give a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: comprar frutas, bolsas, gaseosas, jugos, etc., tendrá un mejor inventario para mantener la continuidad de su negocio

loans.name: Dunstan

texts.en: Dunstan is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells concrete building stones. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are house builders. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a machine for cutting stones. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years.

loans.use: to buy a machine for cutting stones

loans.name: Cissin Wendteldo Group

texts.fr:
Mme SALAMATA est la représentante du groupe CISSIN WENDTELDO. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 03ans.02 vont à l’école et elle à 07 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des œufs depuis 03 ans. Mme s’approvisionne en Cote d'Ivoire et à Bobo.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 150 plaquettes d’œufs.

Ses bénéfices vont servir à agrandir son activité. Elle  ambitions s'acheter une parcelle( un terrain).
texts.en:
Mrs. Salamata represents the Cissin Wendteldo group. She is the married mother of three children, the eldest of whom is ten and the youngest less than three years old. Two of them go to school and she has seven persons under her care.

She has been selling eggs for the past three years. She resupplies in Ivory Coast and in Bobo. She wants to use the granted loan to buy 150 trays of eggs.

Profits will be used to expand her business. Her ambition is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: buy 150 trays of eggs

loans.name: Iris Aracely

texts.es:
Iris, está acompañada, junto a su pareja tienen cinco hijos menores de edad, para apoyar con los gastos que se generan en su hogar, hace seis años decidió instalar en su vivienda una tienda de productos básicos y una venta de pupusas, en la tienda trabaja todos los días mientras que las pupusas las vende solo cuatro días a la semana, trabaja sola y por lo momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Invertirá en productos enlatados, bebidas, pastas, harina, condimentos, aceite, quesillo, chicharrón, granos básicos, verduras, etc., para elaborar la venta de pupusas y surtir mejor la tienda, espera que su clientela aumente para tener mejores ingresos, no tiene muchas dificultades ya que la mayoría de productos son larga duración.
Iris tiene como objetivos administrar de la mejor manera el crédito, lograr tener un negocio más competitivo y darles a sus hijos educación, vestuario y alimentación.
texts.en:
Iris has 5 young children with her partner.  To help with the home expenses, she decided to open a store in her house 6 years ago selling basic products and pupusas. She opens the store everyday but only sells pupusas 4 days a week.  She works alone and for now she has had no difficulties in her business.  
She will invest in canned products, drinks, pastas, flour, condiments, oil, cheese, pork rinds, basic grains, vegetables, etc. for preparing the pupusas and stock her store.  She hopes to have more clients to have a better income.  She doesn't have many difficulties given that the products last a long time.  
Iris' goal is to manage her loan in the best possible way, make her business more competitive and give her children a good education, clothes, and food.

loans.use: to invest in canned products, drinks, pastas, flour, condiments, oil, cheese, pork rinds, basic grains, vegetables, etc. for preparing the pupusas and stock her store.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a farmer. She runs a farm which includes three cows, four calves, 16 colonies of bees and hens. Aida also cultivates wheat near her house. Besides farming, she also has too much work about the house and too many family members to take care of. Aida lives with her husband, parents-in-law and three children. 

Aida has been working for several years at the dry cleaning company as a worker. Her salary is not enough for their big family, especially if we take into consideration that her elder daughter is going to continue her study after school, which means a lot of new expenses will be incurred by the family. Aida has applied for this loan to invest on her farm. She needs to purchase two calves, fertilizer and pesticides to develop the farm and earn income for her family.
 
This is Aida's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions, was very difficult to pay back, and Aida faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her recent hard work, she and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. So Aida has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for two calves, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm to develop it and get income for family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in thread of diffferent colors to make hammocks, bedspreads and tablecloths for sale.

loans.name: Truptiena

texts.en:
Truptiena is a single woman who has no children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To boost the brew business by buying sorghum for fermenting local brew

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman; she has three children, all of whom attend school. Mary lives in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mary has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned products, basic grains, drinks, soap, etc. to satisfy her client needs.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, tiene 56 años de edad, vive con su esposa, le encanta trabajar en su negocio, el cual consiste en ofrecer el servicio de taller eléctrico automotriz, su horario de trabajo es de seis de la mañana  a cuatro de la tarde, lo tiene ubicado en el patio trasero de su casa, tiene un empelado que le ayuda a atender a sus clientes y adema es su hermano, el oficio lo aprendió desde que tenía 12 años.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar cables, herramientas y otros materiales para reparar los motores que sus clientes le llevan a su negocio, será de mucha ayuda para mejorar el servicio y calidad de su trabajo para tener clientes satisfechos.
Sus sueños son continuar trabajando para que su negocio crezca y también ofrecer empleo, ya que de esta manera no solo dará mejores oportunidades de desarrollo a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 56 years old, lives with his wife, and loves to work on his business as a automotive electrician.  He works from 6AM to 4PM in his backyard with one more employee, his brother, who helps take care of the clients.  He learned the craft when he was 12 years old.  
He will use the loan to buy cables, tools, and other materials to repair the engines that his clients bring to him.  The loan will help a lot in improving the service and quality of his work and in keeping his clients satisfied.  
His dream is to keep working to grow his business and also to offer employment to others, helping not only his family but also others who need jobs.

loans.use: to buy cables, tools, and other materials to repair the engines that his clients bring to him.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela, ha sabido invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio, pudo tener los pedidos de hamacas en el tiempo acordado con sus clientes y también atrajo nuevos clientes, se encuentra muy bien de salud y junto a su familia disfrutan de un mejor estilo de vida.
Se siente entusiasmada por su progreso y como desea mantenerlo solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar hilos de diferentes colores y grosores para la producción de hamacas, otra parte lo invertirá en concentrado para alimentar a los cerdos, de manera se mantendrá trabajando.
texts.en:
Ángela invested well the previous loan and was able to deliver the hammocks to her clients on time and she also gained more clients.  She remains healthy and her family enjoys a better quality of life.  
She's excited by her progress and to keep the momentum going she's requesting a new loan to buy threads of different colors and thickness to make hammocks.  The rest of the loan she will invest in feed for pigs to keep that part of the business too.

loans.use: to buy threads of different colors and thickness to make hammocks and will invest in feed for pigs.

loans.name: Mercedes Cecilia

texts.es:
Mercedes, ha mejorado notablemente su negocio con la ayuda del préstamo anterior, sus nuevos ingresos son de mucha utilidad para ir mejorando el estilo de vida que lleva junto a su familia.
Considerando que la demanda de sus productos es un poco mayor y no cuenta con el inventario ideal, opta por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar pantalones, camisas, vestidos, faldas, y otras prendas de vestir que sus clientes estén solicitando, espera que las ventas se mantengan y pueda ir teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mercedes has significantly improved her business thanks to the previous loan.  Her new income is very useful for improving her family's quality of life.
Considering the increased demand for her products and that she doesn't have the ideal inventory, she's requesting a new loan to buy pants, shirts, dresses, skirts, and other clothing items her clients are requesting.  She hopes her sales keep improving and she can have more income.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, dresses, skirts, and other clothing items her clients are requesting.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan es un hombre trabajador de 33 años de edad que se gana la vida con su negocio de elaboración de hamacas, colchas y manteles, actividad que ya lleva realizando 3 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia ha logrado elaborar productos de excelente calidad  que son muy solicitados por sus clientes. Juan vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 1 año de edad que es su mayor alegría. Juan desea realizar una inversión en su negocio, ya que desea ofrecer una mayor cantidad y variedad de productos a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en hilos de colores para elaborar manteles, colchas y hamacas para vender, y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en: Juan is a hardworking 33 year old man. He earns a living with his business making hammocks, blankets and aprons. He has been doing this activity for 3 years. Thanks to his experience, he has been able to make products of excellent quality that are much sought after by his customers. Juan lives with his life's companion and their 1 year old son, who is his biggest joy. Juan wants to make an investment in the business, because he wants to offer a larger quantity and variety of product to his customers. That is why he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in colored thread to make aprons, blankets and hammocks to sell. This way, he can improve his income to offer his child a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in colored thread to make aprons, blankets and hammocks to sell.

loans.name: Francias Camilo

texts.es: Francis es un hombre de 29 años de edad, es soltero pero tiene una hija de 4 años, se ha desempeñado como trabajar gran parte de su vida, recibiendo un salario algo modesto que le alcanzaba apenas para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, cansado de esto, cansado del conformismo, de la desigualdad, quiere iniciar un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, donde busca crecer, emprender, mejorar la calidad de vida, darle a su hija lo que le pida, quiere comprar casa, tener varias sucursales, ingresos altos, salir de pobre, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar un negocio de comidas rápidas que es el que podemos ver en la foto, comprara todo tal cual y lo iniciara a trabajar lo más pronto posible, parte del préstamo será destinado a la compra de insumos, utensilios y uniformes corporativos.
texts.en: Francis is a 29 year old man. He is single and has a 4 year old daughter. He has worked for most of  is life, receiving a somewhat modest salary that was just enough to cover his basic needs. He tired of this, tired of conforming, and of inequality. He wants to start a business telling fast food, where he seeks to grow, become an entrepreneur, improve his quality of life, and give his daughter whatever she asks. He wants to buy a house, have several locations, high income, and leave poverty. That is why he wants to ask for a loan to buy a fast food business, which can be seen in the photo. He will buy everything and start running it as soon as possible. Part of the loan will be used to buy materials, utensils and company uniforms.

loans.use: to buy the food stall which is seen in the photo.

loans.name: Sara Ines

texts.es:
Sara, tiene una venta de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y mucha variedad de productos de uso personal, la fundo hace 5 años, trabaja todos los días con un horario de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, es la forma en que ella obtiene ingresos para costear los gastos de su hogar; vive solo con su hijo, no cuanta con apoyo económico del extranjero.
Invertirá el préstamo que está solicitando en la compra de lociones, cosméticos, desodorantes, etc., para tener mercadería del gusto de sus clientes, Sara cree que al ofrecer mejores ofertas su negocio crecerá y su situación económica será más favorable.
El sueño que tiene la Sra., Sara es tener una casa propia en la cual pueda compartir una vida más digna con su hijo.
texts.en:
Sara has a business selling perfumes, creams, cosmetics and a wide variety of personal use products. She started it 5 years ago and she works every day with a schedule from 7 in the the morning until four in the afternoon. That is how she obtains income to pay for the household expenses. She lives with just her son and has no financial support from abroad. 

She will invest the loan she is asking for is to buy lotions, cosmetics, deodorant, etc., in order to have merchandise that her customers like. Sara believes that by having a better selection, her business will grow and her financial situation will be more favorable.

Sara's dream is to have her own house so she can share a more dignified life with her son.

loans.use: to buy lotion, cosmetics, deodorants, etc., in order to have merchandise that her customers like.

loans.name: Edi Yohana

texts.es:
Ella es Edi una joven d e26 años de edad que junto con su madre quieren iniciar con un negocio de venta de alimentos fritos, como empanadas, pasteles, papas rellenas, esta idea les surgió por necesidad económica ellas viven juntas y quieren tener una actividad económica para pagar sus cuentas.

La idea inicial es vender al frente de su casa, aprovechar que transita mucha gente y estos productos pro su olor y sabor son muy provocativos y de diario consumo, este dinero será destinado para el pago de su alimentación, servicios públicos y si todo marcha bien montaran un negocio de alimentos para financiar una vivienda propia.

Edi solo quiere encontrar algo para hacer, está desesperada, ella sueña quiere progresar, quiere triunfar y tener siempre al lado a la persona que más ama que es su madre, por ello solicitar un préstamo para comprar lo necesario para iniciar lo más pronto posible con su empresa.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una fritodora,  dos mesas, 8 sillas e insumos.
texts.en:
This is Edi. She is a 26 year old woman who wants to start a business with her mother selling fried food such as empanadas, pastries, stuffed potato. They got this idea out of financial necessity. They live together and want to have a financial activity to pay their bills. 

The initial idea is to sell in front of their house in order to take advantage of the fact that a lot of people go by and the aroma and flavor of these products are very provocative and consumed daily. This money will be used to pay for food and utilities. If everything goes well, they will open the food business to pay for their own home.

Edi just wants to find something to do. She is desperate and she dreams of progress, She wants to triumph and always have the person she loves the most by her side, her mother. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy what she needs as soon as possible with her business.

The loan will be used to buy a fryer, two tables, 8 chairs and ingredients.

loans.use: to buy a fryer, two tables, 8 chairs and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow, to provide more milk to clients and expand her agricultural business

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila is forty years old. She is married, with two children. 

She runs a green grocery business in Kalawa. She has operated the business for nine years. Her monthly income is ten thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase stock of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, ripe bananas and cabbages. 

She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for their children. 

Her future aspiration is to be able to provide well for her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, ripe bananas and cabbages, to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour in order to boost her business

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Pilar is 59 years old and has one child in school.

Pilar has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Pilar has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Pilar would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda, 44, is a married woman with five children who are all in school.. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall to save to send her children to college

loans.name: Wagwa School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Dauda. He is the Head teacher of Wagwa Memorial Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Lukaya in Masaka with 410 students. Wagwa School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Wagwa School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Dauda ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm tools and farm inputs for a better harvest so as to meet customer and family demands and be financially stable

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new shaving machines in order to be able to educate his children and become financially stable.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 39 years old and married with two children. With one child is still in school, Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products.

Maribel has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is from Aygavan village and lives with her husband and son. 
Her son works at local confectionery and Natalya with her husband runs their family farm. They keep livestock of cows, calf, two sows and two piglets. They also own a plot of land where they cultivate tomato, eggplant and haricot beans. Selling harvest in the local market is very important source of income for the family, so Natalya and her family would like to expand their farming business. 

Natalya has applied for this loan to purchase  arable land (3 hectares), fertilizer, tomato seeds and hire workers for harvesting works. 
This is Natalya's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions, was very difficult to pay back, and Natalya faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her recent hard work, she and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So Natalya has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for arable land (3 hectares), fertilizer, tomato seeds and hire workers for harvesting works

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 29 years old, married and supports a family of 3 members. He has been practicing small scale farming for the last 7 years earning KES6,000 per month. 

Evans has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs and tools for use in order to realize high production and supply for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to buy a plot and build rentals. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and tools for use in order to realize high production and supply for more income gain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings for planting in order to become financially stable

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm tools to improve her produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his farming through buying of certified seedlings and seedlings for planting, to help pay for his children's education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production which will pay for the education of his children

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary 59 years old, supports a family of 6 members. 

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 7 years earning an income of KES9,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for farming.

Her plans are to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand her farming activity . 

Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizers and seedlings for farming, so as to be able to expand her farming activity

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man and a father of two. He resides in the informal settlement of Nairobi where he interacted with Fresh Life Operator and developed interest of having two in each of his plots.  He is a land lord and currently has over forty rental units.

He plans to have two fresh life toilets in each of his plots. He believes there will be a lot of improvement in sanitation standards in the plots hence high tenant retention. He will pay the loan using his rental income.

loans.use: To pay for two Fresh Life Toilets to improve the lives of his tenants

loans.name: Beryle

texts.en:
This is Beryle. She has operated a ladies shoes selling business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a Kiva of Kes 40,000 loan to purchase additional women's shoes. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Beryle dreams that her children will finish their studies, and she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional women's shoes, to help finance her children's schooling and expand her business

loans.name: Bunda

texts.en:
Bunda is a married man and has three children. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, he has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. His potential customers are neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Bunda dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that he is requesting of Kes 100,000, he wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize
 flour, beans and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize  flour, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana has been living and running farm in Noyakert village for already 20 years. Her farm includes 50 hens and arable land where she cultivates corn , watermelon and melon. Svetlana also takes care of her orchard where she cultivates ten peach, apricot, and five trees of plum. Svetlana's husband is a big support for her. He takes the gathered harvest to the local markets and sells it. Besides the farm, Svetlana also has big family to take care of. She lives with her parents-in-law, husband and three school aged children. 

Svetlana applied for this loan, to invest on her farm and develop it. She plans to purchase watermelon and corn seeds, fertilizer, pesticides for land cultivation and hire workers for land cultivation works. 

As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Svetlana get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Svetlana hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for watermelon and corn seeds, fertilizer, pesticides for land cultivation and hire workers for land cultivation works

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy quarrying materials to ease the quarrying process.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 37 years old, married, and supports a family of six members. He has been operating his retail shop for the last seven years earning KES 8,000 per month.

Julius has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more retail goods for resale for more income gain. He plans to use the anticipated profits to buy a plot and build rentals. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more retail goods for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot for more farming activities

loans.name: Norma Lorena

texts.es:
Norma, ha tenido una experiencia satisfactoria con el uso del crédito anterior, está ofreciendo un menú más variado a sus clientes, sus ingresos son mejores, ella y sus hijos tienen  una vida más confortable, hasta la fecha no ha tenido dificultades para mantener su negocio con vida.
Solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar pan, carnes, embutidos, tomates, lechugas, etc., para elaborar hamburguesas, hot dogs, nachos, etc., el resto servirá para adquirir un freezer en el que conservara sus productos para evitar que se descompongan, espera continuar teniendo su fuente de ingresos en el mercado.
texts.en:
Norma has had a satisfactory experience with the use of her previous loan. She is offering a more varied menu to her customers, her income is higher, she and her children have a more comfortable life, and to date she has not had any difficulties with maintaining her business. 

She asks for another loan to purchase bread, meat, cold cuts, tomatoes, lettuce, etc. to make hamburgers, hot dogs, nachos, etc. The rest will serve to get a freezer where she can keep her products to prevent them from going bad. She hopes to continue having her source of income in the market.

loans.use: to purchase bread, meat, cold cuts, tomatoes, lettuce, etc. to make hamburgers, hot dogs, nachos, etc.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Eunice operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Ulises Francisco

texts.es:
Ulises, vive con su grupo familiar compuesto por su esposa y sus hijos, su actividad económica ofrecer el servicio de reparaciones de motores de bombas achicadores, plantas generadoras de energía eléctrica, motores de vehículos, electrodomésticos, etc.,  en su taller electrónico industrial, lo abrió hace 10 años con capital propio, trabaja de lunes a sábado en un horario de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Necesita de un crédito para tener recursos económicos con los que comprara un juego de llaves, un aparato para soldar, cables, focos, terminales, fusibles y otras herramientas modernas para realizar sus actividades diarias, espera aumentar la capacidad de cobertura y atender mejor a sus clientes.
Sus proyectos son ir mejorando su negocio hasta lograr ser más reconocido en la zona y disminuir sus deudas.
texts.en:
Ulises lives with his family, made up of his wife and children. His work is to do repairs on baler pumps, electric generator plants, vehicle motors, household appliances, etc. in his industrial electronic shop. He opened it 10 years ago with his own capital. He works Monday to Saturday with a schedule from eight in the morning to five in the afternoon.

He needs a loan to have economic resources with which he will purchase a set of wrenches, a tool for soldering, cables, lights, terminals, fuses, and other modern tools to do his work. He hopes to expand his coverage capacity and to serve his customers better.

His projects are to improve his business until it becomes more recognized in the zone and to reduce his debts.

loans.use: to purchase a set of wrenches, a tool for soldering, cables, lights, terminals, fuses, and other modern tools to do his work.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a constructor from Artashat town. Armen lives with his wife and two children, an 11-year-old daughter and a 4-year-old son. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Armen hopes for lenders' support and goodwill. This loan will help Armen to purchase a rotary hammer drill in order to take on more home reconstruction contracts and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a rotary hammer drill needed for reconstruction work

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 52 años de edad, viuda, tiene 2 hijos, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, luchadora, fuerte, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘bajo chuquiaguillo’ ubicada al norte de la ciudad, carece de agua potable, pese a que en su territorio se encuentra la represa de Incachaca, que provee el líquido a gran parte de la urbe, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Ana es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hija que es independiente, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad como; agua, pan, azúcar, harina, fideo, arroz, café, gaseosas, papel, golosinas, etc., actividad que realiza en su tienda de barrio ubicada en la parte baja de su domicilio, “inicié mi negocio por la facilidad de vender en mi propio domicilio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es conocida por los vecinos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para invertir en la compra de mercadería. Su sueño es ahorrar, invertir en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, ella desea consolidar su negocio mediante la compra de mercadería por mayor, como; azúcar, fideo, arroz, enlatados, etc., para abastecer su negocio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para abastecer su tienda y con los beneficios pagar los estudios superiores de su hija.
texts.en:
Ana is a 52-year-old woman, a widow, who has 2 children. Her business is the sale of basic food and products in her neighborhood store. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, determined, strong, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is located in the Bajo Chuquiaguillo zone located to the north of the city. It lacks drinking water, despite the fact that in its area, there is the Incachaca reservoir, which provides the liquid to a large part of the metropolis. It has a dry and cold climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade. 

Ana has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she keeps braided, is short, has a robust physique, dresses traditionally (hat, shawl, and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), her native language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the work she does. She shares her life with her daughter who is independent. They live in their own room built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting which has drinking water, electricity and sewer services. Her business is selling basic products and food such as water, bread, sugar, flour, noodles, rice, coffee, soft drinks, paper, sweets., etc. She does this work in her neighborhood store which is located in the lower part of her house. "I began my business due to the ease of selling in my own home..." she says. The advantage of her business is that it is known by the neighbors. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in the purchase of merchandise. Her dream is to save up, invest in her business, and improve her quality of life. She wants to strengthen her business through the purchase of merchandise in bulk, such as sugar, noodles, rice, canned goods, etc. to stock her business and meet the needs of her customers. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years that she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Ana asks for a loan to stock her store and with the profits, pay for her daughter's higher education.

loans.use: to stock her store and, with the profits, pay for her daughter's higher education.

loans.name: Lingalira Group

texts.en:
A single mother with two children, Madalitso sells secondhand clothes to people surrounding her community. She started this business in order to find adequate funds for supporting her family and relatives. 

Madalitso would like to obtain a loan in order to buy more bales of secondhand clothes, as this will help her to successfully increase her profits.  She dreams of starting another business, so she can fully support her family. 

The previous loans have helped Madalitso to provide food and clothing to her children.

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace lives in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a salon that sells cosmetics, braids, and weaves. She used her previous loan to buy a generator for her salon. Grace is requesting another loan, which she will use to buy braids and cosmetics to sell. She dreams of educating her children to university.

loans.use: to purchase braids and cosmetics

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.en:
Alvaro is 30 years old, single, and describes himself as hardworking, honest and responsible with both personal and professional commitments. He says that he is stable, calm and happy. 

He works as a line manager in a company that provides electronic security products and also is studying for a Masters Degree. 

Alvaro is asking for a loan to pay college tuition; he says that this is his last semester and after he graduates he will be able to earn a higher salary and grow professionally.

loans.use: To pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 29 years old, married to Wilfred and supports a family of five. She has been running her cafe for the last five years, earning an income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.
 
Anne has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to improve her cafe by repainting it and buying new utensils. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand her farming activity. Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to repaint her cafe and buy new utensils

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
The nice woman in the photo is Narine from Aygabats village in the Shirak region. Narine is a mother of two children and, together with her husband, works hard to sustain her family. She is involved in farming, which is the main source of her family's income. Besides her own plot of land, Narine also rents arable land and cultivates wheat, barley, and grass. She also keeps livestock and has cows, sheep, calves, two mother pigs, and 18 piglets. 

To purchase seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation and her farming business, Narine asks for this loan. She wants to enlarge her land cultivation to earn more income for her family. Because the region where Narine's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Narine's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF International and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation to develop her farming business

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en: Hamisu is a Babban Gona farmer from Kunkumi Vilage. Hamisu joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hamisu will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Hamisu would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy land for constructing rental houses.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 39 year old married man with 5 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is involved in transport business and at the same time does farming that adds him more income. He is faced with hardships of limited capital and bad roads that cause constant mechanical breakdowns hindering the progress of his businesses. However, he is working very hard to make sure he educates all his children to higher levels of learning. Patrick has asked for a loan to buy tiles for flooring his house.

loans.use: to buy tiles for flooring his house.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kwankwarmi Village. Dauda joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dauda will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dauda now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en: Gambo is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rumi Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Gambo no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, increasing his income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Gambo now has the opportunity to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a Babban Gona farmer from Rumi Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Daniel no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to expand his farm land. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, increasing his income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Daniel now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields and enable him to buy more land

loans.name: Istifanus

texts.en:
Istifanus is a Babban Gona farmer from Galadima Mayau Vilage. Istifanus joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Istifanus will have access to top-of-the-line farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds. 

This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. 

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Istifanus would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a Babban Gona farmer from Mayau Rumi Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Joseph no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the line farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria, increasing his income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Joseph now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary of Kamwenge, Uganda used her previous loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell. She still deals in the selling of secondhand clothes for children as her main source of income.
