The main reason for venturing into this business was to cater to her family needs, though she complains of the same challenges of inadequate capital, competition and seasonal markets for her clothes. She has hopes of owning a wholesale boutique,educating her children to the university and constructing a good residential house.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to her customers. in order to save for her children to go to university

loans.name: Elly

texts.en: Elly a married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda is 45 years old. Elly ventured into a dairy milk business in 2007 on realizing that he can get an available market for his products. He used the previous loan to buy a milk cooler so as to preserve the milk he sells to his customers. Elly has a dream of expanding his business to suit the increasing market demands. He is hardworking though challenged by weather and limited capital. He intends to use the loan to buy second milk cooler for better services.

loans.use: to buy second milk cooler for better services.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma Village. Iliya joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Iliya will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. 

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Iliya would like to use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase this farmer’s yields

loans.name: Tweimukye Kitonya Farmers Group

texts.en: Ben is 30 years old and a resident of Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a bar and sells waragi (Ugandan gin). He has been in this business since 2009. Ben supplements his income with farming. Ben is hard working and plans to grow his business to a big bar and also to start supplying waragi to the city. His major challenge is lack of enough capital for his business. Ben is one of the members of Tweimukye Kitonya group, where members do not pledge security for loans but guarantee one another.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell ahead of the festive season.

loans.name: Julius Ummaru

texts.en: Julius Ummaru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Mayau Rumi Village. Julius Ummaru joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Julius Ummaru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Julius Ummaru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings  to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields which will enable  him to buy more land

loans.name: Abagamba Kamwe Group

texts.en:
Charles is a hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows and sells crops, mostly Irish potatoes, to supplement his family's food supply and also pay school fees for his children. He wishes to have all his children go to university one day. However, his main challenges are poor weather and price fluctuations.
 
Charles is requesting a loan to hire labor to weed his Irish potato crop.

loans.use: to hire labor to weed his Irish potato garden.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a single man. He doesn't have children but he takes care of his parents. Isaac is living with them and he helps them in the little farm they have. Isaac learned about the milking business when he was a child. Now he has the chance to start his own farm so he needs a loan to buy a milking cow that will belong only to him. Isaac is healthy. He works hard and he needs your help because he is only 21 years old. He would like to finish school and to have his own business.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Faapale

texts.en:
Faapale is 21 years old and single with no child. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling daily items such as rice, sugar, salt, chicken, etc. She has been doing this for one year. 

Faapale needs a loan to buy a freezer, a box of mutton flaps, toiletries, drinks, snacks, etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and also to support her family. 

She became a member of SPBD in April this year (2015) to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a box of mutton flaps, toilteries, drinks, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 30 years old and used his previous loan to buy a motorcycle for transport purposes. He is a married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He deals in retail shop of general merchandise after changing his interests from the electronic business. He also owns a bar and motorcycle transport for additional income. 

He desires to educate his children through university and build a good residential house for the family. He is challenged by inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands while his business plan is to turn his business into wholesale in future. 

Julius intends to use this loan to buy soap, basins, sodas, and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, basins, sodas, and beers to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina has agricultural land in Aloran; she is a widow. For a living, she has been a farmer and makes good earnings doing this type of work, which is the primary source of income for her family. To expand her resources,  Marcelina makes it a point to prepare the land well for planting dwarf coconut and banana seedlings, as well as root crops. This preparation gives her the maximum yield and generates a good income.

Recently,  Marcelina needed an amount to pay for clearing land, digging the soil, and planting seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

Marcelina wishes to sustain her business and to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for clearing land, digging the soil, and planting seedlings

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Batsaikhan, 38 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a small company that supplies materials to mining companies since 2011. His wife helps him to run the business and mainly takes care of the household chores and children. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years, and it needs some renovation. So Batsaikhan is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he will renovate his house and create a comfortable environment for his family. Also, his family will burn less coal for heating, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Cherilyn

texts.en:
Cherilyn has always been enthusiastic about farming. She has cultivated their coco land and banana plantation in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, Cherilyn applied for a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, and to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the land is ready for planting. Cherilyn knows that she has to get things right to yield more income in this cropping season. 

In the future, Cherilyn hopes to buy a carabao and cow for additional earnings for their family.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 14 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud is from Lobogon, Aloran, Philippines. She is married and has six adult-age children. 

Salud is managing a direct selling business; she sells products for men, women and children like soap, lotion, perfume, clothes, shoes, sandals, cosmetics and others. She has had this business for nine years. She found it interesting because she can earn income in an easy way through her good salesmanship. 

She requested a loan to pay for more stock to offer more to her customers. Expanding her inventories would also mean an increase to her income. 

Salud has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to have a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to pay for more stock to offer more to her customers

loans.name: Harlen

texts.en:
Harlen is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. 

Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Jovita is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. 

She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to buy a variety of commodities. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en: Celerina, a diligent and hardworking mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store. This way, she will be able to sell more goods, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store

loans.name: Orozbubu

texts.ru: Орозбубу, 47 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. По характеру она очень трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается торговлей товарами широкого потребления в собственном магазине вот уже 16 лет. В обороте у Орозбубу есть товар на сумму 186,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячно она получает прибыль в сумме около 23,000 сом (KGS). Она хочет развить свой бизнес, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товара и расширение ассортимента. Доходы от кредита Орозбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Orozbubu is 47 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She is a very hard-working and responsible woman by nature. For the last 16 years she has been selling consumer goods in her own store as her family's main source of income. Orozbubu has goods worth 186,000 som (KGS) in stock. Each month she makes a profit of about 23,000 som (KGS). She wants to develop her business, and so she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy goods and expand her range. Orozbubu plans to invest the proceeds from the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy products for resale in order to increase the range in her shop.

loans.name: Moises

texts.en:
Moises runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells items like canned goods, noodles, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, beverages and toiletries. He is a 47-year-old single man from Trinidad, Bohol. He is in need of additional capital to continue operating his existing business.

He is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries like soft drinks, liquors and other goods. These will help improve the content of his store and attract more buyers. With these, his income will increase and he will be able to pay his obligations. He is determined to manage his sari-sari (variety) store to become sustainable in the years to come.

Moises hopes to purchase a brand new motorcycle which is very essential in transporting his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries like soft drinks, liquors and other goods.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 22 years old and a single mother with 1 child. She runs a small business selling pancakes and pork buns in her community. She has been doing this for 3 years. Ana has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, cooking oil, containers, soy sauce, yeast, etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ana will start a new business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to a bag of flour, cooking oil, containers, soy sauce, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.en: Victorino is 58 years old and from Tangub. He is a farmer, focusing on planting rice, corn, vegetables, and root crops. This is how he earns a living. Victorino earns a good income each month doing this type of work. As a new member of PMPC, he is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to purchase bags of fertilizer, herbicides, seedlings, and compost. In the future, he hopes to improve his business and to be able to engage in other agricultural business ventures.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer, herbicides, seedlings and compost

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 46 years old and married. Romeo has always dreamed of managing his own business to support his four children. He is now engaged in running a quarrying business, buying and selling sand and gravel to the local community. He used his loan as working capital to pay for more loads of sand and gravel to meet the demand of his increasing customers. 

Romeo is now on his way to repaying the loan with his new profits.

loans.use: to pay for more loads of sand and gravel to meet the demand of his increasing customers

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Retailing helped Erlinda survive for the family. She retails charcoal and brings a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all she needed to do is to weigh and repack the charcoal for her buyers. Erlinda plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail. Erlinda smiles at the fact of providing her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, a persevering and determined mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is thankful that she was granted a 19,000 PHP loan, which she used for spare parts and accessories of her vehicle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to pay for tire replacement, maintenance and registration of her jeepney. Her income from her transportation business will definitely cover her family's everyday needs and the educational expenses of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial that will be given her.

Analyn dreams to be more stable in life and see her children become professionals someday. She prays for the safe trips of her husband driver and their passengers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance, tire replacement and fuel for her jeepney.

loans.name: Santos Porfirio

texts.es:
Santos, es propietario de un taller de estructuras metálicas, vive con su compañera de vida y su madre, por el momento no tienen hijos, en su casa solo viven tres personas; inicio con su negocio hace 13 años, por la necesidad de independencia y apoyar en los gastos familiares, trabaja solo de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, el oficio lo aprendió con la ayuda de un amigo, su ventaja es que ya es muy reconocido por la calidad de sus trabajos.
Necesita comprar hierro de diferentes medidas, láminas, pintura, electrodos y tubos, tendrá el material suficiente para elaborar los distintos pedidos que tiene en esta temporada, espera tener mejores ganancias para comprar nuevas herramientas para su negocio y cancelar sus deudas.
Desea tener un negocio más rentable, mejor equipo de trabajo y darle a su familia un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Santos is the owner of a metalwork shop.  He lives with his partner and his mother.  For now he doesn’t have kids; only three people live in his household.  He began his business 13 years ago due to his need to become independent and help out with family expenses.  He works alone from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon.  He learned this line of work with the help of a friend.  His advantage is that he is already very well known for the quality of his work.

He needs to buy iron in different sizes, sheet metal, paint, electrodes, and pipes.  Then he will have the materials needed to meet different orders that he has this time of year.  He hopes to have better earnings in order to buy new tools for his business and pay off his debts.

He wants to have a more profitable business and better equipment, as well as to give his family a more respectable life.

loans.use: to buy iron in different sizes, sheet metal, paint, electrodes, and pipes in order to have enough supplies to meet different orders this season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia started with a small piggery business and then became boss of her own small meat shop. She has managed to have enough meat supplies for her shop and rolls over her capital to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales because of her good selling skills. 

Recently, she approached Paglaum for much-needed capital to pay for five pigs and bags of feeds. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to pay for five pigs and bags of feeds

loans.name: Marina De Jesus

texts.es:
Marina, continua trabajando en la venta de antojitos y granos básicos, lo cual es posible por el buen uso del crédito anterior, la nueva situación financiera le ha permitido ir cubriendo las necesidades que surgen en su hogar, además ha construido una nueva habitación adjunto a su vivienda.
Para Marina los créditos son herramientas útiles para surtir su negocio, por lo que nuevamente hace la petición de más capital para comprar aceite, yuca, plátanos, azúcar y otros productos para elaborar la venta de antojitos, también piensa invertir en insumos agrícolas para la milpa.
texts.en:
Marina continues to work selling snacks and basic staples; this was made possible due to the good use of her previous loan.  Her new financial situation has allowed her to cover the needs that crop up in her home.  She has also built a new room next to her house.

These loans are a useful tools for Marina to stock her business, so she is once again asking for more capital to buy oil, yuca, plantains, sugar, and other ingredients for making and selling snacks.  She also is thinking of investing in agricultural supplies for her small farm.

loans.use: to buy oil, yuca, plantains, sugar, and other ingredients for making and selling snacks; also to invest in farming supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. 

At the age of 44 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Haide wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Julieta Del Socorro

texts.es: Emprender un nuevo negocio ha sido la principal meta de Doña Julieta y con esfuerzo y dedicación la ha logrado cumplir, su familia ha sido su principal apoyo. Hace diez años que se dedica al negocio de venta de calzado de cuero, el cual le ha dejado buenas ganancias. Doña Julieta desea seguir invirtiendo en el negocio es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para comprar calzado de varón, de esta manera podrá obtener mejores ingresos económicos para ella y su familia y también mantenerse activa en el negocio.
texts.en:
Undertaking a new business has been Julieta’s main goal.  With effort and dedication, she has managed to do so.  Her family has been her primary support.  She has been in the business of selling leather shoes for ten years.  It has left her with good earnings.

Julieta wishes to continue investing in her business.  It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan to buy men’s shoes.  This way she will be able to get better income for her and for her family, and she will also keep her business active.

loans.use: to buy men’s shoes.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Marife runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items likes biscuits, candies, chocolates, soap, beverages, condiments and soft drinks. Aside from that, she also is engaged in selling Avon products and an RTW (ready-to-wear) business, selling items like pants, shorts, T-shirts and many others. She is a married woman with three dependents. She lives in Loon, Bohol. 

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies like pants, T-shirts and Avon products like bags and fashion jewelries. These will help enhance the variety of her stock and will attract more buyers to come. With this, her earnings will improve and she will be able to provide her children with nutritious diets.

Marife hopes that she will be successful in handling her sources of income for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy supplies like pants, T-shirts and Avon products like bags and fashion jewelries

loans.name: Naranzul

texts.en:
Mrs. Naranzul, 35 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been supplying maintenance materials to mining companies since 2013. Her husband works as a manager at a private company. Their children go to school. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy plastics, heating and cooling equipment in order to build a greenhouse on her family's land. She will grow vegetables such as tomatoes, carrots and cabbage in the greenhouse in order to meet domestic needs.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. Her husband is a farmer focusing on rice farming, and he manages a small piggery. 

Arlene is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Arlene wants to repair and expand her house to live comfortably with her family. Recently, she applied for a loan. This loan is intended to purchase marine plywood and roof sheets and pay for coco lumbering. She is on her way to repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase marine plywood and roof sheeting and pay for coco lumbering to repair her house

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el posee un gimnasio ubicado cerca de su casa en un zona muy transitada, tiene muchos 2 años de tener su negocio y posee muchos clientes por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de atender, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de bicicletas estacionarias así como refrescos y aguas para tener más clientes y el tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos is 63 years old. He lives in his own home with his son. 

He owns a gym near his home in a heavily travelled area. He has been in business for 2 years and has many customers due to the courtesy he extends when he assists them. Thanks to his work he has been able to get ahead. 

He is asking for a loan in order to buy stationary bicycles as well as soft drinks and water in order to have more clients and better income.

loans.use: to buy stationary bicycles for his gym.

loans.name: Manzurahan

texts.ru: Манзурахан, 57 лет, замужем, есть 2 взрослых и уже самостоятельных детей. У Манзурахан среднее образование, с 1977 года она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря целеустремленности, упорству и трудолюбию Манзурахан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров. Все условия для содержания скота есть. Выращиваемую на собственном участке мерою 10,73 ГА продукцию, преимущественно рис, она продает. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Манзурахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья скота с целью дальнейшей реализации и на подготовку почвы. Доходы от кредита Манзурахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Manzurahan is 57 and married with two adult children who live independently. She has a high school education and has been working in agriculture and animal husbandry since 1977. Thanks to her purposefulness, effort and hard work she currently has five cows on her farm as well as everything necessary to take good care of them. She also has 10.73 hectares of her own land where she grows primarily rice for sale. Her monthly income is about 15,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Manzurahan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase livestock to increase her head count with the goal of further selling them, as well as to cultivate her land. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and to cultivate her land

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bicycle taxi business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy an additional bicycle for her bicycle taxi business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Zenaida's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 36 years old and married with two children. She lives in an urban community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

Amy owns and operates a small general store in her community. She has four years of experience with this business.

She needs a loan to restock her general store. She plans to use her profits to meet her family's weekly expenses and provide a better living for her family.

Amy joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new stock, such as bags of rice, noodles, bags of sugar, biscuits and cooking oil for her general store.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is from Tangub. She is 36 years old and is single. Mildred owns and operates a retail store selling assorted goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Mildred joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Mildred is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional store inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional store inventory and have working capital.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda has always been enthusiastic about farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Liloan, Bonifacio, in the Philippines and has made good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, Erlinda applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation for the next cropping season and for the purchase of higher yielding rice seeds and bags of fertilizer. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Erlinda knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Erlinda hopes to buy a hauling truck for the easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation for the next cropping season and for the purchase of higher yielding rice seeds and bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Primativa

texts.en:
Primativa is 60 years old, married, and has six children. She is from Tangub, Philippines. She operates a fish vending business. In 2012, she applied for membership in Paglaum-Multi Purpose Cooperative in order to seek financial services and insurances. Since then, she has been a good member and repays her obligations in a timely manner. 

Primativa requested a loan for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to finance farming activities such as land plowing, leveling, cleaning of dikes, and purchasing farm inputs. She has found assistance for her family's financial needs through PMPC and is grateful.

loans.use: to finance farming activities such as land plowing, leveling, cleaning of dikes, and purchasing farm inputs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is married with four children. Her husband is a fisherman. From her desire to help the family, Marilyn signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the necessary capital to start up a sari-sari store (general store) business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Marilyn has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wanted to take advantage of this good fortune so, recently, she took out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce and pay for fishing nets and accessories. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce and pay for fishing nets and accessories.

loans.name: Feve

texts.en: Feve is 28 years of age and a resident of Migcanaway, Tangub, Philippines. She is married with three kids. Her family has a little fishing business from which to earn a living. With their business they meet many challenges, but they realize that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. Feve and her husband work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested from Kiva's partner, Paglaum MPC, a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase new fishing nets. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help should there be a need for working capital in the future. Feve smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en: Peregrina earns an income by selling various seafood like crabs, lobsters, shells, and seaweeds. She also produces shrimp pastes to sell. Peregrina is a fully fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to be used as additional working capital to purchase more stock of a variety of seafood to expand her business and increase her resources. She is on her way to repaying her loan from her new profits. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family, and to earn an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of a variety of seafood to expand her business and increase her resources

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
His name is Jeffrey, 23, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. He is still single and has an entrepreneurial spirit. Jeffrey already has a small general store to support himself and assist his parents in their everyday personal and household needs. He also retails mobile phone minutes to subscribers. 

In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a little cooking oil, or an egg. He profits by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 1500 PHP in sales every day. 

To help him continue operations of his business he is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan that he will use to pay for sacks of rice and for grocery items such as canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages. He is positive this will boost his income as he expands his business. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him.

Jeffrey aims to grow his store and have a big rice retailing store. He desires and prays to have a family of his own soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to add sacks of rice to sell at his small general store.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee una peque tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años y también a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como sopas, huevos, granos básicos, aceite entre otras cosas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. She has a small store located in her residential location for 3 years and also has worked in agriculture for 15 years. With what she obtains from her sales she has achieved a solution for household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more products such as soups, eggs, basic grains, and oil, among other products and as such be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy more products such as soups, eggs, basic grains, and oil among other things.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.pt:
Patricio tem 34 anos de idade, casado e não tem filhos. É funcionário de Ministério de educação, sustenta o seu sobrinho.
Com o empréstimo de 40.000,00mts pretende comprar cervejas de diversas marcas, amendoim, arroz, feijão, óleo da cozinha, caldo, açúcar e outros produtos para revender.
Ele tem o sonho de criar uma empresa de produção animal (bovino e suino) e, prende-se com a dificuldade financeira, o que faz com que o seu sonho demore concretizar e, tem o desafio de reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo acordado.
texts.en:
Patricio is 34 years old, married and doesn't have any children. He works at the Ministry of Education and supports his nephew.

With this loan of 40,000 MZN he intends to purchase beer (various brands), peanuts, rice, beans, kitchen oil, stock, sugar and other products for resale.

His dream is to build a company rearing cattle and pigs and but he is trapped by financial difficulties so his dreams will take longer to come true. His challenge is to pay bak the loan in the agreed length of time.

loans.use: purchase beer (various brands), peanuts, rice, beans, kitchen oil, stock, sugar and other products for resale.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is 27 years old, married, and has one child. She operates a sari-sari store. Her earnings help her family with their daily needs. 

Marivel requested a loan, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. An increase in her store inventory will result in an increase in her sales and income. Marivel plans to expand her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is from Bonifacio, in the Philippines. She and her husband have agricultural land and earn a living through farming. They have also cultivated rice land near their home. 

Juliet makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan from Paglaum MPC to finance farming activities such as clearing, holing and planting on her land, and purchase farm inputs. She wishes to sustain her business and to be able to supply more crops in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to finance farming activities such as clearing, holing and planting on her land, and purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Sharifzhan

texts.ru: Шарифжан, 52 года, женат, 5 детей. У него среднее образование, очень ответственный и пунктуальный. На протяжении многих лет Шарифжан занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес в 1995 году почти с нуля. На сегодняшний день прибыль Шарифжана составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. У него в хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 9 овец, он реализует молоко оптовым покупателям на ежедневной основе. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шарифжан обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Шарифжан планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и пристройку кухни к дому.
texts.en: Sharifzhan is 52 years old, married, and has five children. He has a secondary education and he is very responsible and punctual. Sharifzhan has been a farmer for many years, having started this business in 1995 practically from nothing. Today Sharifzhan's profits are about 13,000 som (KGS) each month. He has five cows and nine sheep, and he sells milk daily to wholesale buyers. In order to further develop his business, Sharifzhan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock and feed for livestock. Sharifzhan plans to invest the proceeds from the loan in further developing his business and adding a kitchen to his house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed for livestock.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is gearing up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have all the farm inputs she may need, for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Beatriz hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations, and purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Jurinda

texts.en:
Jurinda is thankful that she was granted a 19,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her child to school and meet the daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods and cellular phone loads that she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales, and thus, increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her child. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Jurinda dreams of having a bigger general store. She wants her child to have a college education and assist her nieces in their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Bebina

texts.en:
Bebina is married and makes a good earning with every cropping on her rice farm in Liloan, Bonifacio, in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting her family with her husband. Bebina has been able to provide her children with a good education, until they graduated and secured stable jobs. 

Bebina pawned her 1-hectare rice land when her children entered college. Now, with the help and support of her son, she wishes to access a PMPC loan to pay for the acquisition of her pawned rice land. Bebina has high hopes that she will have a higher yield on her rice farm next cropping, and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for the acquisition of her pawned rice land

loans.name: Marquieta

texts.en:
Marquieta has always been an enthusiastic farmer who has grown rice on her land in Molave. She consistently has a good yield and strong earnings from the business she has managed, but would like to be even more productive. That is why she has applied for a loan to prepare her land and seedbed and ensure that her rice field is ready for planting. 

Marquieta knows that she has to get things right to earn a higher income in the upcoming season. In the future, she hopes to buy another rice land to cultivate.

loans.use: to prepare her land and seedbed and ensure that her rice field is ready for planting

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima has been preparing for the post harvest operations of her palay (rice farm) in Bonifacio. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for threshing, drying, storage, and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. 

Prima requested a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to pay for post harvest activities. Prima hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is married and has two adult children. He operates a rice farm with the help of his wife who also operates a sari sari store. Nilo wants to earn more income for future use and investment in another business so he needs a good rice harvest in order to increase rice sales. 

Nilo requested a loan, which he will use to purchase fertilizer for his rice field. He plans to buy a new vehicle for delivery of his rice to the market.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his rice field.

loans.name: Tenning's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été crée en octobre 2007. Il regroupe des femmes du même village et qui s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche.
Tenning debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est veuve et mère 7 enfants dont 3 filles et 4 garçons.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter un veau et elle mène parallèlement une activité  de restauration, vente de petit déjeuner. Elle achète le veau à 125 000 FCFA voire 150 000 FCFA selon les prix du marché.Elle achète de l'aliment de bétail  et autres produits afférant à l’élevage pour 50 000 FCFA. Après élevage, elle le revend à 250 000 FCFA et même jusqu'à 300 000 FCFA. Avec le reste du prêt elle va acheter différents produits pour l’activité de restauration qu'elle mène. Elle achète deux sacs d’oignon l’unité à 6000 FCFA. Elle achète de l'huile pour 14 000 FCFA, une tablette d’œuf à 2100 FCFA, du maggi pour 2 000 FCFA, ail 500 FCFA, piment 500 FCFA, poivre 500 FCFA.
Avec les bénéfices, elle va participer à des tontines qui vont lui permettre  d’épargner. Les bénéfices vont aussi lui servir à construire une maison pour ses enfants vu qu'elle a déjà acquis un terrain.
texts.en:
This group is part of a Banc Villageois which was created in October 2007. It brings together women from the same vilage who are active primarily in commerce and livestock raising. 

Tenning, who is standing on the right in the photo and raising her hand, is 58 years old. She is a widow and the mother of seven children, three daughters and four sons. 

 With the loan, she is going to buy a calf. At the same time, she has a cooked food business, selling breakfasts. She will buy the calf at between 125,000 F CFA and 150,000 F CFA, according to the market price. She is buying livestock feed and other products necessary for raising livestock for 50,000 F CFA. After raising her animal, she will resell it for 250,000 F CFA up to 300,000 F CFA.

With the remainder of the loan, she is going to buy various products for her cooked food business. She will buy two sacks of onions, each costing 6,000 F CFA. She will buy oil for 14,000 F CFA, a cardboard crate of eggs for 2,100 F CFA, some Maggi cubes for 2,000 F CFA, garlic for 500 F CFA, and red peppers for 500 F CFA.

With the profits, she will participate in some "merry-go-round" revolving savings groups which will allow her to save up. The profits will also be used to construct a house for her children, given that she has already acquired a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a calf, and also some onions, oil, and eggs, etc.

loans.name: Dashdavaa

texts.en: Mr. Dashdavaa, 48 years old, lives with his wife in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a maintenance engineer for fifteen years. His wife works as a janitor at a private company. This year their son will graduate from his university and their daughter is studying medicine in a Chinese university. Using his previous loan, he has paid his daughter's tuition fee and his daughter is showing academic success. He is requesting a loan of 1,550 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and planks in order to renovate his house. After that, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollutant into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita earns a living by providing cosmetology services. She engages in manicure and pedicure services to the locals in her area.  She is a 54-year old married woman with five dependents. Two of her children are still attending school, ages 14 and 18 respectively. She lives in Antequera, Bohol.
 
Julita is asking for a loan to purchase one set of manicure tools. These will help improve her services and enable her to cater to large numbers of customers. With these, her income will increase. Thus, she will be able to continue to send her children to school and provide for their basic needs.

Julita is determined enough to handle her current livelihood for sustainable living in the future to come.

loans.use: to purchase one set of manicure tools

loans.name: Kenia Emperatriz

texts.es: Kenia de 27 años de edad es madre soltera y vive junto a sus dos hijos pequeños uno de 3 años y el más pequeño de 4 meses de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que cada día se esfuerza por salir adelante, por lo que desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida apoyada en su trabajo en una empresa cercana. Kenia siempre buscando lo mejor para su familia ha decidido construir un techo en el corredor de su vivienda, ya que actualmente no cuenta con este como se observa en la fotografía, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: madera, tejas, clavos y barra de castilla para construir el techo del corredor de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Kenia is a 27 year old single mother. She lives with her two small children. One is 3 years old and the other is only 4 months old. She is a working mother who every day makes an effort to get ahead. For this reason she has earned her living through her work in a nearby company.

Kenia is always looking for the best for her family and has decided to construct a roof over the veranda of her house as currently it does not have a roof as you can see in the photograph. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in wood, tiles, posts and nails to construct the roof on her veranda as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in wood, tiles, nails and posts to construct the roof of the veranda at her house.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old, married, and has six children. She sells mangoes at a fruit stand.  

Rosalie requested a loan, which she will use to purchase more mangoes to sell so that she generate more income. She needs to increase her income to pay for her children's education needs. Rosalie plans to have her own fruit stand with a variety of fruits besides mangoes.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Doña Maria de 64 años de edad vive con sus dos nietos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de huevos su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene 18 años e inicio con las ventas a causa del desempleo, con las ganancias que obtiene logar solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas cartones con huevos por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a sus nietos una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Maria is 64 years old and lives with her two grandchildren in her own house. She works selling eggs. Her business is located at her place of residence. She has 18 years of experience and started as she was unemployed. With her profits she manages to pay the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more flats of eggs wholesale and make greater profit to be able to provide her grandchildren with more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more flats of eggs wholesale.

loans.name: Mirna Lorena

texts.es: Mirna vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y comida desde hace aproximadamente 8 años, gracias a su trabajo es como puede salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, aceite entre otros ingredientes que necesita para elaborar las pupusas y asi poder seguir con sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Mirna lives in her own house with her family. She has been working selling pupusas and meals for approximately eight years. Thanks to her work she can get ahead with the expenses that occur in her house. She is requesting a loan to buy corn, cheese, pork cracklings, beans and oil amongst other ingredients that she needs to prepare her pupusas and thus be able to continue with her sales and obtain greater profit.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, pork cracklings, beans and oil amongst other ingredients.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza, 50, is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Elegaio, her business partner, and they already have a grandchild.  She manages her household while operating the grocery business. She works hard to earn income to support and meet her family's daily personal, household needs. 

Esperanza operates a general store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small business that sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling retail by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 700 a day. 

To help her continue operation of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan to buy grocery items such as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, and soda. She is positive that expanding her inventory will boost her income. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Esperanza hopes to maintain and grow her business. She prays that God will continue to bless and guide her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 57 years old, widowed and has three children who are grown and married. Rosalina wanted to earn income for her family's needs so she started a fruit-vending business five years ago. For her, this business is profitable because she earns monthly income of PHP 2,000 that helps meet heir daily needs. She wants to increase her income to sustain the needs of her family. She decided to take out a loan to buy more mangoes to sell and more sales will generate more income.
Rosalina's plan for the future is to save money from her business.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Consuelo Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Consuelo de 69 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 40 años vende de lunes a domingo, su negocio esta cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como puede salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como pollo, verduras, carnes, arroz, frijoles, fruta, refrescos, mariscos, entre otras cosas y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Consuelo is 69 years old. She lives in her own home with her son. She has sold food for 40 years, selling from Monday to Sunday. Her business is near her home in a very busy area. With what she earns, she can make progress. She is requesting a loan to purchase basic materials like chicken, vegetables, meat, rice, beans, fruit, soft drinks, seafood and other items. She can continue with her work which generates good earnings.

loans.use: purchase basic materials like chicken, vegetables, meat, rice, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is from Badian, Cebu. She is 59 years old and married. Like most residents of Cebu, Josefina has kept a barn near her house for a hog-raising business. This has been her livelihood for two decades now. She is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy feed and piglets. Josefina usually earns profit of 5,000 PHP per month. She hopes to increase her income as a result of this loan. She dreams of making expansions in the year to come for a bigger return on investment.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Ursecia

texts.en:
Ursecia is a resident of the town of Antequera, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 5 and 7. Her husband is a carpenter. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic household commodities like sugar, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, assorted canned goods and soft drinks.

Ursecia is asking for a loan to buy supplies  like groceries, drinks, dried fish and fruits. These will provide additional stock for her store and attract more customers. Thus, her income will improve and eventually she will be able to handle her finances and settle her obligations.

She is hopeful that she will sustain her business to continue supporting the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy supplies like groceries, drinks, dried fish and fruits

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es: Rosa de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace mas de 10 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza y con la ayuda de su esposo pueden cubrir algunos de los gastos del hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder seguir con su venta de tortillas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her three children. She has worked selling tortillas for more than 10 years. Her business is located in her place of residence. With her sales and the help of her husband she is able to cover some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime to be able to continue with her tortilla sales and thus have greater income for a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria wants to provide for her three children's needs. She is engaged in a transport business with her husband, who drives a motorcycle. She and her husband aim to give their children a better life so they need to increase their family's income. Victoria decided to take out a loan to purchase spare parts to repair her husband's motorcycle so he would able to continue to serve more passengers and earn more income.

Victoria wants to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for repairing her husband's motorcycle.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is grateful that she was granted a PHP 15,000 loan to pay for personal products to sell. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs. Nerissa was able to add other essential food items to sell.

She would like to apply for another PHP 15,000 loan to buy ingredients such as peanuts, oil, coconut, and sugar to make her peanut butter, other ingredients to prepare her "atsara" (a pickled appetizer made from grated green papaya) and frozen food. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Nerissa believes that with her hard work, her business will grow and prosper. She hopes to be able to save for old age. She prays for a long and victorious life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies 

. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: To pay for ingredients to make peanut butter, "atsara" (pickled appetizer) and frozen foods to sell .

loans.name: Zaiba

texts.en:
Zaiba is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for 12 years. Her husband is responsible for meeting the financial needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to pay for maintenance of his taxi. The current condition of his taxi is not good so it requires more and more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient funds, her husband is unable to pay for the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Zaiba has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help from this loan, Zaiba's husband can afford the maintenance costs. Then he could provide better transport services to earn a more profitable income. Zaiba also plans to save some of the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.
Zaiba is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to repair his taxi

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 42 years old and a mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing household expenses.
Zubaida's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit for reselling so he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. Due to unfavorable financial circumstances, her husband is not in a position to purchase more fruit.
Therefore Zubaida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. Then she could help her husband  purchase the fruit. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Tahminahon

texts.en: Tahminahon is a hard-working woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1981. She is living in a small town with her family. She is divorced and has one child. She is a waitress who works at wedding receptions to earn money to feed her family. After her husband was jailed, they divorced and now she lives with her parents. Her salary goes toward meeting her family's needs, such as food and clothing. She is planning to repair her house and live in better conditions. She asked for help from IMON, requesting a loan to pay construction workers. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and to live better.

loans.use: to pay construction workers to repair her house.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan to pay for ingredients to make her peanut butter to sell. Through her earnings she has been able to send her child to elementary school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to pay for peanuts, sugar, oil, sacks of rice and electronic loads to sell at her small general store. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Aside from her small store she is also a fish vendor. Her earnings help to sustain her family's basic needs and pay for the education of her child. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Jessa dreams of becoming a big-time rice retailer in her town. She prays that her child will grow to be a God-fearing person.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for sacks of rice, ingredients for peanut butter, and electronic load to resell at her small general store.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is married with six children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc-Project Dungganon. Diana supports the family through her pig fattening and farming rice business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her son Dave who 20 years old and is 4th of 6 children in the family, who is studying Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education and is currently in the 4th of this 4-year course.

Diana is borrowing PHP 12000 to pay for tuition fees of her son Dave for the Second Semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Dave plans when he graduate to help his parents earn an income to send his brother and sister in college.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Teodoro David

texts.es:
David es un joven de 19 años, nacido en la ciudad de Latacunga, es soltero y vive en casa de los padres, gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio de los padres David pudo terminar sus estudios y por el bajo recurso económico que viven desde hace varios años se ve obligado a trabajar para poder ayudar en los gastos del hogar. 
El mayor obstáculo en su vida ha sido no poder concluir sus estudios ya que solo terminó la primaria lo que le impide encontrar un trabajo estable. Tiene su negocio propio que se trata de un criadero de cerdos, un trabajo muy sacrificado ya que el debe mantener muy bien cuidados a los animales y alimentarlos ya que son muchos. Lamentablemente este es un trabajo inestable porque no todos los días puede vender la misma cantidad de cerdos. 
Solicita un préstamo para así poder adquirir  alimento para sus animales  y tener más ventas. David agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
David is a youth, 19-years-old, born in the city of Latacunga. He is single and lives in his parents' house. Thanks to the efforts and sacrifice of his parents, David was able to finish his studies. Due to the shortage of economic resources he suffered for various years, David was obliged to work to help his parents with their expenses at home. 

The major obstacle in his life has been his inability to complete his studies. He only completed primary school, which has prevented him from finding stable work.

David has his own business raising pigs, work that requires much sacrifice. He has to sustain very good care of the animals and provide them with feed, since there are so many. Sadly, the work is unstable, because he couldn't sell the same number of pigs every day. 

David is requesting a loan to be able to acquire animal feed and to increase sales. David wishes to thank Fundacion Alternative en Ecuador, and to Kiva for making possible growth in his work and personal life.

loans.use: to acquire feed for his animals.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 48 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children, three of whom are now of adult age, while  four are still of school age. Wilma is engaged in a food supplement business and is an elected Barangay official in the community. She earns approximately Php 18,000 each month from her business and honorarium. 

Wilma became a member of PMPC one year ago. She has requested a loan to purchase inventories of food supplement to sell. In the future, she hopes to be a major owner of a food supplement dealership business.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of food supplement to sell

loans.name: Silolo

texts.en: Silolo is a 61-year-old widow woman with 7 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 4 years of experience with this business. Silolo needs a loan to buy bags of flour, yeast, cooking oil, a gas oven, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies. Silolo has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, yeast, cooking oil, a gas oven, etc.

loans.name: Duffy

texts.en: Duffy is a 34-year-old married woman with 2 children. She makes and sells pies, coconut buns, and pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Duffy needs a loan to buy cooking oil, a gas oven, pots and pans, containers, bags of flour, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family. Duffy has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, a gas oven, pots and pans, containers, bags of flour, etc.

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is heading into the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much-needed land and seed-bed preparations. She wants to have a large enough supply of rice fertilizer and herbicides. She also needs a new knapsack sprayer, so she has applied for a loan from the cooperative. 

Gema hopes to save enough to purchase a rice thresher to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase rice fertilizer and herbicides and to pay for a new knapsack sprayer

loans.name: Jose Amadeo

texts.es: Don Jose de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de medicina popular desde hace 7 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de su producto, con las ventas que realiza es como ha podido sacar adelante a su familia el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina popular por mayor para tener surtido su negocio y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Jose is 59 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He has made a living by selling over-the-counter medications for the past 7 years. His business is located in his residence, and he has many customers due to the quality of his product. With the sales he gets he has managed to support his family and get ahead.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of more over-the-counter medications at wholesale so that his business can be well-stocked, and by doing so, have a better income, and to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more over-the-counter medications at wholesale.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “RETO AL FUTURO”.

El  socio es el  Sr. Claudio; el socio continua con el negocio de compra y venta de repuestos  y a la vez brinda servicio técnico de electrodomésticos, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
 El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de alicates entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the RETO AL FUTURO communal bank.

 His name is Claudio. He is continuing with his business of  buying and selling spare parts. At the same time, he also services household appliances. The member is a responsible and persevering person. He wants to continue working since this allows him to continue supporting his family. The member is grateful and values the loan approved by Kiva. He promises to make the payments on time. 
He is requesting a loan to purchase pliers and other items.

loans.use: purchase pliers and other items.

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri is a young and enterprising woman of 28 years from a small village in the district of Alipurduar. She is married and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters); two of them are studying in grade 5 and grade 1; the other is an infant. She and her husband, Atul, both attended school up to grade 5 and had to give up their education because of their families' poor economy. Her husband, Atul, is a car driver by profession.

Sabitri has been practicing cattle farming for many years to give sustenance to her family through dairy. She finds this business enjoyable and profitable. She rears dairy cows and supplies milk from door to door in her neighborhood. She also sells cattle by-products like cow dung for additional income. In order to increase her business and satisfy her customers’ demand, she needs to purchase one more cow, but the biggest challenge she faces is limited funds.

Sabitri is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy a dairy cow. It will produce enough milk to enable her to supply more milk and satisfy her customers’ demand; thus she hopes to earn more profit.

She dreams to purchase land in the future with the profit from this business. She wishes to provide higher education to her children.

She gives her heartiest thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Ai

texts.en:
Ai is a divorced woman of 35 years old with three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily consumption goods such as sugar, salt, snacks, freezers and more. She has been doing this for more than five years. 

Ai needs a loan to buy timber, iron roofs, bricks, and cement to expand her store and also to buy a variety of stocks. She hopes to use her profits to start a new business and to save for unexpected emergencies. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy timber, iron roofs, bricks, cement, a cooler, a freezer, toiletries, etc

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Don Victor de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de medicina popular de manera ambulante por los pueblos aledaños, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de medicinas y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como puede solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la  y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Victor is fifty-four years old, he lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He sells popular medicines at a mobile stand in nearby towns. He has been selling medicines for five years, and with his earnings he can pay some of his household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy more medicines so he can increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more popular medicines at wholesale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with four adult-age children. She is good at doing her farming activities and has had this business for more than a decade. 

To prepare for the next cropping season, she requested a loan to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce and pay for land and seedbed preparation. She recently became a member of Paglaum MPC. 

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to venture into a new business to have more income for her family

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce and pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
Ediltrudes is engaged in selling homemade meals like stewed vegetables, fish soup, fried chicken, and other native menus. She lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is a 48-year-old single woman. Aside from that, she also engages in a fish vending business. She sells fresh fish and seashells to augment her income.

She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of fresh fish, seashells, big foam (storage), and ice. These are very useful in augmenting her fish vending business. She will purchase more stock and sell it to the locals in her place. Thus, she will be able to set aside some savings and start to expand her business.

Ediltrudes dreams that her both her livelihoods will be successful.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fresh fish, sea shells, big foam (storage), and other materials.

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna is a 44-year-old widowed lady and a mother of two sons. She lost her husband a few years back. Her sons work as laborers on a daily wages basis. They live in Alipurduar district of West Bengal.

Ratna belongs to a community where the people belong to the under-privileged category and earn their living by agriculture, animal husbandry and stitching. Ratna has been engaged with a sewing work business for many years. She is the main source of income for her family and has to struggle a lot to cover the household expenses. She stitches men’s and women’s attire and sells them to her neighbors, who are her main clients.

Now she needs to expand her business to cope with the price hike of essential commodities. But due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase a new machine.

She heard about Kiva’s partner BJS and has taken a loan from them to purchase a modern sewing machine, which will be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

She wants to grow her sewing work business in the upcoming days. Ratna is thankful to her lenders (Kiva and BJS).

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her sewing work business.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is 48 years old and a partner with four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy corn flour, a gas oven, yeast, cooking oil, a bag of flour, etc.

In the future, Amanda hopes to extend her business by baking cakes. She joined SPBD in April 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, a gas oven, yeast, cooking oil, a bag of flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corrugated metal sheets, wood, nails, and wire so she can change the roof in the hallway of her home.

loans.name: Pablo De Jesus

texts.es: Pablo de 45 años de edad viven casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la confección de ropa desde tiene 15 años de experiencia en esa actividad, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Pablo is 45 years old.  He lives in his own home with his family.  He has worked at making clothing for 15 years.  His workshop is in his home and he has many customers due to the quality of his work.  With his earnings he is able to cover some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastics, etc. so that he will be able to continue with his work which generates a good income.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastics etc.

loans.name: Maria Filomena

texts.es: Doña Maria de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de carne y chicharrón desde hace mas de 25 años, vende de manera ambulante en los alrededores de la zona, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas carne y chicharrón ya que  esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter. She has been working selling meat and pork rinds for over 25 years. She works as a street vendor throughout nearby areas, and her sales allow her to  cover some of her household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more meat and pork rinds, because this is her only source of work and income.

loans.use: to buy more meat and pork rinds.

loans.name: Nozukoi

texts.en:
Nozukoi is a careful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1962. She is living with her family in a small town. She is married and has one child. She has worked at a medical clinic as a senior nurse for almost ten years. She has only one child and takes care of him.

She wants to ensure that her son is educated in order to have good work and become a well specialist. Her son graduated from high school and entered university to get a higher education. She is proud that her son is doing well in university and studies actively in classes.
