She is asking for financial support from Kiva and IMON to pay for her son’s education. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes makes good earnings on her rice farm in Liloan, Boniafcio. This is the primary means of their income, supporting their needs. 

She wants to increase her farm yield, so Agnes approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase fertilizer and compost and higher-yielding rice seedlings on her farm. She has high hopes that she will have good produce next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost and higher-yielding rice seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RETO AL FUTURO”.
La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de fabricación y venta de velas, la socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua elaborando las velas para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de parafina entre otros.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the communal bank "RETO AL FUTURO." She makes and sells candles, and she is grateful for and appreciates the loan provided through this avenue, and promises to meet the payment terms in the established time frame. Elizabeth is a very responsible, hard-working person, and she continues making candles for all her customers who want for them. She would like to continue working so she can support her family in this way. 
Elizabeth is seeking a loan to buy wax and other materials.

loans.use: to buy wax and other materials.

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie used her previous loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase various grocery products needed in her general store. With her earnings, she was able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

Richie is requesting another loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items such as rice, canned goods, soda, rice noodles,and  frozen foods. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger general store.

Every week, Richie meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from God.

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Soe

texts.en: Soe is a 37-year-old divorced woman with one child. She makes and sells pies and pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Soe needs a loan to buy a gas oven, bags of flour, yeast, cooking oil, containers, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family financially. Soe has been a member of SPBD since April this year 2015.

loans.use: to buy a gas oven, bags of flour, yeast, cooking oil, containers, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón asadas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 18 años y ya tiene clientes fijos que lo prefieren por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios,  con las ventas que realiza es como a podido salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar más semillas de marañón por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is 65 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She works selling roast cashew seeds. She has been in this business for eighteen years and already has a regular customer base that prefers her for the quality of her product and her good prices. Her sales are what have allowed her to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy more wholesale cashew seeds, so that she can keep working and have a better quality of life alongside her family.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale cashew seeds.

loans.name: Rotifa

texts.en: Rotifa is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1964. She is living in a small town where doing business by selling dried fruits is best common. She is married and has two children. She has nine years of experience doing business. She is disabled; nevertheless she works in order to feed her family. She works at a candy maker's as an accountant. She earns only 600 TJS monthly. Her salary is not enough to renovate her house. She hopes to have a good condition to live and ensure her children with necessary things. She appealed to IMON and asked financial support to repair of her house. She awaits KIVA lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Judit

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RETO AL FUTURO”.
La socia es la Sra. Judit; La socia  continua con su  negocio de brindar servicio técnico para todo tipo de electrodomesticos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua trabajando  conjuntamente con su esposo en este negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de alicates entre otros.
texts.en: The member belongs to the “RETO AL FUTURO” communal bank.  The member is Judit and she continues to work with her husband in their business. They offer technical services for all types of appliances. The member is a responsible and persevering person and continues to work in the business with her husband. This is how she supports her family. The member requests the loan to buy pliers, among others items.

loans.use: to buy pliers, among other items.

loans.name: Malevi

texts.en:
Malevi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana is a hardworking young woman of only 18 years, married to Sahidul. She studied up to grade 8; then she could not continue her studies due to her parents’ poor economic resources. Then she got married. She lives in a small village of Falakata in West Bengal, India with her family.

Sultana's husband, aged only 29 years, is a trader of betel nuts (a kind of mouth freshener used in rural areas of India). Sultana is a housewife and at the same time helps her husband in this business. They are running this business successfully. They purchase raw betel nuts from their own villagers and from the neighboring villages and sell in the local market. It is the only source of income for their family. To give the family wellbeing, they need to expand their existing business, but they don't have much capital to invest in their business.

Thus, Sultana has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, which gives business loans to rural needy women. She wants to purchase more betel nuts with the loan. Her dream is to enhance the business. In this way, she will obtain a greater income that will enable her family to get ahead and provide a greater opportunity for life so that they can be established in the future.

Sultana is grateful to both Kiva and BJS for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase more betel nuts for her existing business.

loans.name: Mwasefu

texts.en:
Mwasefu is a married mother of two children, botth of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 30,000 loan,  she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es: Rosa de 59 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su hija quien trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, ella posee desde hace varios años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, la cual la inicio con capital propio, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter who works and helps her with household expenses. She has had a small store located in her place of residence for many years, which she started with her own capital. 

She has many good clients and is asking for a loan in order to be able to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc. so that she will be able to have more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Guillermo

texts.es: Jorge de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 8 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito ya que necesita comprar las herramientas necesarias para continuar con su trabajo como: trasmallos, redes y darle mantenimiento a la lancha que muestra en la fotografía ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y de ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 48 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has been working in artisan or traditional fishing for eight years. He sells his catch throughout the surrounding areas and the sales he makes allow him to cover some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan because he needs to buy the tools he requires in order to keep working, such as trammels and nets. He also needs to service his boat, which is shown in the picture and represents his only source of work and income.

loans.use: to buy trammels and nets and service his boat.

loans.name: Shielamie

texts.en:
Shielamie is 36 years old. She is married with 5 children and lives in Liloan, Bonifacio. 

Shielamie and her husband manage their rice farm to earn their living. She is also engaged in a palay trading and rice retail business to help support their needs. 

Shielamie joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in March of 2011. She is a hardworking and determined mother who pursues her goals for the benefit of her family. 

Shielamie has requested a loan to purchase both fertilizer to increase her farm's production and bags of rice to resell. This will help her earn more income and provide her children with a good and decent life.

loans.use: to purchase both fertilizer to increase her rice farm's production and bags of rice for retail.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.en:
Surayo is a kind woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1966. She is living alone with her children. Her husband died, and she is used to working and raising her children alone. She has three children.

She is a teacher at a secondary school and teaches literature and Tajik language to students. She has 30 years of experience working as a teacher. She is well known among friends and teachers. She likes her duty and teaches with pleasure.

She appealed to IMON, asking for financial support to pay for her son’s higher education. She hopes to be supported. She is willing to ensure and raise her children and ensure they will get an education.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s higher education.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twenty years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 100,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan, she also wants to establish a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Nele

texts.en:
Nele is a 38-year-old woman who is single with three children. She has a small business, selling elei (hand-printed fabric) and clothes. She has three years with this business.

Nele needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, thread, scissors, material, and colour paint. She will use her profits to support her family and her children's education.

Nele joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, thread, scissors, material, colour paint, etc.

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Carmen de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica al cultivo de loro desde hace 5 años, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, gracias a su trabajo es como puede salir delante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y controles de plagas para tener una buena cosecha y asi poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen is 52 years old and lives in her  own home with her family. For the past five years, she has been working growing loroco, a vine with edible flowers commonly used in Central American cooking. She sells her product throughout the areas surrounding her home. Her work is what allows her to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pest control products so that she can obtain a good harvest, increase her income, and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pest control products.

loans.name: Finess Iii Group

texts.fr:
Nyele est la femme au milieu tenant entre sa main droite l’assiette  contenant le riz.
Nyele est une malienne âgée de 40 ans, mère de 06 enfants dont 05 sont scolarisés et 01 non scolarisé, elle est analphabète résidant au MALI. Son mari est décédé e .Nyele n’ayant pas assez de fonds crédit pour le commercial de riz et de manioc. Elle s’approvisionne dans les foires environnantes et urbaines en sacs de riz  et manioc  et après approvisionnement, elle les revend aux comptants à des prix acceptables.  Elle a une technique de vente très rentable qui la permet de  réaliser un bénéfice prévisionnel qui varie entre 100000 à 200000fcfa par cycle de prêt. Elle  affirmant que avec ce bénéfice elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de la famille tel que : ( la santé , l’éducation ,et le revêtement) , elle a  un rêve au sujet de l’avenir c’est de réussir dans son commerce de riz et manioc.
texts.en:
Nyele is the woman in the middle holding a plate of rice in her right hand.

Nyele is from Mali, 40 years old, and a mother of six, five of whom attend school and one of whom does not. She is illiterate and lives in Mali. Her husband is deceased. Nyele doesn’t have enough money for a rice and cassava root business. She stocks up on sacks of rice and cassava root in surrounding urban fairs and resells them for cash at reasonable prices. She has a very profitable sales technique that allows her to earn a projected profit between 100,000 to 200,000 FCFA per loan cycle. She states that with this profit, she is able to meet the needs of her family, including: health, education, and clothing. Her dreams for the future include succeeding in the rice and cassava root business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and cassava root to resell

loans.name: Lemau

texts.en:
Lemau is a 37-year-old woman who is single with four children. She runs a business selling kids’ suits, elei puletasi (hand-printed fabric dresses), etc. in her community. She has two years of experience with this business.

Lemau has requested a loan to buy materials, a sewing machine, scissors, thread, a stitch unpicker, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business.

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, a stitch unpicker, thread, scissors, a sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a married man with one child, who is still young and attends school. He lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water.

Edwin has been operating his retail shop business for the past one-and-a-half years, selling household consumables such as wheat and maize flours and sugar. He faces a major challenge of having creditors to repay over a long period for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan Edwin is requesting, he wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, and maize and wheat flours. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, and maize and wheat flours.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase candy, soft drinks, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de yinas (sandalias) su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia en un zona muy transitada, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con sus abuelos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas variedad de yinas (sandalias) por mayor para poder surtir su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
The young woman above whose face is obscured is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. She sells sandals. Her business is located in her place of residence in a much-traveled zone.

With the earnings she obtains, she manages to advance. This young woman lives in her own house with her grandparents. 

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy a larger variety of sandals at wholesale, in order to supply her business. She needs to do so because the business is her only source of work.

loans.use: purchase a greater variety of sandals at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Salvador Ovidio

texts.es: Salvador de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene 22 años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, el está el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Salvador, 42 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and daughter. He has a metal shop and makes doors, balconies, bars, and other things. He has been in this business for 22 years and has a lot of experience, which helps him improve his work everyday. With what he earns from his work, he is able to move ahead with household expenses.

He is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy iron, metal, tools, etc., and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Richard Ernesto

texts.en:
The member belongs to the LAS MERCEDES DE KATAÑIRAY community bank. The member, Richard, continues to make a living providing taxi service. He is a responsible and diligent man. He would like to continue working in order to continue supporting his family in this way.

Richard is applying for a loan in order to do maintenance work on his car. He is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Djeneba's Group

texts.fr: Djeneba qui se trouve sur la photo assise  à droite , est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Diensobala au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Djeneba, âgée de 56 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 10 à 39 ans, et dont l'1 d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Djeneba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 56 ans. Djeneba cultive l'arachide,le riz, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Djeneba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Djeneba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Djeneba cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Djeneba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage , cultiver plus d’ arachide, riz et d'étendre la surface cultivée . Enfin Djeneba espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en: Djeneba, seated to the right in the photo, is a member of a group of 11 farmers signed up with myAgro, living and working in the village of Diensobala in the southwest of Bamako in Mali. Djeneba, 56, is the mother of six, ages 10-39, one of whom currently attends school. The roots of her family tradition in farming, a principal source of income and the family’s self-sufficiency in food, but also what allows her to ensure the self-sufficiency of her own family, incited Djeneba to work in this business for 56 years. Djeneba grows peanuts and rice and does truck farming on her land but must also face the challenges of farmers, such as lack of rain and farming materials. Djeneba is kicking off her first year with myAgro, and signed up in order to increase her yield with myAgro’s proposed services. This year, Djeneba is making payments to buy a myAgro packet of OPV seed and fertilizer to farm peanuts in order to augment her yield on her .0625 hectare of land. Djeneba has been cultivating peanuts for 20 years for its food-producing value, explaining that peanuts are directly consumable by the family and is used as a base sauce in food. Djeneba plans to augment her yield and her income by farming and growing more peanuts and rice and extending her farmable land. Finally, Djeneba also hopes to be able to cover her children’s school fees and also ensuring self-sufficiency in food for her family.

loans.use: to obtain a packet of OPV seed and fertilizer to farm peanuts

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de lubricantes para vehículos y repuestos para motos y bicicletas, tiene 1 año de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual le genera buenos ingresos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 41 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner. She makes her living selling motor oil and spare parts for motorcycles and bicycles. She has been in this business for 1 year, and is making good money from it.

She is applying for a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale to be able to continue with her sales and have a better quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy motor oil and spare parts for motorcycles and bicycles.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
La socia al banco comunal LAS MERCEDES DE KATAÑIRAY.
La socia sigue dedicándose  a su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas  para su negocio.
texts.en:
Zonia belongs to the LAS MERCEDES DE KATAÑIRAY community bank. She continues to make her living in the clothing sales business. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

She is a responsible and diligent person, which is how she gets her family ahead. She is applying for a loan to buy sweaters for her business.

loans.use: to buy sweaters for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de comida y pupusas desde hace 3 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como puede salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como pollo, verduras, carnes, arroz, frijoles, fruta, refrescos, mariscos, entre otras cosas y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is blurred because she is 26 years old and lives in a high-risk zone has been selling food and pupusas [a traditional Salvadorean stuffed tortilla] for three years. Her business is located in her place of residence and with what she earns from her sales she is able to get ahead. The young woman lives in her own house with her family. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase raw materials such as chicken, vegetables, meats, rice, beans, fruit, soft drinks and seafood, among other things, so that she will be able to continue her work, which generates good income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as chicken, vegetables, meats, rice, beans, fruit, soft drinks and seafood, among other things.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 52-year-old woman from Panglao, Bohol. She is a married woman with five children. Her youngest child is 14. She sells homemade meals like boiled eggplant with coconut milk and spices, fried fish, stewed vegetables and many others. Her husband earns a living by being a carpenter.

Elizabeth has requested a loan in the amount of 27,000 PHP to buy additional tupperware for storage and supplies like vegetables, fish meat and seasonings. With these, she will be able to prepare a variety of meals and sell them to the locals in her place. Thus, she could now provide for the needs of her children and be able to pay her obligations.

She hopes that she will be handling both of her sources of income successfully for the improvement of the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional tupperware for storage and supplies like vegetables, fish meat and seasonings.

loans.name: Liga

texts.en: Liga is a 48-year-old single woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbage, tomatoes and cucumbers to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Liga has requested a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, a weed sprayer, rakes, etc. She has become a member of SBPD this year. With her profits, Liga hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a weed sprayer, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia Idalia

texts.es: Cecilia de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y ya tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual la inicio a causa del desempleo, con las ventas que realiza es como logra solventar algunos de los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal y asi poder generar mejores ingresos y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Cecilia is 41 and lives in her own house with her family. She makes a living selling tortillas and her business is located in her house. She has made a living this way for 10 years after starting as a result of unemployment. With her sales she is able to pay some of her household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to buy 100 lb. units of corn and lime to improve her income and have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy 100 lb. units of corn and lime.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Don Juan de 62 años de edad vive en  casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee una molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años, posee muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas ya que ahí llegan a moler el maíz,  con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, el solicita un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y así tener mejores ingresos para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Juan is 62 years old and lives in his own home with his family, he has had a corn mill located on his property  for the last two years. Juan has many customers, especially the women who make tortillas and come to grind their corn. 

With what Juan earns from this work, he is able to cover some of the household costs. Juan needs this loan to buy the necessary spare parts for the mill, such as discs, belts, blades, etc. As a result Juan will be able to increase his earnings and have, along with his family, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy belts, discs, blades, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks for sale

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He has operated an m-pesa business for the past 15 years, serving the people in the community. He mentioned theft as the major challenge in his place of operation.

With the loan that he is requesting he wants to add float to his m-pesa business. He decided to join Yehu to get access to the loan and boost his business.

loans.use: to add float to his m-pesa business.

loans.name: Erik Geronimo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LAS MERCEDES DE KATAÑIRAY.
El socio Erik alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  a su trabajo de mecanico,el socio lleva buen tiempo en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the LAS MERCEDES DE KATAÑIRAY communal bank. Erik work as a mechanic, and has been in his business for sometime. It is going well thanks to the effort he puts into it each day. He is a responsible and  hard-working person. 


He wishes to be able to continue working so that in this way he can continue supporting his family. The member is requesting a loan in order to buy tools and other items. He feels grateful for the loan granted, and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: To buy tools and other items.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina sells grocery items from her home to earn a living. She has operated her business for three months. She also engages in crop farming to earn additional income. She and her husband work hard together to sustain their family's basic needs.

Josefina would like to increase the quantity and variety of grocery goods she offers in her store, but she has insufficient capital for this investment. She is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000.

Josefina is excited about her loan and is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy a stock of grocery items for her retail store
